title: I will stay here again!
text: I did a lot of research before picking a hotel to stay in NYC. During that research I discovered his hotel had the highest volume of great reviews. After staying there myself, I can confirm this hotel is the place to stay in NYC! The location is practical with a subway station right around the corner. If you have any questions there's always a concierge in the lobby to guide you. In our case, Daniel and Cristian were wonderful. They let us know that they can schedule a driver to pick us up and take us to the airport (which I will take advantage of next time!) At the time the price was the same if not a bit less for the driver compared to your Lyft or Uber service. The rooms were cleaned daily (with water and snacks restocked) and at night it was quiet. Will be staying here again !

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: Absolutely fabulous hotel, wonderfully comfortable king size bed, lovely cotton sheets and pillows on a well made bed, no ill fitting sheets or duvets here!  For a small room there was ample, well thought out storage with 4 large pull out drawers under tour king size bed.  The room contained a mini fridge, espresso coffee machine, large TV and small hand held steam iron. There were a couple of packets of complimentary crisps, biscuits and water which was a nice touch.  There was a privacy light on the door if you did not require room service.  We had them freshen the room half way through our stay, when we returned, they had thoroughly cleaned through and changed all the bedding.  The room was spotless. Bathroom quite big with huge shower and good water pressure.  We were in room 1705 which was quite high up and at the back of the hotel, really surprised as to how quiet it was considering we were in the middle of NY city, no noise from adjoining rooms either. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful and so welcoming.  When you step outside the door the area is a little off putting but to to be honest it felt extremely safe.  There is an Irish bar across the street if you arrive late and are wanting a quick meal or a drink.  Just around the corner there is a “Pret A Manger” with an eating area for breakfast items such as lovely almond croissants or warm savoury items and good coffee to start you off on your day.  This is classed as the financial district and very close to the 9/11 site and not far from battery park where you get the ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis island.  We were a little worried about the subway but there has been a massive change around here since we were here last, everywhere felt much safer and cleaner even though a lot of buildings seemed to be covered in scaffolding for some reason. We did not find lots of restaurants in the immediate area but a 5-10 minute walk took you to plenty.  Could not recommend this hotel highly enough. After a hard day trekking the city, so nice to have a homey haven to come back to, wonderful shower and amazing bed for a well earned good nights sleep.

title: Excellent hotel in downtown New York
text:
Just returned from 7 nights at the Artezen Hotel.
What a great hotel, would highly recommend especially if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the Time Square area.
We had a room at the back of the hotel so no views however we weren’t bothered by this and the room was very quiet. Beds were super comfy and the room had a small fridge, coffee machine, 3 bottles of water provided every day and toiletries in the bathroom.
Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar very nice and service great.
The hotel is in a good spot in the downtown area, 5 minutes from 9/11, 10minutes from Hudson River in one direction and same from South St Seaport on East River. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the streets around the hotel and a Pret 5 minutes away for breakfast.
There is a subway a few hundred yards away.
We wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again if we return to New York.

title: Absolutely brilliant hotel close to wall street.
text:
We have stayed in NY several times, mostly near Times Square and thought this time we would venture off the usual tourist track. 
We stumbled across the Artezen hotel in the financial district, not far from Wall Street. As we do with most trips we read the really bad reviews on TA to see what we might be letting ourselves in for. The Hotel is not huge as are the rooms. When we checked in the Tea, coffee and water arrangements in the room were clearly described to us and what would and wouldn’t be replaced.   We were allocated a room on the second floor at the front of the hotel, which was very near street level with the noise and smells associated with it. However, unlike other comments there was almost no street level noise to be heard, and while there were some interesting smells around the area the hotel smelt wonderful being scented with a lovely fragrance, so top marks there. The room its self was clean, and  bed comfy. There were charges for phones and everything you would expect. We almost immediately headed for the recently added roof top bar and while it is not tall enough to have any outstanding views over the city it is a great place to relax and imbibe a few cocktails. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful without exception whenever we meet them. 

The location is excellent. Being in easy walking distance to lower Manhattan and the One World Trade Center or south street sea port or battery park, also as virtually all the subway lines converge around wall street it was usually only a minute or two to walk to any station (usually the various entrances to Fulton Street) to get virtually anywhere in Manhattan which makes getting around very easy. The Bars and clubs in Stone Street are an easy stroll away as are Fraunces Tavern and the Dead Rabbit, both of which are worth a visit.  On the flip side on a Sunday in the financial district we walked all day and didn’t see a yellow Taxi cab once, so if you like to travel by cab and not subway you may be disappointed. 

So if your tired of Times Square and fancy something different The Artezen could be just the ticket, as long as you like to ride the subway!

title: A great financial district GEM
text:
I have been to NYC many times and never stayed in the Financial District before, so was a bit skeptical about this area of the city as I didn't know how much would be around. I tacked a weekend on for pleasure and ended up really enjoying the location. You are literally a 30 second walk to Fulton subway stop and a 4 minute walk to the WTC which connects you pretty much anywhere you want to go in the city underground, so ended up being conveniently located. 

The hotel itself was lovely. The room sizes (we stayed in a deluxe King) were good by NYC standards. The linens were nice and the bathrooms were also nicely sized. The room ended up being very comfortable for multiple nights. My only one recommendation would be to add a coat hook or two on the wall. I was here in cold and bad weather and it would've been nice to have somewhere to hang my coat over than throwing it over the chair.

The staff were super friendly and could not do enough for me, holding doors open and elevators at any chance. The front desk staff were wonderful and professional.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. If I have to return for work again, I will absolutely stay here.

Thank you for the great stay.

title: Fantastic boutique hotel on a quiet street.
text: This is a great hotel and very convenient to the Fulton subway station. In walking distance to 9/11 memorial. Nice to have some good restaurants on the same street or within blocks. title: $16 a day for two creamers,
text:
I travel extensively and live a large part of my life in hotels , so I feel I am in a position to judge standards of hotels. Unfortunately I was very disappointed with this hotel , despite all the good reviews on here, the management has got to learn how to deal with customers complaints . I paid over $300 per night for the room without breakfast and in addition there is a resort fee, which is effectively a tax and another way the hotel makes money out of their customers. When we arrived at reception the receptionist explained the resort fee to me and stated that this was for coffees, teas, and water in the room as well as Internet and the Spa?. In the room there was only 2 small tea bags and two creamers so I requested more which they obliged. Next day i  requested some more creamers as two was not enough. The receptionist said that they would bring some to the room. After 45 mins i phoned back down and inquired where the creamers were as we wanted a cup of tea after walking around NY all day, only to be told that housekeeping had stated that each room was only allowed 2 creamers a day and we already had that so therefore we were not allowed any more, i assumed they were joking , but was told this is the rules. I confirmed , that the resort fee of $16 covers this and they stated it did , however you are only allowed 2 creamers a day , despite them not replenishing the water( which is also included in the resort fee) that day . I expressed my disappointment and they told me the manager would contact me. Pete the manager phoned me and explained that he had spoken to Housekeeping and these are the rules and you are only allowed 2 creamers a day per room.I confirmed with him , that the resort fees are for these amenities and he agreed but made a big statement how the Internet (which in almost every other hotel in the world is free) is also covered by this resort fee. He agreed on this occasion that he would allowed 5 creamers ( but only delivered 4) but from the next day onward we would only be allowed 2 creamers per day. I find this pathetic and bad management , and shows the hotels attitude of squeezing money out of their customers, and customers feelings doesn't matter .
I would have dropped my rating even lower but Daniel the concierge was extremely helpful.

title: Overcome by the service
text: We just arrived here yesterday so we’re just into our stay and I had to feedback the outstanding customer service we have received so far on day 1! I asked if we Avon’s switch rooms as I suffer a not from anxiety and felt the view made me claustrophobic, a quick email and they were more than happy to move us to a higher floor with a more open view, it was also my partners 50th and they offered us a compliment bottle of wine which really blew me away, we saved a lot to come here and it really made me realise it was worth it to come to this outstanding hotel. The staff are also wonderful nothing is too much at all. I’ll update more at the end of our stay xx

title: Best hotel in FiDi
text: Best hotel in FiDi! I’ve been too a few hotels downtown and the Artezen Hotel is by far the best one. The staff always treat you like family and the rooms are well kept! We always book a terrace room when possible! We hope to be back again during the new year!

title: Comfortable, welcoming and well-located
text: We booked the Artezen through a United Packages deal and I specifically chose it because of its good reviews and high rating. I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is well located in the heart of the Financial District, which was a preferred area for me having last stayed in Mid-Town (almost 20 years ago!) as I wanted to be near the ferries to Liberty/Ellis Island and Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 memorial, Pier 17, etc. It's also a good spot to get the high-rise feel, especially with the narrower streets. The room was spacious enough, clean and well appointed and the bathroom was lovely too with a large walk-in shower. The bed was VERY comfortable. The staff are all very friendly and welcoming and I would thoroughly recommend the Artezen.

title: My second visit, and just as excellent as the first time!
text:
Having first visited the Artezen Hotel in January 2020 (yes, just before Covid became a thing!), and being very impressed with it, I decided to try it again, this time with my girlfriend.  I checked the reviews before booking, and was glad to see that they were still as consistently good as they were before, and it was still good value (New York pricing considered).  My girlfriend was a little hesitant as it's location is a bit out of the centre of Manhatten, down near Wall Street, but after our stay she agreed that the location was actually excellent - it's right across the street from the subway, it's just a short walk to the Staten Island ferry (free, and a must do), and there are loads of great bars, restaurants and shops nearby.

Well, I'm pleased to say that it's as superb as before.  The customer service is excellent, the bedrooms are beautifully maintained and comfortable, and I just can't find fault with it.  We were nice and high up in the building, on the 17th floor, so our view was very good, and although we can hear the inevitable street noise from below, it had no impact on us.  The roof top garden was just being 'soft launched' to family and friends, so we missed out on that only just (despite the best efforts of the concierge, Daniel, to get us a viewing - we'll just have to visit again!).

Talking of Daniel, the concierge, he deserves a special mention.  He's very personable and kind, and was a pleasure to chat to.  He gave us plenty of great advice, and he definitely enhanced our stay.  Not that the other staff weren't excellent too, I should add!

A couple of other tips - if you want superb cocktails in a wonderful and intimate bar, go to the Parlor at the Dead Rabbit Bar (about a 10 minute walk away, but probably best to book a table).  And for great food and drinks in an awesome environment, visit the Trinity Place Bar and Restaurant (just a five minute walk away).

title: Fantástica experiencia
text:
Hermoso hotel en el corazón del Financial District, con conexiones de subte a todas partes de NYC y gran variedad de opciones para desayunar, almorzar y cenar.

Es necesario destacar la amabilidad de todo el staff del hotel (Daniel fue un genio absoluto), siempre dispuestos a dar una mano y a hacer la estadía perfecta como lo fue la nuestra.

Sin duda volveremos cuando visitemos nuevamente NYC.

Con amor desde Buenos Aires.

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel
text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel located steps from the World Trade Center.  All the subway lines are across the street making getting around the city very easy. The staff at the desk was welcoming, the housekeepers were personable and Daniel, the Concierge was a delight.  The rooms are a bit small, but it's expected in NYC. Still had room for all our luggage as we were on the road for 3 weeks. The beds are wonderful and the rooms are modern and clean.  I got a great deal on TripAdvisor Plus.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: 3.5 stars
text:
If I could give 3.5 stars I would. 

The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The beds and mattresses are high quality. Nice showers, too. And a very useful gym. Everyone I dealt with at the hotel was friendly. The price was decent for an NYC hotel (if $350 a night is ever "decent.") Location is unbeatable - we found a very good hole-in-the-wall Chinese place around the corner for hand-pulled noodles. For staples, a Whole Foods is 2 blocks away. So is the 9/11 memorial. In addition, Battery Park and Chinatown are short walks. I'd pick this location again.

So what causes me to remove 1.5 stars from my review? I realize NYC is a noisy place, and I've never stayed anywhere there that was perfectly peaceful. But our third floor room here was directly across the street from an "Irish karoke bar" that blasted music past midnight. Our first night was a Saturday and I figured, OK, Saturday night. Our second night, however, was Sunday, and once again that place violated our rest till midnight or later.

I'd stay here again, but advise others (and myself next time) to ask for a room facing away from the street or higher up in the building. Otherwise, a good pick for anyone wanting a pleasant hotel in the Wall Street area.

title: Family owned hotel with a big heart
text: We booked this hotel for a dream trip to NYC for my 35th birthday. Unfortunately we lost our son in an accident two days before the trip. Initially my credit card said the hotel would not refund our money so we emailed the hotel directly. They immediately called me and offered a full refund even though our booking was “non-refundable”. They were incredibly understanding and helpful. If and when we do come to NYC, we will absolutely stay here and nowhere else. We appreciated the personal phone call and email from the management of this hotel during this difficult time.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in FiDi
text: We spent a week at this boutique hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable with great bedding and the staff were all wonderful, friendly and responsive . Daniel & Christian were great at recommending places to go. With the Fiji water and Nepresso pods provided daily, we had what we needed to get the day started. There is plenty of storage, a mini fridge and a great shower. Although there is no bar or restaurant onsite, there are plenty of places within short walking distance. I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Nice NYC Hotel
text: The hotel was really nice and clean. The room was comfortable, for a NYC hotel, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great, with a subway station just across the street, and many attractions and places to eat within walking distance.

title: A wonderful stay in a lovely hotel. Helped make out wedding celebrations even more memorable. Concierge staff were fab.
text: Thank you, Thank you to everyone at Artezen Hotel, NYC. This was our first visit to the city and Artezen helped make it wonderfully memorable. All of the staff we encountered were amazing. Thank you!

title: Convenient and relaxing
text: Stayed for a week in September.  Temperatures in the 90s were no problem for the aircon and the bottled water and room fridge were invaluable.  Convenient location close to Fulton street, helpful and welcoming staff, housekeeping did a great job and the rooms were quiet.  Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend.

title: Two nights in New York with my wife after our transatlantic Disney cruise. Sightseeing and taking in a show on Broadway.
text: Fantastic hotel for a city break. Well priced and located out of the tourist areas in the finance district. Perfect for subway connections to all parts of the city with Daniel the best concierge in New York City in my opinion.  Plenty of independent local choice for breakfast and eating out.

title: Perfect location & excellent staff.
text: Excellent location near the subway, Wall Street & the 9/11 memorials. The staff were helpful. Daniel, the concierge was excellent & very knowledgeable. Nothing was too much hassle for him. Rooms are spacious & clean. Lots of excellent places to eat nearby.

title: First New York visit
text: We stayed here for 9 nights on our first trip to NEW York, the staff could not have been more helpful and knowledgeable and nothing was a problem for them.  The room was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable.  The location of the hotel is 500 yards from a main subway which made getting around very easy and was located very close to major attraction in Lower Manhattan.  We had a great stay and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to stay in this area.  Big thank you to all the staff, keep up the great work

title: ARTEZEN Hôtel - Je recommande !
text:
Séjour de 6 nuits à l'Hôtel Artezen, situé à proximité de la Station de métro FULTON, a quelques encablures du Mémorial 9/11. 

Le personnel nous a toujours accueilli avec le sourire et très poliment. 

La chambre de type "Complimentary" était idéalement située à un étage très élevé et côté cour intérieure ce qui a grandement participé au retour au calme et à l'apaisement après une folle journée dans les rues de NY. 

Peu de chambres par étages, nous avons eu la chance de ne pas entendre nos voisins de couloir. 

La chambre (1 lit King Size) est plutôt petite, le placard est assez restreint lui aussi mais le cadre de lit est pourvu de 4 tiroirs ce qui permet de ranger beaucoup d'affaires. Cintres / Coffre fort dans le placard. 

** A noter : le matelas est très très confortable **

La salle de bain est fonctionnelle (Produits d'hygiène / sèche cheveux) 
Un plateau café/eau/chips est réassorti tous les jours (cela fait partie des fameuses FEES à payer - Taxes supp à régler avant ou après le séjour, consommés ou non vous les paierais pour tous les jours passés à l'hôtel) 

Pas de restaurant donc pas de petit-déjeuner. 

Enfin je terminerai par le plus important : tout est propre dans l'hôtel ! 
Pas de nuisibles / Pas d'odeur ! 

AC - Chambre 1705 - Séjour du 06 au 12/09/23

title: Not amazing hotel but good location for 9/11 memorials
text: Arrived later than planned due to airline delays.  When I checked in, was told I was getting the last room they had available.  As I opened the door to the room, I felt a little claustrophobic as the room was barely larger than my walk in closet at home.  The view was of a neighboring building where you could see into some of their rooms, so I kept my blinds shut.  It was quiet and that was the most important to me after a long flight.  It was easy the next day  to walk to the 9/11 memorial, 9/11 museum, One World Observatory, etc.  For dinner they recommended Keste Pizza but it was only average - disappointing.  Next day discovered right across the street from the hotel,  Joe's pizza, which I loved - nothing fancy but amazing pizza "to go".

title: Overall Excellent
text:
Recently stayed here for a 5 night stay in September. Hotel is in a great location, accessible to loads of subway stations and World Trade Center for PATH trains elsewhere.
Many tourist attractions are within walking distance (ferry to Statue of Liberty for example).
The hotel is also within walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown and the Brooklyn Bridge. Staff are very helpful, friendly and kind. Daniel (Concierge) was an outstanding member of the team, always willing to give advice and offer hospitality. This was much appreciated and went a long way when we were new to New York City.
Rooms were clean and tidy with all the facilities you need. Considering it is in NYC, it was very quiet overnight which allowed for good recovery time from busy days exploring the city.
Definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere to stay.

title: Best hotel experience!
text:
Probably the best hotel experience we’ve ever had! Amazing service, accommodated all of our needs, very clean, and the staff gave wonderful recommendations. Daniel at the door was SO kind and was particularly sweet to our Grandma. The Nespresso machine in the room was fantastic, and the small water kettle was perfect for Grandma to brew her favorite green tea. 

Also, this hotel is located right across the street from a great pub eatery: The Irish American. Great food! 

Lastly, this hotel had no issue with 5 of us staying in a 2 queen bed room and provided extra bedding for our young son to sleep on a small blow up mattress (we brought the mattress from home). 

We will definitely be back!

title: Outstanding!
text: A wonderful hotel in downtown NYC, we’ve now stayed there about 5 times. Stylish, comfortable, great location, absolutely spotlessly clean, good rates (for NYC, nothing anyone can do about that!), and absolutely the best staff. Every single staff member is totally professional, really friendly and always solves any issues right away with no fuss. We can’t recommend it highly enough.

title: Excellent hotel for a NYC visit
text: Our family of four stayed at the Artezen last week and loved everything about it. The location is great - close to Fulton Station and so many sites in the financial district, the beds were super comfortable and we appreciated small features: the safe, daily water bottle replenishment, the privacy/cleaning lights and the gym was outstanding. All of the staff from the moment we arrived until departure were incredibly friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Beautiful experience
text:
Hotel perfetto. Rispetto ad altri hotel di New York ha dei vantaggi : camere decisamente piu grandi della media, non si deve aspettare l'ascensore perché ci sono solo 21 piani, è estremamente pulito, personale super efficiente e cordiale, caffe' in camera. Veloci nel soddisfare qualunque richiesta. A noi è piaciuta anche l'area ( financial district) perché si trova nella zona della baia dove si può andare in bici e a piedi per fare lunghissime passeggiate. Ci sono campi da basket, skate, tennis disseminati per tutta la baia e la sera è una zona davvero magica. Sicuaramente piu comoda e meno turistica di Central Park o time square. Complimenti a tutto lo staff e grazie per aver reso perfetto il nostro soggiorno a NY
( per gli italiani: nessuna agenzia vi propone questo albergo perché non fa parte del circuito italiano, io ho prenotato in autonomia prezzo nella media per un 4 stelle )

title: Fabulouso stay !  Just perfect
text: Fabulous stay in the Artezen hotel!  We are a family of 4 celebrating our son's 18th and 21st in NY.  Very efficient and friendly check-in.  Room was lovely - comfy beds, nice bathroom, TV , coffee machine (coffee replenished daily), all spotless. The Concierge team are fantastic - special mention to the lovely Carmelo - cant't thank him enough!  He is very knowledgeable and super helpful.  Gave us loads of recommendations for eating out - all spot on and fabulous - as well as tips to get around and sites to see.  Hotle is surprinsingly quiet considering how central it is - just perfect for all the sites.  Fabulous Thai restruant 2 doors down - but be prepared to queque its so worth it!  Carmelo also recommended Juniors for Cheesecake and Zucker's for Bagels - omg the best we've ever had! Loved every minute of our 5 day stay.  Would definitley recommend this hotel every time !  Thanks !

title: EXCELLENT !!!
text: Hotel Artezzn is very well located for visiting New York City. The staff are polite, friendly, discreet and helpful. The rooms are clean and a good size. We will return to this hotel on our next stay. There is a PRET A MANGER not far away for breakfast.

title: Business Trip x Leisure
text:
While my husband was busy during our stay since he was in a business trip I on the other hand was just chilling and vibing the place. 
Friendly staff, and our housekeeper during our stay was very pleasant. 

the only down side is the sound insolation of the place, which I think was a common issue here.

title: Lovely comfortable rooms and great location base.
text:
Very comfortable rooms and bed and the staff very helpful and gave us a warm welcome.
Would definitely recommend and would go back if the prices don’t go up too much.
We got really good value for our money spent and there is plenty of sightseeing places near by and a great location for the subway trains from the world trade centre and Fulton street.

title: Great convenient all-round friendly hotel.
text:
Can't praise the Artezen enough - superb location and easy walk to most of the places on our 'wish-list'. Room (on the 17th floor) was fine and the bed/bedding was superb in size, quality and comfort.
The concierge and his team were extremely helpful with recommendations for dinner and the best way to get around the city.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Me and my mum recently stayed at this hotel and it was everything we needed!! The rooms were fully equipped with all needed and the staff were amazing! 
Each receptionist, each concierge and each cleaner were always happy to help and so friendly! 

With it being so close to a main subway station it was easy access to all of New York. 

Would 100% recommend to anyone going to New York

title: Amazing boutique hotel in the financial district
text: Amazing hotel. Possibly the nicest I’ve stayed in for friendliness, cleanliness and overall chic. As it’s situated in the financial district it’s less hectic than midtown, but still has the authentic NYC feel.  With views of WT1 pretty much from the sidewalk outside and Fulton Street subway hub opposite it was an ideal spot to explore the sights of Manhattan & Brooklyn. We were a 5-10 minute walk from the Brooklyn bridge, Broadway, World Trade 1 and Wall Street. The hotel staff were super friendly & helpful and the room large and comfy. The beds were huge & very comfortable. The nespresso machine was a nice touch, as was the limited free coffee, water and cookies daily. The bathroom was spotless and had excellent mirror lights (always a bonus) a large shower and plenty of vanity space. Our room was quiet & we only heard other guests on one occasion. I felt very safe as the elevator only works with a room key. Therefore I felt secure in knowing that the hallways etc were private. Oh and there’s a great pub opposite. I’d definitely visit here again.

title: Hotel très bien placé,  à recommander
text:
Très bonne expérience. Personnel au top (manque peut-être quelques sourires féminins à l'accueil, les hommes sont plus aimables...), très professionnel dans l'ensemble.
Les différentes personnes avec qui nous avons eu affaire à la conciergerie étaient toutes super efficaces et sympathiques (et patients...). Nous avons bien apprécier ce service de conciergerie.
La terrasse au dernier étage est malheureusement fermée (nous n'avions pas eu l'information avant d'essayer d'y monter... on nous a rappelé de manière un peu maladroite que c'était une "zone interdite", sans plus d'explication). Dommage...
Lits très confortables. Nous avions une chambre à 2 lits queen, de taille très correct pour 3.
Hotel bien placé, restaurants et supermarchés à proximité

title: A great stay
text: We decided to stay well away from mid town and what a great choice of hotel. Great location close to the pier and main subway stations, an ideal base. Lovely size room and bathroom, smartly decorated and great facilities. For me though the stand out was the pre arrival concierge team. We had so many tips and hints, without any trouble at all they were just brilliant. A great stay with so much on your doorstep

title: I loved it once, but second time disappointed
text: We visited this hotel a couple of years ago and we loved it!  However, this time it did not live up to my expectations.  Yes, our room was smaller, and certainly that was part of it.  The bathroom and shower were great and the bed was comfortable.  It was definitely very clean.  I longed for a cup of real coffee in the morning, and there is only an nespresso machine, which is not for me.  My husband had to walk a while to find coffee as the place we used last time, right across the street, has closed.  I had to laugh at the “resort fee” charged…what is it for??  Some tiny cookies and chips?  A bottle or two of water?  Just forget the resort fee, please.  The TV did not work.  Naturally when I called the desk I merely wanted them to tell me what to do….NOT to send a person up, but that was the option. The woman on the phone tried to help, but the option she gave was in no way related to the options on the TV or two remotes.  There was loud noise from building from 4 AM.  I love that NYC is re-building, but how about a warning or some earplugs?  Clearly this goes on every single night!

title: Chic, clean & cool! 😎
text: Chic, Clean and Cool. Amazing service all round- my go-to hotel in FiDi. Never would I ever stay elsewhere! The team is superb, friendly and extremely helpful. Francesco and Erica went over and beyond to make my stay welcoming and comfortable.

title: The Perfect Getaway
text: I wanted to highlight this hotel from all, me and my girlfriend spent 3 days and I could say everything was perfect, the location walking distance to almost all trains, the room we stayed had all you can need the beds are super comfortable, housekeeping did an excellent job in our room we had service everyday and the room was spotless . The part that put the cherry on the ice cream for me the customer service everyone we spoke with was always very helpful and courteous with a smile on their face. I love this hotel I will recommend 100%

title: Amazing Holiday
text: We had a wonderful time staying at the Artezen hotel, John Street. The staff were so helpful and friendly, the room was immaculately kept, cleaned daily, bed changed and toiletries restocked. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the 9/11 memorial and world trade centre and a 15 minute walk to Battery Park where you can board a boat over to the statue of liberty and Ellis Island.  From the Fulton  subway which is a 2  minute walk from the hotel it is extremely accessible to get up town to all the other areas of New York, Joe's pizzas just around the corner are really nice. We had an amazing stay and I would highly recommend this hotel, thank you so much!

title: Brilliant stay!
text:
What a hotel! 

Staff were amazing and very attentive! Nothing was too much! Extremely friendly!! Couldn’t be happier with our stay! 

Location very close to world trade centre and accross the road to the subway! 

Fantastic!

title: Fantastic
text:
Stayed here as a party of two couples. Lovely clean & comfortable hotel with fantastic bed  & amazing linens. Beautiful fragrance everywhere!
 Fresh water & coffee replenished each day. Close to Brooklyn Bridge & World Trade Centre.
All staff lovely & friendly, particularly Daniel who recommended we use their black car service to take us back to JFK, which he arranged for us.
Overall could not fault this hotel - a lovely calm, quiet oasis in a very busy city.
Would recommend 120%!

title: Super Clean and Comfy
text: Staying in NYC is tricky because hotels can be icky. This hotel is super clean and have quality toiletries. The robes and slippers are awesome. Staff was always helpful and attentive. Enjoyed the stay and would return!

title: Brilliant location
text: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Artezen. Check in was smooth and welcoming. Rooms are a good size for NYC. Handy location as just over from Fulton Street and Trade centre metro stations also within 5 minute walk. There’s also a great bar Carraghers across the road, which would also recommend a visit. Staff were really helpful and friendly. Would recommend this property and will hopefully be back in the future.

title: Great Hotel
text:
A lovely hotel situated in the heart of the financial distict. Check in was great, and front of house were very nice.
We only used the room as a base, but everything from the bathroom to facilities, were as expected.
All the staff we encountered were all very friendly. We would definitely stay again when in New York.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: A lovely hotel. We felt comfortable and safe in this hotel. Rooms are standard New York size but well laid out. Friendly service and knowledgeable about the area. Close to subway stops and attractions. Only a 15 minute walk to ferry system. Beds are comfy and floors were quiet. Would stay here again.

title: Sensational find in a great location
text:
I thought it would be impossible to find good value for money in the Manhattan hotel market……but I was wrong, the Artezen is fantastic! 
The rooms have everything you’d expect for a hotel of this quality. The staff were amazing - friendly and helpful. The concierge even helped us walk three blocks with our luggage to find us a better spot for the taxi to take us to the airport because the traffic was completely blocked on the street where the hotel is. 
The location is superb - right next to Trade Center/OneWorld, 5mins walk to Brooklyn Bridge, one block from Fulton St where you can get the subway to Midtown and a bunch of other places. And although the hotel doesn’t serve breakfast, we found two great spots within 1min walk (Suited and Parisienne)

Can’t thank everyone at the Artezen enough for making it one of the best hotel stays we’ve had anywhere in the world. Would 100% recommend it to anyone planning to visit NYC

title: Lovely place to stay
text: The artezen is very clean and tidy the staff are very helpful the only drawback is no breakfast available there are tea and coffee with kettle in the room there is a small fitness gym which is clean very enjoyable stay neat the brocklyn bridge and 911 memor

title: Great location and service
text: Had read so many great reviews of the Artezan I was not sure what to expect but it absolutely lived up to it's reputation.  Check-in was friendly and our room was great, not the biggest room but perfectly fine for our needs.   Bed was very comfortable, air-conditioning worked well an the shower had great pressure.  In terms on convenience you   couldn't get much better.  The subway is super close taking you all over NYC, we walked down to the 911 memorial and over the bridge to Brooklyn.  For anyone looking for a  NYC Hotel close to transport, with friendly service and not over priced - this one's for you.

title: Good memories of my first trip to New York
text: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this hotel on our first New York trip in April. The lobby staff also kindly welcomed me, and I was very grateful that they took care of the coat I forgot to leave at the hotel. The location was also very close to the subway station, so it was very convenient to travel around the city of New York.

title: Phenomenal  stay!
text:
Fantastic 5 day stay at The Artezen! This will officially be my new go-to hotel for future visits to NYC.  

The staff is incredibly kind, hospitable, friendly, and helpful. The room I stayed in was wonderfully clean. The lobby and elevators were kept clean and sanitized, as well. Housekeeping was visibly/actively cleaning too. 

The rooms have very nice features, including a Nespresso machine and refrigerator, great water pressure in the shower, C.O. Bigelow body products, a desk for working, reliable WiFi, and water bottles + delicious quality snacks (Fiji or Poland Springs water, Biscoff cookies, Deep River potato chips).

Room 1903 even came with a view.
 
The location is ideal for exploring, with Fulton Street Subway station access at the end of the block on John Street (for the 2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, J, R, and Z lines). The 9/11 Memorial & Museum, Brooklyn Bridge, Federal Hall, Charging Bull, the South Street Seaport, etc.are  all nearby, and Chinatown, Tribeca, Lower East Side, etc. are an easy walk. There's a Whole Foods and Eataly nearby, Duane Reade across the street.

title: Birthday Weekend...
text: Where do I begin..My daughter and I arrived late March 31st and was greeted with smiling faces from Peter and the other young man (thank you to the young man for the 2 parking locations for our vehicle)  at the front desk.  All of the men are gentlemen and always  acknowledge you coming and going.  They open the doors for you, assist you with your luggage, calling a taxi ( thank you to the young man who called a taxi for us) and where to park your vehicle. The front entry is beautifully decorated with a welcoming aroma and it does not stop there.  The elevator is beautifully decorated and modern and, the hallways are modern with lovely artwork including the lights.  Our king deluxe was a welcoming haven to relax.  Again, beautifully decorated, very comfortable bed, linen and pillows.  The furniture was everything we wanted in our home as we are renovating now.  Huge thank you to the ladies that serviced our room.  We had a nice conversation with Carmelo who directed us where to eat breakfast and assisted us with our luggage along with the other young man. The area is busy  with plenty to see and do and the location is great.   Much appreciated and we will be back....

title: Very Friendly/Clean Place to stay
text: Very nice place to stay, they will go out of their way to do whatever you need them to do. They are always asking if you need anything and will always ask if you need directions for the subway or best way to get around. We will for sure come back and stay at this hotel.

title: A Hidden Gem1
text: I loved our stay here!  The location is perfect!  Away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town so close to the 9/11 memorial and museum.  I also loved the vibe of the financial district.  Our teenagers were thrilled to be so close to a location of Joe's Pizza.  That was a fan favorite.  I can't speak highly enough of the staff here.   They are kind and really went the extra mile to make sure we had everything we needed...down to a reasonable;y priced ride back to the airport.  Can't wait to visit again!  I will return...one of my new favorite places to stay in the city for sure!

title: Outstanding!
text: This is by far the best hotel experience we’ve ever had! Very nice rooms and a staff that really stands out. Our four day stay with this helpful staff (especially the concierge) really made this a memorable visit to NY.

title: Better than I expected!!!  Would definitely return!!!
text: Beautiful boutique hotel. Clean!  Comfy beds, sheets, pillows. Rooms are perfect. The staff goes above and beyond. DANIEL!  What a guy!!  I could write pages! Helpful, polite best experience! Thanks!

title: A gem in FiDi!
text: Several weeks ago, I had the pleaure of staying at this lovely boutique hotel.  The moment I walked in, I had several staff members welcome me and offer any help I might need. Checking in at reception was quick and seamless. Upon checking out, without solicitation, a staff member asked if  I would like to have my bag stored until actually leaving the city. All this and being that it is a smaller hotel, makes for a very personalized experience. It is conveniently located near the Fulton Street transportation hub as well as all other attractions (1 World Trade Center, Oculus, seaport, Battery Park, etc.) Let me add that the entire hotel is decorated beautifully with a modern but eclectic flair. My room was beautifully appointed and super clean with complimentary in-room coffee, water and snacks. The best part is that I had an amazing  night's sleep in a very comfortable bed, with a choice of pillows and, even though my room faced Fulton Street, I did not hear any traffic noise. I would imagine the windows are well sound-proofed. I happen to be a native New Yorker who often stays overnight in the city so I do have very high expectations which were more than met by The Artezen!! I will definitely stay there again!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: This hotel was wonderful, the room was stylish and modern, so was the bathroom with a beautiful big shower and great cosmetic products. Staff were nice and friendly, the location was great due to its proximity to Fulton metro station which has different lines going through and is connected to JFK. Only downside is that our TV wasn't working on the first day and it took 3 days before they fixed the issue, other than this the whole stay was perfect and I'd definitely choose this hotel again.

title: Great Find in Lower Manhattan
text: First and foremost! Every staff member from housekeeping to front desk to door man are all extremely friendly and welcoming. Such a swell hotel. Room was really nice.. VERY comfortable bed. Lovely linens. Lovely decor.Large closet with safe. Free water. Bathroom was large with a fabulous rain shower. Large desk and large tv.Very quiet. Only complaint is it is lacking a traditional coffee maker - only espresso. No matter. Plenty of coffee in the hood. Spent 5 days and not a hiccup - I will return.

title: Better than advertised
text:
We stayed here one night. The staff is very professional and helpful.  The rooms are exactly as shown on their website, comfortable and well laid out. The bathroom is clean and well designed. We will definitely stay there again.
The only thing  we didn't like the soft mattress. Next time we will ask if there is an option for a firmer mattress. 
There is a great Irish bar across the street, get the "hot chocolate"!

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The staff was incredibly helpful and welcoming, especially Daniel. He remembered my name and my husband's name and made us feel so comfortable and taken care of. The room was super clean and the bed was very comfortable. Really nice shower as well. The gym was well-supplied. But really, the crown jewel is the staff. Absolutely first-class service all the way. Thank you.

title: Great experience
text: We loved the Artezen! The people here were super nice and welcoming every time we came and went. It was close to the subway for easy access. Room was small (probably normal for New York) but comfortable. We really appreciated the free bottles of water each day, which we took out sightseeing with us. Our only critique is the bed pillows - they were terrible and squished flat when you put your head on them.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Experience was great! No hidden or ridiculous fees, rooms were clean and the terrace was really dope! Christian and Daniel were super great people and made our reservation for a ride to the airport which saved us so much money (instead of an Uber or taxi).  The front desk is always welcoming and greets you all the time.  This is a 5 star hotel with a family ambience!

title: Amazing Stay
text: We stayed for 4 nights on our first visit to New York! Amazing hotel, great value for money, the most friendly, helpful and polite staff and a great location next to the subway. Huge comfy beds, brilliant maid service each day and little extras like water and snacks in your room! Wouldn’t hesitate to book again!

title: Exceptional Hotel & Outstanding Staff
text:
Exceptional hotel, outstanding staff and great value for money. Our 2x double queen room surpassed expectations and was much bigger with great amenities. Spotlessly clean and proper sound proofing meant we got a great night’s sleep. All the staff from the porters, reception & cleaning were super friendly and helpful - real assets to this hotel. Although in FiDi & not a main tourist hotspot, the location was great right next to Fulton St subway hub that takes you pretty much anywhere & walking distance to all of lower Manhattan’s attractions. 

Would highly recommend & will be returning!

title: Amazing stay and even better value!
text:
I stayed at the Artezen as a solo traveller over the President’s Day long weekend and it was such a great stay. 
The rooms are typically sized for NYC (small, lol) but for me staying on my own - it was perfect. The bathroom has great lighting and a spacious shower with a rain shower head + a detached shower head. Also, the daily water bottles were a great touch. I didn’t get a chance to go to the hotel gym but from the pictures, it’d looked a bit smaller than what I’m used to.
The staff were extremely friendly and helpful for anything needed. Also the location being just steps away from Fulton station was perfect for getting around the city! Overall, I will definitely come again the next time I visit NYC and would recommend to anyone who wants an excellent hotel for a great price.

title: A Hidden Gem
text:
Having visited NYC over many years, you soon realise that certain hotels have their hotspots. The Artezen is ideally located for the subway (50 yds), WTC and Memorial museum (200 yds), The Staten Island Ferry ( 400 yds) and The Financial District (300 yds). As you approach John Street you can begin to wonder about the area. Don’t be over alarmed, the street is just busy. 
Once inside the hotel is a modern clean and well equipped hotel with good amenities. We find that any hotel is only as good as it’s staff and would certainly endorse the warm and courteous welcome you receive from all members and a willingness to offer help and advise. 
Our room was modern and clean with good amenities which was appreciated. Some rooms have outside terraces which don’t offer any views but do give you additional space to sit.
As we were room only we used the Brookfield Place which overlooks the Hudson River and The Oculus ( in the WTC railway station) for meals. These offer many dietary options and are a great place to eat. A visit to The Tin Shed is well worthwhile.

Thanks to all the staff who contributed to a great stay. We would recommend this hotel and hope to see you on our return.
Regards
Phil and Sally ( Room 704)

title: Great stay!! Worthy of it's high rating
text:
The hotel was fantastic. 

Check in was quick and painless. Staff were extremely helpful and attentive all throughout our stay. 

The room is surprisingly large for Manhattan. It was immaculate and well maintained. We had a view of John street. 

The location is a real winner. We normally stay in midtown so were nervous of the downtown location. However it worked amazing for us. Fulton Street station is well serviced (expect delays at the weekend however) and there are trains to all the midtown stations. 

Walking distance to wall street, battery park and you can see the WTC from the hotel. 

Would highly recommend

Shout out to Charles and Denny (I think I got the names right) went above and beyond helping us out throughout our stay

title: Frustration due to being nickel and dimed
text:
Let me start out by saying, I will sound like a bit of a Karen in this review. That is not lost on me. To start off, this hotel is a perfectly fine hotel if you need to stay in FiDi. The room is decent size but the bathroom is tiny. I've stayed at hotels in NYC at similar price point with MUCH bigger bathrooms but I get that might have been more of an exception in NYC so no points off for the small bathroom. The room makes up for it with the large balcony which was really nice to have. With the exception of one lady at the front desk, the rest of the staff was exceptionally nice and welcoming.

Now, this is where I got really angry. You pay a fee each day that is supposed to cover water and coffee etc. Not once, did they refill the coffee pods or water bottles for the 3 nights that I was there (each day they made up the room). I called one day to get some water and creamer (used both creamers for one pod). On the third day, I called down because I ran out of coffee pods. The lady at the front desk said that it would be an extra charge. I told her this was ridiculous because they were never refilled. She said she would look into it and call me back. Really? 5 minutes later she called me back saying the system shows they replenished them but that they would send more and graciously waive the fee. The room comes with 2 caffeinated pods so for my stay I should have had 6 of them (if I used 2 per day) but I only used 2 the entire stay (the 2 that were in the room on the first day). She continued to explain that their system showed it was replenished, essentially saying that I was lying (there were no cups either since they were not replenished). Honestly, from a customer service perspective, I should NOT have to argue about getting a freaking coffee pod and convince them that I am not lying to save a couple bucks. 

Again, I know I am complaining about a relatively small issue, but it was such a simple thing from a customer service perspective to not insinuate that the customer is lying and just send up 1 freaking coffee pod.

If I need to stay in FiDi again, I would likely not stay at this hotel. Such a shame that one bad customer service encounter can leave a foul taste in your mouth and ruin an otherwise nice stay.

title: Nicest Hotel Staff in Lower Manhattan
text:
Stayed for three nights to attend a workshop in lower Manhattan/financial district.  The staff couldn't have been nicer. SOOOO helpful and welcoming. Don't let the neighborhood noise fool you--my room was on the 16th floor and I didn't hear a sound.  (And I am a light sleeper.) Bed was comfy, too, and I liked the size of the work space.
Very special kudos to Danny at the desk and the two concierges, Consuelo and John.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: Stayed here in mid January.  Room was lovely with plenty of room especially for a New York hotel. Staff went beyond to ensure stay was perfect - provided directions, general NYC information and very welcoming. All staff great however kudos to Jonathan, Carmelo and Daniel!! Great room amenities. Also good location to get around city. Overall wonderful atmosphere at hotel.

title: No hesitation in recommending this hotel with the most wonderful staff
text: We loved this hotel. The best part about it is the wonderful staff, particularly Jhonathon, Francisco and Daniel. They could not have been more helpful and genuinely friendly. The location was great with Eataly downtown nearby as well as brilliant ramen, a juice bar and the Nobu downtown. The rooms were so beautiful with the most comfortable beds and pillows. Everything was clean and functioned well.

title: Fantastic hotel, excellent location, highly recommended!
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Artezen for 4 nights in early January 2023. The rooms and bathrooms are modern, clean and comfortable. A/C  available in the rooms, we had a very large shower, and bedside lamps even had USB ports for charging devices. A clothes steamer was also provided which was very useful for a quick fix on creased clothes out of our cases!

All staff were extremely friendly and the concierge (Carmelo) was very helpful and knowledgeable, especially in advising the best option to get to JFK for our departure.

The location of this hotel is what really makes this a stand out hotel for me (this was my third time in NYC). I found it very easy to get around, regardless of where we went. Subway stations are seconds away from the hotel and several key tourist attractions are nearby, as follows:
- 5 minute walk to 9/11 memorial.
- 5 minute walk to Wall Street (Stock Exchange etc).
- 7 minute walk to Brooklyn Bridge.
- 10 minute walk to Wall St. NY Ferry to get to Brooklyn/DUMBO (I recommend doing this instead of walking all the way over Brooklyn Bridge then back, tickets were about $4).
- 15 minute walk to The Battery for ferries to Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island etc.

There are plenty of restaurants/pubs/bars in the surrounding area. A few of my personal recommendations:
- Healthy Green Juice Bar (breakfast smoothies/acai bowls etc) 30 second walk.
- Kesté Pizza (offer full gluten free menu) 5 minute walk.
- Overstory cocktail bar (64th floor 360° views of NYC skyline, incredible for seeing Brooklyn Bridge at night) 5 minute walk.

One final, huge, positive of this hotel, the location is also very quiet! I cannot recall being able to hear any traffic or sirens of emergency vehicles. Both myself and my partner slept very well.

I really could not overstate how highly I would recommend this hotel!

title: Family holiday to New York
text:
I have to commend this hotel, they made our stay in New York City a very memorable one. The staff were extremely helpful and went above and beyond to guide us every day. Carbello, Daniel and all at the front door (sorry if I forgot your name or missed spelled them) are the most amazing people we met. Every morning they would great us with a smile and ask what our plans were and give us directions on how to get there. They informed us of all places to eat and we’re would be the best places. Every evening we came back they would ask us how our day was and welcome us back. They organized transfers for us when needed and taxi SUV to the airport. The front desk staff always had a smile for us and also welcomed us back every evening. The housekeeping staff were so friendly and keep our rooms so clean and tidy and replenished our snacks and that every day. They truly are amazing people and I would highly recommend staying in this hotel. I will definitely be back to this hotel on my return to New York. Well done to all the staff in the Artezen Hotel and a special thank you to Carbello and Daniel. 

From the Irish folks 

Charlotte, Marion, Shauna, Daniel, Annie and Caoimhe

title: A Fabulous Stay!
text: Our 3 night stay was fabulous!  The staff is top notch. The concierge(s) were stellar and proved to be a huge help.  While the room is predictably compact, it is so well appointed (and clean!) all our needs were met.  The downtown location proved ideal - eateries, stores, restaurants, an Irish pub and a subway station are in easy walking distance. We also walked to WTC/Oculus, Battery Park, City Hall, Wall Street/Federal Hall, Tenement Museum, South Street Seaport. I would recommend the Artezen Hotel in a heartbeat.

title: Absolutely amazing hotel
text:
My family and myselfs stay at this hotel was incredible , we had an absolute amazing time and we were treated with so much respect all the staff there are unbelievably nice and kind 
We will definitely be back 100% yous have made our trip so much better we had an amazing time 
Thank yous all for your kind service 
This hotel is really clean and modern
They are all so helpful and have big smiles !!
Very very amazing hotel

title: Klasse Hotel mit einem guten Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis
text:
Ein super Hotel im Finance-District von New York. Sehr schön und geschmackvoll eingerichtet, das Personal ist sehr, sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit und es sind nur wenige Schritte bis zu U-Bahn, One World Trade Center und Wall Street.

Einziger Wermutstropfen war das Bett: die Matratze glich einer Hängematte, uns tat nach 6 Nächten der Rücken weh. Trotzdem absolute Buchungsempfehlung.

title: Un piccolo gioiellino
text: Hotel in ottima posizione per visitare le principali attrazioni di NY! Pulizia accurata e accoglienza impeccabile da parte del personale.  Camera di buone dimensioni e letti molto comodi. Bagno con doccia molto funzionale.  Ci ritorneremo sicuramente.

title: Martha Peabody Walker
text: This hotel is a treasure. My weekend stay was flawless from check in to checkout. Exceptionally clean and comfortable rooms with excellent staff and service. They alerted me immediately for an item I had left in the room after checkout. Above and beyond. Thank you!

title: Best 4 star hotel in downtown
text: A block from the Fulton Street metro center makes the Artezen an obvious choice.  What you find out when you check in is that the staff is welcoming and ready to help at all times.  They even put out a rack of umbrellas when it rained!  Beds are super comfortable.  Bathrooms nicely renovated. Room size is what you would expect for being an older structure in an older neighborhood.  Did hear a neighbor's very loud tv which fortunately wasn't on all night.  Very close to World Trade Center, Seaport, Chinatown, Brooklyn Bridge (yes, NYC is made for walking) and practically every subway line you can think of in Manhattan.  Would stay here again.

title: Exceptional value in downtown location.
text:
Clean, friendly and welcoming experience.
Every employee was upbeat and helpful.
Directions in the neighborhood were always correct and recommendations informed.
The room was small but very well laid out.  We didn't feel cramped.
The HVAC  worked well.

title: Exceptional
text: Absolutely beautiful hotel-small rooms but no different than many of the hotels in the area. Rooms were very clean, bathroom clean and very nice. Bed was very comfortable and nice to have a fridge in the room as well as a small desk.  Staff was exceptional-so helpful and we would have not gotten around so easily without  their guidance.  Carmelo was exceptional-sharing his experience of 911 at our asking as well as his guidance for places to eat and using the subway. He is a true gem for the hotel. Hotel security was excellent as well. Would absolutely stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends and family. Cannot wait to go back!

title: Smaller hotel close to different neighborhoods
text: Was in town for a couple of days and wanted to find a hotel aware from the craziness of Times Square, etc. On a side street, close to Fulton Station with easy access to the subway and shopping. The room was on the small side but clean, but could use better towels. There is a gym on-site, was extremely small, however there was a separate yoga/stretching area.

title: Exceeded my expectations! Wonderful hotel! Great location!
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Artezen Hotel. The hotel is very clean, polished, and comfortable. Location is great! All types of transportation are easily accessible. 

I am in awe of the staff! You will always be greeted with a big smile before entering the hotel. Upon entering, you don't feel as if you are in New York City. Great vibe!
 
Marcelo, the concierge, gave us great recommendations for restaurants and attractions and was always very friendly, with the best attitude and customer service! The front desk staff were also very friendly and happy to assist. My stay exceeded my expectations!

title: Customer Service is very important at this hotel.
text: This place is amazing. It clean, the staff is friendly the customer service is very good. I felt really comfortable. I like how my room was set up with tea, sugar, coffee and creamer, 2 bottles of Figi water and a Portland spring bottle of water.

title: Amazing stay, amazing staff
text:
The Hotel was fantastic, the room was spotlessly clean, the bed was sooo comfortable, and the staff were out of this world, special shout out to the night manager Fransisco, what a legend!!
Unfortunately our overall trip is being Mared by American Airlines flight delay and Expedia's ability to address the issue. 
I would thoroughly recommend the Artezen Hotel. In addition its within easy walking distance to all those downtown attractions, Freedom Tower, statue cruises, helitours at pier 6, to name but a few, uptown is just as easy, however, as the hotel is practically next door to Fulton Street Station, a hub for many of the subway lines. 
Thanks again

title: Amazing.
text:
Really friendly staff couldn’t of done more for us. Perfect location - 2 minute walk to Fulton street station where you can catch the subway into central  - takes about 15 mins. Also surrounded by amazing places to eat. 
Thankyou for making our stay in New York.

title: Outstanding ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ !
text: This hotel was absolutely beautiful, the rooms felt luxurious (especially the bedding and the shower), but the customer service is what really sets it apart! The entire staff went above and beyond to make our stay amazing, and we felt like VIPs all weekend. Carmelo was so awesome - our departure plans fell apart and he truly saved the day! Can’t wait to return to the Artezen!

title: Our favorite hotel in NYC
text:
We stayed at the Artezen for 4 nights in May (after having stayed in two other NYC hotels (CitizenM times square and Public) and Artezen was our favorite hotel by far, despite the other two already having been great. Why so much better, you may ask? It's difficult to describe, but it felt much more personal and like a home away from home. The staff was extremely attentive, helpful and kind. The rooms were modern (recently renovated), had Nespresso coffee machines, daily housekeeping with free replenishment (including coffee capsules), fast wifi, a comfy bed and a nice bathroom.
We also learned that there were plans for a rooftop bar, which will surely be a great addition.

title: White Glove Guest Services!!
text: We absolutely loved our stay at the Artezen Hotel! Exceptional guest services! We enjoyed the room amenities such as snack &  water. The beds were super comfortable & spacious room for NYC hotel!  We also loved the downtown location close to battery park, One Trade center, Wall st. And variety of restaurants. I forgot my Apple Watch in the room and the staff was so gracious to mail it to me in a timely manner! Cannot say enough wonderful things about this lovely hotel and white glove guest services! Highly recommend it!

title: Amazing stay in the cutest boutique hotel in Financial District!!!
text:
Amazing stay at Artezen Hotel, perfect location, 15 minutes subway to Times Square, walking distance to Battery Park to take the boat to Statue of Liberty, right in the middle of the Financial District, 2 blocks from 9/11 Memorial, could not have chosen a better location! 
Courteous staff, specially the Concierge Team, leaded by super friendly and helpful Carmelo, always assisting us with all questions and concerns, he is THE GEM of the Hotel!  Front Office Staff very nice as well, but Carmelo is the true STAR! 
Room is perfect, not small for us at all, as we were in there just for shower and sleep, so those reviews that mention room is small, bear in mind that if you are in NY for tourism, you won't need anything bigger that the super tidy, clean, well taste decor room at Artezen. It comes with Nespresso, coffee pods, they leave Fiji water daily, a welcome snack, and there is a mini fridge that was super useful for us! 
Only issue was the TV in our room, apparently the remote was not working 100% well, so they gave us another one, but then we had to operate with both to be able to get the channels, no big deal at all, we only watched probably 10 minutes of TV per day, rest of the day we were out, so not a big problem. 
The bathroom is super nice, they give nice toiletries, is very well sized and immaculate clean every day, the towels are soft, they give you bathrobe and sleepers. The bed is just amazing, would like that one at home! Pillows, the best! Sheets, soft, whiter than anything,  had great sleep every night!
Lobby is cute, boutique, nice decor, and we got to see it xmas transformed as well and loved it! 
We really loved our stay, we home to come back to NY soon and whenever we do, we'll come back to Artezen, for sure, thanks for an amazing stay! Vanesa, room 1901, from Nov. 19th to 24th.

title: A gem of a hotel.
text: It was our first time staying at The Artezen Hotel but it won’t be the last. All the staff were lovely and incredibly helpful. Our room was clean, modern and very comfortable. The location is excellent with brilliant transport links to the whole of Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Service is excellent as is the location
text: This hotel speaks of excellence when it comes to service.  Whether it is the greeting at the front door, check in or room service, this team could not have done better.  We rented a king size with a balcony for an extra charge.  The rooms are small but immaculate.  I think next time I would skip the balcony.  The view was limited.  The cost is about typical for hotels in this area.  There is no restaurant or mini bar but one doesn't have to travel far to indulge.

title: Bon hôtel à Manhattan
text:
Bel établissement à taille humaine et à la décoration soignée, très bien entretenu, choisi sur la base des commentaires sur Tripadvisor.
Il est un peu excentré au sud de Manhattan mais à proximité immédiate du métro, on peut rejoindre très facilement tous les centres d’intérêt de la ville.
Chambre particulièrement confortable et parfaitement équipée, un peu petite malgré tout (placard pas très grand et peu de place pour la/les valise(s)).
L’insonorisation sonore est correcte, on ne perçoit pas le bruit résiduel toujours présent de l’extérieur à New-York.
Le personnel est sympathique et disponible.
Il n’y a pas de restaurant, pour le breakfast/brunch/déjeuner je recommande « La Parisienne » dans la rue derrière l’hôtel, très bon.
Les point négatifs sont le tarif/la pratique du ‘fee’, comme pour tous les hôtels New-Yorkais excessif/injustifié comparés à ceux de standing identique en Europe, mais le rapport qualité/prix reste supérieur aux établissement similaires à Manhattan.

title: Staff Rocks!
text:
Excellent service and location.  I stay in this area for close proximity to the ferry in preparation for the NYC marathon.  Subway station across the street and surrounded by restaurants.  Quiet at night and walking distance to sites and shopping.  

The room was small, but I had a terrace which was huge.  Very clean and had all the amenities.  Having a fridge and tea kettle was key to prepping for my race.  Appreciated the complimentary chips and water. No one does that anymore.  

Staff was outstanding!  I’d return to this hotel in the future.  The race and heat wrecked me, but the hotel was an awesome second finish line to cross!

title: One of the best hotel experiences
text:
This hotel is truly wonderful.  The staff are incredibly helpful, the room is spotless, beds as comfortable as home, there is no outside noise and it is within walking distance of the 9/11 Memorial and many good restaurants. 

Like most NYC hotel rooms it is small but well laid out.

Highly, highly recommend.

title: Perfect hotel in Manhattan
text: Clean, trendy cozy hotel in the middel of Manhattan. Located centrally and very easy to reach by subway. Close to wallstreet. The room is medium sized but very efficiently designed. Great shower and bathroom. Very convenient working desk with an abundance of espresso coffee available at all hours.

title: Poor housekeeping and rude front desk wrecked an otherwise good stay
text:
We found the hotel modern and comfortable.  The Deluxe King room is quite small, but a lot of New York hotel rooms are small. We enjoyed the location. The concierge was super helpful, as were the doormen. 

Our stay was really dampened though by lacking housekeeping and - more than anything else - the response we got from the front desk about it. So this review is really for front desk management. 

During our whole stay it seemed the only thing housekeeping did is make the bed. Not once did they change the sheets, replace essential amenities (like the bathroom soaps or toilet paper) or even give us clean drinking glasses. They also just generally didn’t tidy. On our third day we told the desk about this and asked for new soaps and toilet paper since we had run out. We had to go down and collect them. 

There was still no improvement for the rest of the stay, so at check out when they asked if we had any feedback, we told them again about these issues and said we were disappointed that nothing was done even when we raised it mid-stay. The woman at the desk first responded by telling us she suspected we had left the ‘do not disturb’ sign on and, if so, it was our fault. When I reminded her that the housekeeper had come in every day to make the beds, so I didn’t think it was our fault or that there was confusion about a ‘do not disturb’ light, she got really abrupt and defensive and started talking about how the snacks in the room were only a ‘first day’ thing and would not have been replaced anyway. That floored us - like she totally didn’t care or listen to a word we said. Who was talking about snacks? I told you we weren’t given soap or toilet paper and that dirty dishes were left in the room for five days straight, even after we asked for someone to come sort things midway through. Nobody cared about snacks. 

That whole exchange left a really negative final feeling. We didn’t ask for anything from the desk because of these issues so it isn’t like we were fishing for compensation. We just gave feedback because they asked for it. To have the desk rep respond so defensively and abruptly to us on the way out the door wasn’t great. If you don’t want feedback then don’t ask.

title: Perfect hotel, excellent location.
text:
Myself and my son stayed here Oct 19th to Oct 25th. From the very start the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful and it smelt amazing as you walked in.  
The room itself was spotless and smelt amazing . The drinks and snacks are all complimentary and the fridge was lovely and cold. There are plenty of lovely white full sized towels along with a make up towel too.  The heating in the room was amazing and all touch control for you to have it as hot or as air conditioned as you require,  The beds are extremely comfortable too.  The location is fab and has a subway station on the same street.  911 and the one world observatory is literally a five minute walk away as it a fab shopping centre and bars and restaurants. 
Our stay was just perfect and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Great Hotel in Financial District
text: I really liked this hotel, staff we friendly and helpful, rooms were average size but very modern and clean with everything you need, however they can be a bit tight if there are two of you with a few items of luggage. Overall I liked it so much that I will certainly stay there when I am back in NY.

title: I love this place!
text:
This is just the perfect hotel for my visits to NYC. The rooms are spacious with large windows, and the staff is just wonderful! The location is great for walkers, also the Fulton st subway station is right there and it’s a quick walk to the east river ferries.
I have stayed here three times since discovering it last year. I am so happy I have found a hotel that is so reliably perfect!

title: First-rate all the way around
text: The Artezen is a first-rate hotel with quiet, cozy, rooms and a welcoming staff.  Every single employee was warm and helpful, especially Carmelo and Solomon.  I had not been to NYC in many years and needed advice about transportation and the neighborhood.  I could not have had a better experience or felt more at home.

title: Great hotel , lovely staff
text:
Great hotel and staff ! Arrived to a warm welcome from Brandon and pre arrival service from carmelo , one of the young concierge (who’s name i sadly didn’t get ) on shift most days was outstanding ! A real jewel in the crown ! Please make sure he is aware of how good he is ! 
Room immaculate , lovely decor and linens of great quality not to mention a comfy bed ! 
Nice toiletries and amenities in room
Tv ans iPad however not working for several days which was a minor annoyance and having to mention a few times was also a bit annoying but mostly for my teenager ! 
Downtown means quiet location and a 25 min ride on subway from Fulton street station across the street . Deserves its rating, a wee bit out the way which I’m guessing is why it’s so well priced 
Great car and driver back to airport 
Thanks to all for a lovely stay

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: I loved this hotel! My room was on the 14th floor and I loved the views! I could also open the window a bit for some fresh air and to hear the sounds of the city. It was in a very good location. It was also immaculately clean. Not a huge room, but I didn't plan to spend a lot of time in my room anyway. It had everything I needed. The staff was friendly and the bed was very comfortable! Would stay here again!

title: A gem in the heart of the Financial District
text:
We stayed at The Atrezen for our wedding trip and had an amazing stay.
From arrival to departure, all the staff were friendly and helpful. In particular, we would like to thank Daniel and Carmelo who went the extra mile to ensure our stay was memorable. Thanks Daniel for the restaurant recommendation where we had the most fantstic steak !
The hotel is located close to Fulton St subway which means you can get across Manhattan really easily. It's a stroll away from the 9/11 museum, One World Observatory and Brooklyn Bridge.
The room were well appointed and spotlessly clean. We had probably the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in.
We opted for a terrace room but unfortunately the weather on the first few days was rainy so we were unable to use it as much as we'd hoped. Room 506 is surrounded by tower blocks (I guess not surprising !!) so didn't get the sun when the weather did improve and was close to a loud vent, so quite noisy.
Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel, the rooms were so quiet and comfy we slept really well. It was the perfecr place to celebrate our NYC wedding.

title: Top Lage - Top Hotel
text: Durch die tolle Lage - sehr nahe beim WCT und dem Finanzviertel - ist es hier ruhiger  als beim TQ! Mit der Subway-Station vor dem Hotel kann man Dich schnell in einen anderen Viertel der Stadt bewegen. Das Hotel ist sauber und die Angestellten hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend! Die Zimmer sind gross - wir hatten zwei Kingsbetten und genügend Platz!

title: Better than some five star hotels I’ve stayed in NYC
text: I booked this place for the reviews as well.  I always stay in five star hotels because I’m searching for 1. Cleanliness and 2. Amazing staff. Well, the Artezen blew me away in both. I recently stayed at the Langham in midtown and the Artezen blew them out of the water. The staff are LOVELY. Beyond helpful with bags, check in. I lived in FIDI for 12 years and had to leave due to COVID- now I am back for interviews and I explained I had one at 3pm (same time as check in) and they were able to secure a room earlier so I may have time to get ready!  Was beyond appreciative. One of the doormen saw my paper bag was ripping that was holding some food - he went and replaced the bag. Details details details.  I will always stay here now. Oh! And the hotel room was DEAD QUIET - how is that even possible in NYC?!?!?

title: Location!!!Staff!
text: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews. They have excellent reviews and it is for a reason. The hotel is nearly perfect , the staff is beyond helpful and kind. It is only a couple of blocks from pace  university. There is off site parking about a block and a half away. I did have a little trouble navving to the site. I am not sure why but it kept throwing me around the block. So just be aware of what streets you are on and crossing. This has nothing to do with the hotel but it is helpful . When you walk in the staff is very welcoming and kind. The room does not disappoint. I had a mini fridge and my absolute favorite a nespresso machine. It is also walking distance to a couple of cute bars and even a cvs , you can get everything at cvs can't you? I stayed on the fifth floor and I had an adorable enclosed balcony. The bed was comfy, the room may be a little small for some people but it's manhattan. That's how it is. Zero complaints from me. I will be staying here in the future.

title: Excellent
text: If you haven’t previously experienced the hell realm that can be affordable New York City hotels, you may not fully appreciate what an oasis this is. Quiet and clean is hard to find in this city, and the Artezen delivers on both. I guess rooms are small, as other reviews mention, but this is normal for even the high end hotels here, and my room here did not stand out as particularly small. I had plenty of room. The bathroom looked brand new. All the staff and doormen were exceptionally polite and responsive. Location is great. I don’t normally need to spend time in the Financial District when I’m in NYC, but I’ll definitely stay here again when I come back. It’s easy to catch the subway to anywhere else in the city, and it’s worth it to stay down here for the rare quality of the Artezen.

title: Fantastic hotel and incredible staff!
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in sept 2022 … the hotel has a good location and it’s easy to get around via Fulton st subway station . Beautiful rooms and super clean ! The staff at this hotel is Amazing and deserves all the credit for making our stay so incredible ! Carmelo and Jhonothan ( I hope I spelled that right !) were excellent hosts making sure we knew how to get everywhere and even helped us with tickets to a few shows . All the staff here seem to know exactly what the customer wants before you ask for it … want a water for ur trip ? U don’t need to ask it’s there ! Directions ? Boom they print them out for u or help u find them on ur phone . Needless to say when we come back to this crazy beautiful city we will be staying here !
