Thanks trip advisor ,as always ,you steered us to the right place btw 2 more things there car service from  the airport is great and the Irish American bar across the street is a great place for a nightcap .. friendly bar and decent prices .. didn’t eat here just drank the night away ! Lol

title: Awesome staff, quiet clean hotel in FiDi
text: We were in a great little room - only 150 square feet in the Petite Queen Room, but it had everything we needed - fridge, clothing steamer, desk, n'espresso, magnifying mirror in bathroom, and after a few days in - we found a bathrobe & slippers! Room was clean and well-decorated, the lobby had a cool design, everything in the hotel was clean, and always smelled great. Great price value for the FiDi. I have never stayed in such a quiet room in NYC  - we probably go at least twice per year, and I’ve never been in such a quiet NYC hotel. View was also nice. As others have said in reviews - the staff here is awesome. So polite and cheerful. The guys who work at the door are excellent - I can't say enough good things about all of them.  Carmelo gave us great detailed help on how to find the correct subway train(s) to get to JFK airport. He was always smiling and friendly as we exited the hotel. Daniel is another gem - so nice and gave us some off-the-beaten path ideas for dinner - since the weather was nice he had ideas on good restaurants with outdoor seating - he even checked to make sure they were open. Awesome. Ashley at front desk also great - helpful & friendly.

title: Solides Stadthotel
text:
Das Hotel liegt in der Nähe der Metro-Station "Fulton-Street" und des "WTC". Durch diese perfekte Lage und der kurze Wege fand ich das Hotel insgesamt sehr gut. Nicht perfekt, da mein Zimmer sehr dunkel und etwas "abgewohnt" war, aber das Gesamtpaket war für einen Städtetrip perfekt. Im Zimmer gibt es einen Tresor, jeden Tag kostenlos zwei Flaschen Fiji-Wasser und kostenlose Chips und Kaffee/Tee. 

Das gesamte Zimmer sowie auch das Badezimmer waren sehr sauber und gepflegt. Die Angestellten waren sehr freundlich und höflich. Einmal wurde der volle Mülleimer erst auf Aufforderung geleert, sowie ein leeres Duschgel ersetzt. Vermutlich wurden beide Sachen beim Zimmer saubermachen übersehen. 

Diese Tatsache, sowie das dunkle und das etwas abgewohnte Zimmer (insbesondere der Teppichboden) in Verbindung mit dem relativ hohen Preis (ew York eben) lassen mich zu der Gesamtwertung von dennoch guten 4 Punkten kommen.

title: Great staff in average hotel
text:
We booked the hotel because of the great reviews but we were disappointed. We checked in late at night to find a note in our room that there would be no running water or toilets from 10am to 5pm the next day.  After traveling for about 30 hours we just wanted to collapse into bed but we had to shower and stockpile water. 
We spoke to a manager and he had been given little warning of the water outage himself. He admitted that they should have thought of the effect on people checking in on the day of the outage. He gave us a free upgrade and took 50% off the price of our first night.
I don't understand the great reviews as the hotel is nothing special. The staff were great. The doorman really helped us out one evening when the taxi we thought we had booked didn't arrive. He went to the main street and hailed a taxi and brought it back to us. It seems that the only way to get a taxi is by hailing them down. A car service can be booked but that is more expensive.
The location of the hotel is a downside unless you want to be in the financial district. Everywhere there is scaffolding because of some regulation about checking the facades of buildings. Apparently it is cheaper to leave the scaffolding up permanently than to take it down and rebuild it when needed.
The booking sites all say that "breakfast is available". This is not true. We should have got in touch with the hotel to check on this as they did not provide a breakfast option.

title: Bon choix !
text:
Bon choix !
Je pourrais m'en tenir à confirmer tous les avis positifs précédents, mais en quelques lignes.
Les + :
- Bonne localisation (proche de nombreuses "attractions" du sud de Manhattan et à quelques pas de la station de métro Fulston très bien desservie)
- Bon service dans son ensemble (attention pas de restaurant et de petit-déjeuner à l'hôtel)
- Des chambres assez spacieuses et modernes (plutôt rare à NY) avec un petit-frigo. Salle de douche plutôt petite. Les chambres à l’arrière sont assez sombres.
- Insonorisation correcte mais perfectible (en réduisant par exemple le bruit de fermeture des portes des chambres)
- Rue calme (peu de trafic) mais avec des bruits permanents de conditionneurs d'air à l’extérieur (fenêtre ouverte ou sur la terrasse).
Les - :
- Notre première chambre avec terrasse donnait à l'arrière de l'immeuble. La terrasse était petite, sombre (tout comme la chambre) et le bruit des conditionneurs d'air de l'hôtel et des immeubles environnant était étourdissant. Fort heureusement, nous avons pu avoir le lendemain une nouvelle chambre avec terrasse à l'avant (la vue était plus dégagée et le bruit moins gênant)
- La froideur à l'accueil d'une des réceptionnistes (les autres étaient très sympathiques et accueillant.e.s)
- un service de navette vers l'aéroport que je ne conseille pas. 
Je conseille, en été, une chambre avec terrasse mais en façade à rue uniquement

title: Favorite NYC hotel yet!
text: We had a great 4 night stay at The Artezen in the Financial District, it’s a lovely hotel. The rooms are small as they always are in NYC but ours was clean, quiet & had a comfortable bed. What makes this hotel stand out is the employees, everyone is extremely kind & helpful most especially Steven & Jonathan. The hotel is steps from the Subway & the Oculus. We plan to make the Artezen our go-to hotel when visiting NYC from now on!

title: Brief but fun stay at the Artezen
text: When I was looking for somewhere to stay, the Artezen caught my eye because it was extremely well-reviewed and not insanely expensive. Great customer service from the minute I stepped out of the Uber. Smooth, efficient check-in. Nicely appointed room (small, but this is Manhattan...). Perhaps best of all for a traveler like me, super close to the metro (Fulton St Station). You can literally exit the hotel and walk across the street to catch the train, with direct lines to Penn Station, Yankee Stadium, etc. Checkout was just as efficient. Highly recommended!

title: Great hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed here recently and were pleasantly surprised by the quality and cleanliness. While the room was small, it had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was well-equipped with high-end details. The door and front desk staff were super friendly and quick to help. There were free water bottles and snacks in the room, which was a nice touch! I would stay here again.

title: An absolute treasure in NYC
text: I stayed here for 4 nights this summer with my son. This hotel was absolutely amazing! The proximity to Fulton Street subway station was a lifesaver and allowed frequent pit stops to our room to cool off. The staff was very welcoming and attentive. Carmelo was especially helpful arranging a ride to the airport when we left. The room was very clean and housekeeping was impeccable with their daily service. We really enjoyed the water and snacks in our room when we returned from a venture. Loved the espresso machine! We chose this hotel for it's great location but will return for the five star service. Thank you to the Artezen for a wonderful time in the city!

title: Excellent!
text: We enjoyed an wonderful stay at the Artezen Hotel. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room was relatively small (Petite Queen) but spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. Fantastic toiletries. Location is excellent, practically all the subway lines  are within easy reach via the Fulton Street hub. Wall Street, World Trade Center, The Oculus, South Street Seaport all quite nearby and within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Very Impressed
text: Came here for a July 4th getaway and to stay in city for Yankee games. Was impressed with this hotel from top to bottom, our stay was 5-stars. First off, it’s location in heart of financial district is superior. Within a 5 min walk to the old World Trade Center site, 5 min walk to Wall Street, and 10 min walk to Battery Gardens where we caught a ferry to the State of Liberty. The check in process was smooth and we had multiple doormen offer to help us bring up our bags. Rooms aren’t overly large but actually on the spacious side for NY standards. Very clean and modern, bathrooms were decorated nicely and provided a sophisticated feel. For the price we got, I cannot  recommend this hotel more

title: Lives up to reviews!
text: This hotel lived up to the hype. It was a great location with friendly staff and a beautiful modern room. Housekeeping was on top of it and I liked the little extras in the room. Location is amazing with easy access to all kinds of food and subways. It’s two blocks from my daughters apartment so it will be our homebase from now on.

title: Pretty much ideal and everything you could want from a city hotel
text:
Traveled for business and stayed a few extra days for fun.  Great location, can walk to the bull statue and a whole host of restaurants and a CVS nearby.

Staff is excellent - quick in and out if you need, and an elongated lobby big enough to have people wait for their uber if needed.

Rooms small but clean and nicely laid out.

title: Good value for Manhattan and wonderful staff
text:
Stayed in 1303 for three nights. This is a small room, king bed, no view, end of hallway on the John Street side. Maximum two people for this room. It's not the smallest room I've had in Manhattan, but at around 200sf it's best for people who will be gone most of the time. 

The hotel is modern and *really* quiet for Manhattan. 

Fantastic staff - every person I encountered was helpful and friendly.

They do charge an additional fee of $12.95/night. This is usually an annoying fee that basically covers wi-fi. But at Artezen you get water and a few snacks, so there's value for the charge.  

The room had a robe, slippers and a steamer (nice surprise). The bedding was good quality and bed comfort was great. The elevators are super fast (even nice hotels seem to have the creakiest elevators). 

There are lights you activate to indicate if you want housekeeping to make up room or if you'd prefer privacy. 

Duane Reade and Fulton station right across the street. Oculus, Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial a quick walk. 

Little things that would be nice: a lighted mirror in the bathroom, as the lighting is not good enough for doing makeup. A coffee maker rather than an espresso maker. Some sort of breakfast offering, even if it was just coffee and fruit. 

I usually stay on UWS but will definitely return to Artezen.

title: Fantastic
text:
Fantastic hotel in walking distance to Ground Zero and the Financial District. Everything is clean and new and, above all, the hotel staff is outstanding!  Real, honest friendliness and helpfulness! Rooms are modern and big enough and very clean with very good beds.
Absolutely recommend! Look no further!

title: Amazing hotel in a wonderful Neighborhood!
text: Our travel agent found this hotel for us, and I have to say it is one of the most wonderful hotels I've ever been in. The staff is outstanding, and I have to give a big shout out to Carmello our Concierge. He was amazing. The rooms were great, and the location was perfect. We were right by one of the main subway hubs, close to Wall street and Battery Park. If you go to NY stay here!

title: Loved it!
text:
Loved it! Will definatelly stay here in the future. All the staff was fantastic, kind and most of them speak spanish. 
Very clean rooms and very safe enviroment for example you need your key to access the upper floors.
Also, great location close by several subway stations.

title: Hidden Gem!
text:
Location⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Staff⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Unrelated to the hotel!!
Trip Advisor make the review section as many characters as you want; I don't need the 200 characters to explain the hotel was great!!!!

title: The perfect hotel (and most lovely people) for your visit to NYC.
text:
Let us start our review by telling you how the Operations Manager went the extra mile to try and help us make our trip to NYC happen (spoiler alert: she succeeded), with all the cancellations and problems we had had due to Covid and lockdowns. To express their empathy for our situation, the hotel even welcomed us with a nice bottle of cold wine. That was the first example of many, from all of the staff, of the extreme professionalism, humanity and courtesy at Artezen.

The location is fantastic, just a few metres from the A train, in the middle of the Financial District. Our room had a delightful view, far from the noise of the city that never sleeps. The bed was gorgeous. 

There is a gym in the building and shops, restaurants and pubs all around - including my beloved Dunkin' Donuts just a few metres away.

Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho on one side to the North; the Brooklyn Bridge and the piers of the South East; Battery Park and the World Trade Center: they're all within walking distance. With the subway, you are a few stops away from anywhere in Manhattan. And at night from the Village, it's no more than a $15 ride with Lyft if you want to take it easy.

If you're planning a visit to NYC, especially for the first time, look no further than this nice place.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: The service at the Artezen was outstanding. Carmelo and Daniel went above and beyond when our ride to the airport didn’t show up. Ben was a whiz with directions, and helped us get where we wanted to go. Everyone at the hotel was outstanding.l would highly recommend The Artezen to anyone who wants a great hotel in NYC

title: Great location, reasonably priced and exceptional customer service.
text:
Pros:  location close to 9/11 Memorial and the seaport.   Reasonably priced.  Nearby convenience stores and a couple of fun restaurants across the street.  Great neighborhood with lots to do within walking distance.  Customer service was wonderful.  Everyone was friendly, patient and accommodating.  The Concierge, Carmelo, is a wealth of useful information, pleasant and fun to talk to.  We were especially appreciative of his advice and info on how to use the subway to get back to the hotel - saved us some money and was a fun experience.  Hotel is a great value if you're planning a trip to this area downtown.

Cons:  Rooms are small, but that's typical for NYC.  View from our room was buildings.  No coffee in the rooms.  There is an espresso machine, but we would have preferred coffee.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: The Artezen made my family's trip to NYC so comfortable. Great location. We easily walked to the Brooklyn Bridge, One World, and Staten Island Ferry. The employees were all kind and helpful. This hotel is kept clean and smells great. The room is freshened up daily. New towels and water left in the room.

title: Cálido y acogedor hotel para visitar Manhattan
text:
Este es el hotel perfecto como centro de operaciones para las vacaciones en Manhattan, la ubicación es magnífica, con acceso a la estación Fulton de metro conectando con todas las líneas, el distrito financiero cuenta con muchas opciones para comer, el servicio es estupendo, las instalaciones son muy nuevas y se encuentra muy bien cuidado, y por último la atención de todo su personal es perfecta, los conserjes muy atentos en todos los detalles.
Sin duda una decisión acertada y muy recomendable.

title: A great hotel
text: We stayed at the Artezen hotel for 6 nights. It is a great location with many places we wanted to visit nearby. We chose a room with a balcony which was great as the weather was good and it was a great place to relax at the end of a hectic day with a bottle of wine and pizza from Pizza Joes round the corner! The staff are all really friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Absolutely wonderful place to stay in NYC. Hotel staff were amazing and very polite. Concierge was super helpful, as well as greeting us coming and going daily. They very able to provide us information in all of our day to day travels. Location is superb to visit many local attractions on foot as well as having many subway stops close. The lobby has a wonderful aroma that permeates into the street when the concierge holds the door open for you. Housekeeping maintained our room with a high level of cleanliness. They were in each day to swap out linens and towels. Every day felt like you were walking in to a freshly cleaned room. I definitely would recommend this hotel!

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Hôtel hyper bien placé à côté des stations de métro à côté de la nouvelle gare l’Occulus et du World Trade Center dans le quartier financier. 
Accueil très bien et chambre faite tous les jours avec bouteille d’eau et capsules de café à disposition. Literie nickel ! pas de bruit la nuit ! 
Personnel à disposition pour vous renseigner et vous appeler taxi ou Uber

title: Rien a redire.
text: Propre calme et bien placé cet hôtel trouvé sur le GDR est un bon choix pour visiter NYC.  Les chambres sont spacieuses et la literie très confortable.Biens équipées ( frigo et cafetière Nespresso). Pas de petits déjeuners lors de notre séjours mais plein d endroits z proximité. Le personnel est accueillant. Situé dans Financial District il est bien desservi par de nombreuses stations de métro. Proche des départs pour la Statue de la Liberté. Du site du 11 septembre et du One World Obseratory. Un bon plan sur place (prévoir une demi journée)  prendre le ferry gratuit pour Staten Island et aller faire un tour au Outlet Factory. (Nike. Banana Republic.et autres .) .Pour bénéficier d'un discount supplémentaire inscrivez  vous sur la mailing liste de la marque au moment de payer.

title: Kathy's client service
text: I travel to NYC for business one week per month and I always stay at the Artezen (I've stayed 8+ times) for one reason, Kathy. Kathy works the front desk and while everyone is friendly, she goes above and beyond to deliver white-glove service. She anticipates needs and always has a smile on her face. An employee like her is very difficult to find. As long as Kathy is around, Artezen will be my preferred NYC hotel.

title: Am exhausted.  Horrible nights sleep.  Noise in the halls during the night for hours
text: Was really looking forward to a NYC visit after 2 yrs of pandemic. Starting with the worst first, basically got no sleep.  Every time a door on the hall  opens or shuts , it is very loud and easily heard. So, from about midnight to 5 am, every time someone entered their room, we were woken. Worst of it, from about 2 am to 5 am, a group with a couple of rooms would leave one room and bang on the door of the other room. So heard the doors, the banging and the loud talking with the doors open. Through the walls, could hear people in another room talking.  Got up feeling horrible, with a headache and exhausted.  Not a great way to start the day for exploring the city. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Bottled water in the room and a couple of bags of chips is nice. Nespresso machine is nice to have. Ipad didn't work.  Dead battery probably.  They will fix it / replace it, but would be nice to have functioning things in the room upon arrival.  Also, clogged sink, which was quickly fixed. Alarm clock was set for 6 am and went off.  Would have been nice if housekeeping had checked for that. Comfortable bed.

title: Gran experiencia en The Artezen Hotel!
text:
Después de más de dos años regresamos a Nueva York con mi esposa, y debo decir que acertamos en elegir este hotel. La estadía fue muy placentera, los aspectos más importantes fueron la ubicación, la limpieza, pero sobretodo la atención espectacular del personal.
De hecho recomiendo este hotel y seguramente será mi elección cuando vuelva a visitar esta hermosa ciudad.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: My family and I stayed at the Artezen from May 19-23. The entire team was amazing. From the front desk and cleaning staff to the concierges and Carmelo, you couldn’t ask for a more dedicated crew. We had a minor baggage mix-up as we were going to the airport and they rectified it immediately. Great location near Fulton and Cortlandt stations. Can't wait til the rooftop patio is open later this summer. Highly recommended!

title: Outstanding value in FiDi.
text: Very clean (room made up every day and fresh towels), enthusiastic staff (even housekeeping) made us feel welcome.  Nice size room (appx 180 Sq ft including bathroom) for Manhattan.  Walk in shower, rain head and wand.  Frette linens and nice towels.  Comfy bed.  Easy access to all subways, ferries.  Extremely friendly and helpful staff.  2elevators, both very fast.  Mini fridge.  Pharmacy, Thai, pub, and market within100 feet of hotel.  Restaurant coming in August.  Very quiet, 5 rooms per floor, never heard neighbors.

title: Lovely Stay with Outstanding Service
text: The Artezen is a quiet oasis in the city.  You will feel refreshed after staying there.  The rooms are finely appointed and the staff is very nice.  The snacks in the room are great too.  I strongly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Doorman / Concierge service is outstanding
text: Artezen hotel is very clean, nicely furnished, has great shower, excellent beds and is located in the heart of the financial district.  The most distinguishing aspect of the Artezen are the Doorman/Concierge.  They were exceptionally helpful, polite, kind, and professional.  Benjamin and Carmello were beyond helpful and kind in helping us to  navigate difficult transportation issues, poor weather, etc.  They are the best we have ever encountered in NY over the years of our travel to the city.

title: Great property
text: Spent one night in a deluxe king with my wife.  Overall, we had a great stay.  The hotel is located on a street with a surprising amount of food options, felt more like the village than the financial district.  Check-in was efficient, staff were friendly.  The rooms were extremely clean, modern, and comfortable - the bed was great.  All in all, hard to imagine doing any better at such a reasonable price point (for NYC)....

title: Excellent customer service and location
text:
What makes this hotel stand out amongst the dearth of hotels in Manhattan? 2 things stand out, excellent customer service and the hotel location which makes it easy to use the subway to go across Manhattan and Brooklyn too.
The customer service was top notch wherein all our questions and needs were addressed appropriately and in a timely manner. Daniel at the front desk/concierge was a delight to interact with. Housekeeping and room services was also very good and no complaints there.
Location wise.... NYSE, Wall street, World Trade Center and 9/11 memorial and all of lower Manhattan/Lower Financial district is all within walking distance from the hotel. Subway lines 4,5,6, J, A, C etc. are easily accessible from the hotel via the nearby subway stations.
Room size? decent room size as per NY standards.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Just came back from here, beautiful hotel and staff couldn't be nicer. The hotel is in easy reach of everything and doormen very helpful and informative. Any requests we had were never too much trouble. I would highly recommend it to NY visitors.

title: Heart of Manhattan
text: Very nice service, location, and building. Their food service menu has decent options and tastes fine, just a bit overpriced for what you get. The doormen are friendly and helpful in getting what you need. They also contract with a dry cleaning service but you have to call it in directly. The 2 waters and coffee I believe was complimentary. They have a fridge as well. It’s super quiet and foot distance to the train station or even just walking to where you need to go (which we did a majority of the time). It took us about an hour and 20 minutes to walk to union square, and 20 minutes from the airport. There’s literally a Duane Reade’s pharmacy across the street and lots of food shops including Dunkin’ Donuts, Carmen’s kitchen, bubble tea, and a smoothie shop, and so much more. The Fulton train station is at the  very edge of the block. There was some construction on the sidewalk so we had to crossover but that’s about it! The room was a bit cramped than what we’re used to (nyc life).

title: A total delight!
text: Best hotel I have ever stayed in in NYC.  I will stay here every time I go.  The room was immaculate and they cleaned it every day if you so desired.  The hotel arranged everything we needed (taxi's, etc.) and even provided free umbrellas during rainy days.  The location is perfect with easy access to the subway to get anywhere that you need to go.  Stay here!

title: Very Nice Staff, Room Small But Well Designed
text: I stayed here one night for business. The staff was very nice -- from the moment I arrived until the moment that I departed. My room was small -- as is so often the case in Manhattan -- but it was well designed and in very good condition. I would stay here again if I had a reason to be in that part of the city.

title: Mother’s Day weekend
text: The artezen hotel was really nice and smell’s good to! Staff is very friendly I loved it! Concierge was very helpful. Good area to find food, shopping and transportation. Different things to see and do.

title: Amazing expérience
text: Hôtel fantastique. Personnel très attentionné. Chambre très propre avec mis à disposition de café et d'eau tous les jours ce qui est tres appréciable. La litterie est de qualité et c'est super après une bonne journée de visite! L'hôtel est très bien situé en face de la station de métro Fulton.  Il est très calme. Tout mes remerciements à l'équipe d'Erica.

title: Artezen, What a Gem !
text: Just stayed 4 nights to spend time with family. The best thing about the Artezen is definitely the staff. They couldn’t be more friendly and inviting every time you walk through the lobby. We loved the scent being diffused in the corridors. Yes, we had to get the details. After staying in the upper West side our last two trips, the location in lower manhattan was a real treat. The Fulton subway station is across the street from the Artezen and from there, you can easily navigate to anywhere you want.  A few close dining options close by, Joe’s pizza of course. It never disappoints. Leo’s bagels down William street toward Wall Street was worth two visits. If you love Mexican food, a 15 min walk to El Vez will not disappoint. To close it all out, they handled car service back to the Airport for 60% of what Lyft was charging. We’ll be back.

title: Lovely hotel
text: My wife and I stayed at the Artezen For 5 days in April. The rooms are small but nice, the hotel is clean and comfortable and the people are the best. Everyone that worked at the Artezen is friendly and tries to doe his best for you. We enjoyed it very much.

title: The place to stay in the FiDi
text: My wife and I stayed at the Artezen at the end of March, beginning of April. The rooms are small but nice, the hotel is clean and comfortable and the people are the best. Everyone that worked at the Artezen treated us as family - whether it was a sincere "welcome back", to a "what can I help with", to little extras for the room to tips on the weather and the neighborhood - nothing was too much trouble. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Artezen and will be staying there agin on our next trip bck to The City.

title: Great Hotel
text: Excellent hotel, excellent service, excellent staff with a pleasant attitude who are always happy to help.  I will definitely be back there on my next visit to New York.  I would love to especially mention Daniel, a lovely employee who helped and always with a smile, thank you.

title: Quiet and Close To Everything You Need
text: Traveling for over 15 years to NYC annually and this was our first stay in the Financial District. What a fantastic gem right on the same street we used to come and enjoy Bourdain's Les Halles restaurant. Quiet, well-appointed rooms, and close to several subway lines, grocery stores, and delicious ramen right next door for take-out. We walked to SoHo, Chelsea, over the Brooklyn bridge from the hotel and enjoyed the neighbourhood. If you arrive early, you can freshen up and store your luggage. Special thanks to Joseph for assisting with our luggage and arranging a taxi to EWR. We will be back!

title: Hidden gem
text:
Found this hotel via Google while looking for 1 night accommodation close to Brooklyn Bridge and WTC memorial. The price seemed too good to be true given the high prior review scores. 

But the hotel indeed proved to be an absolute gem! Well run, super helpful staff, room almost twice the size what I expected in NYC for under 200$! Excellent sleep quality as sound proofing was good and bed massive and comfortable. Complimentary bottled water and snacks were a nice touch!

Fulton St subway Station is literally dozen steps from the hotel entrance, providing excellent transport options.

The consierge was also super helpful and made us feel very welcome from the moment we stepped out of our taxi.

title: This hotel -- in an extremely crowded location -- offers a small, clean room
text:
The Good - 
Close to NYC Ferry and Fulton Street subway station
Some of the hotel staff were professional and/or helpful
The housekeeping staff supplied new towels, each day, and kept the room clean

The Bad -
Fulton Street and the surrounding area is a crowded, schlocky area
Some of the hotel staff were rude, unhelpful and barely made eye contact
Even though we are living in a pandemic, there were no masks in sight -- staff and guests routinely crammed themselves into the 2 small elevators

The Ugly -
The hotel staff recommended a car service that went to JFK.  Using that service was the worst experience.  The driver did not appear to know how to use signal lights; he constantly fishtailed; spent the entire trip fiddling with his cell phone, and nearly slammed into a concrete barrier.  If alcohol was not the cause, it's possible that he never drove a car before.

title: Hotel perfecto
text:
Un acierto de Hotel. Estuvimos en dos habitaciones en unas vacaciones familiares.  Creo que acertamos plenamente. Buscábamos un hotel que no estuviera cerca de Times Square para evitar el ruido  y, el Arte Zen cumplió todas nuestras espectativas: un buen hotel, con un personal amable, (especial mención a Carmelo), con la estación de metro enfrente, por donde pasan casi todas las líneas, zona segura y tranquila. Al lado de Wall Street.
En fin muy recomendable

title: My bday trip
text:
Amazingly cute hotel . Staff was great and professional.  Clean and cozy . They were able to check me in early so i got to enjoy more of the day
 No complains , was very pleased with my stay  Will definitely be coming back!

title: Great hotel for downtown
text: Great hotel, clean, friendly and attentive team. Probably only had one grumpy experience the whole stay. The rooms were well equipped, and had plenty of space, we even had a small terrace to relax on. Cold water was a great touch and if you are needing to be in downtown, you couldn’t want more. If your planning to visit midtown, get subway at Fulton st it’s really easy

title: Excelente Hotel Boutique - Super recomendable
text:
Estuvimos 7 noches en nuestro primer viaje a NYC. Familia de 4 adultos.
Hotel Boutique nuevo. Gran ubicación a 80 mts de la Estación de Subte Fulton St (muchas líneas pasan por ahí). 
Habitación y baño muy bonitos, de buen tamaño para NYC con excelente acustica (no se escuchan ruidos externos o internos).
Los colchones y almohadas (los mejores que he probado en un hotel) junto con las sábanas son EXCELENTES y te aseguran un gran descanso. Los elementos de cortesia (jabon, shampo, etc) y las toallas / toallones y batas también excelentes.
En la habitación hay una heladera pequeña pero de gran ayuda, una cafetera Nespresso y reposición de capsulas y 2 botellas de agua diarias..
El hotel se completa con un equipo humano genial. Desde las personas de recepción o que están en la puerta de acceso, hasta la gente de limpieza. Siempre cordiales, dispuestos a ayudar. Además muchos de ellos hablan español. Hotel 100% recomendable..
Nota: En la misma cuadra, o cuadras cercanas hay muchas opciones para desayunar / almorzar o cenar, incluyendo supermercados con comida buffet.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Un accueil très très agréable et chaleureux (  je suis arrivée à 1h du matin ), la chambre était propre, nettoyée tous les jours, grande et très spacieuse pour Manhattan, avec des bouteilles d'eau offertes tous les jours. 

Très bien situé pour visiter le centre et le sud de Manhattan, à peine à 10 minutes à pied du Brooklyn Bridge et de nombreuses lignes de métro au pied de l'hôtel. Parfait !!

title: Great stay!
text: Wow! So impressed with my stay here. My friends and I booked several rooms for a vacation and all of us were happy with our stays. Not only was the hotel visually appealing, but It smelled amazing and was maintained super well. Very clean rooms and common areas. The hotel staff was superb!!! Best I’ve ever experienced. Carmelo and Daniel really made our trip. Such professionals and did the most to accommodate us and make us comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing service, amazing stay!
text:
This place was phenomenal. I had stayed in a midtown hotel the day prior to shifting to this hotel. The midtown one was fine (compared to other midtown ones I have been in!) but this FiDi hotel CHANGED.THE.GAME. I will never stay in midtown again! For the cost and service this hotel gave, and the space I received, I could not have gotten that in any other hotel north of FiDi. The front desk service reps were great, and I have NEVER had faster room/guest services in my life. Literally right after calling for extra towels, they were outside my door.

And did I mention the space????!! SOOO much space for NYC. SO much. Rarely do you have more than a foot to walk around the bed. Not the case at the Artezen! You have at least 6-10 feet! Unheard of.

Thank you Artezen for making my stay lovely. I will be seeing you soon!

title: Great Stay in New York
text:
We really like this hotel. Excellent location! Walking distance to important sites as Ground Zero, South Seaport, and many others. Comfortable rooms. Great staff! This will be our first choice for a future stay. Highly recommended.
Thank you Carmelo for your excellent recommendations!!!!

title: Convenience, cleanliness and friendliness
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Artezen and were greeted by unpretentious, friendly and professional staff.  Our room  was small, but clean and bright and most importantly had a very comfortable bed and great shower!  The extra amenities were appreciated as it is always nice to start your day with an espresso in bed.
The location was fantastic for us.  It was in the Financial District - so close to Wall Street, Seaport, 9/11 Museum, Oculus and to walk the Brooklyn Bridge.  We also walked to Soho and Tribeca.
Every time we returned to the hotel we were welcomed with friendly greetings.
I was a bit concerned about the area when I drove up, but was surprised by the choice of coffee shops, bars, sushi bars and just how walkable the area was for us.
We will be back.

title: Great stay
text: The Artezen was a nice and cozy stay in the middle of downtown Manhattan. Although my girlfriend and I only stayed there for one night I cannot say enough about the wonderful customer service Carmelo provided. It started off with funny banter back and forth then he gave us an amazing list of recommendations of things to do and places to eat around the city. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Séjour très agréable. L'hôtel est bien situé à proximité directe de plusieurs lignes de métro, pas dans le quartier le plus animé mais de ce fait plutôt calme et sûr. 
Chambre confortable, bien insonorisée, bonne literie. Chambre très propre et personnel agréable.

title: An amazing hotel!
text: This hotel is outstanding. The staff is friendly and attentive. It’s a great location that is quiet yet close to the subway to get anywhere you need to go quickly and it feels very safe. The price is right too! Highly recommend and would stay again. Thanks so much to the entire staff for making our stay amazing!

title: Fantastic Hotel, one of the best Ive ever stayed in New York!
text: I flew in for business. I had some important packages sent for work. The hotel received and had everything waiting in my room when I arrived. All the staff were friendly and helped me out any way I needed. World class service and accommodations. Will definitely be staying again.

title: Immaculate Hotel & Incredible staff… A MUST VISIT!
text: I recently spent my birthday weekend here and my only regret was that I didn’t stay longer!  Upon entering the hotel, you are met with the warmest of welcomes as the staff is extremely upbeat and attentive. The decor in the reception is beautiful making you that much more eager to get to your room. Luckily check in is quick and painless, before you know it you’re enjoying you’re own little slice of paradise. Sinking into the most comfortable mattress that will make you forget you have dinner reservations. I can’t wait to go back and if you haven’t been, what are you waiting for?

title: Supresa agradável
text: Fiquei alguns dias no hotel e gostei bastante. Achei muito bom o custo/benefício! Serviço muito bom. Os funcionários são cordiais. A localização é ótima, pois fica perto de uma estação de metrô gigante. O quarto é espaçoso e limpo. Conseguimos fazer late check out… Recomendo.

title: The loveliest stay for our NYC elopement!
text: A huge thank you to the wonderful staff at the Artezen, particularly Carmelo, for making our stay so memorable. We travelled early December from Ireland for our city hall wedding just as the restrictions were being lifted. Our room was spotless, modern and spacious by Manhattan standards, with some nice touches. Friends contacted the hotel and staff arranged Moet and balloons for our room, and gave us advice on booking various aspects of the wedding. Location is excellent, a couple of minutes walk from Fulton St station, and actually within walking distance of many, many NY attractions. A super stay!

title: A terrific hotel, a great staff
text:
A fabulous hotel that is run by a terrific staff. We arrived at the hotel on a Friday morning, way before check in time (about10:00 AM). Chis the doorman greeted us hardily with a great smile.  Carmelo, the hotel concierge was right there to greet us as well.  We knew that our room would not be ready, but Carmelo checked in our bags to hold and offered the use of a restroom to freshen up. A real touch of class and service. The front desk took our telephone number and would call us when our room was ready.  Off we went to the Bronx Zoo with no worries.  Sure enough, around 1:00 PM, the hotel called to let us know they were ready for us when we ready to check in.   

When we checked in around around 6:00P, the evening staff was as friendly, professional and pleasant as the morning staff.  Anthony processed our credit card, explained where the ice machine was located, the workout room, wifi information, exactly what was going to be charged to my credit card. Our room was on the 12th floor.  What I was impressed with was that there was the doorman, and three staff members that stood between the main entrance and the elevator leading to guest rooms.  We have stayed in nice boutique hotels in NYC FiDi where there is one clerk on duty, who doesn't even look up when a person enters the lobby, and the elevator is right by the front door.  And the elevators require the use of your room key card to work...going up....and down (so if you get ice...take your keycard. I'm glad I saved myself embarrassment). 

The common areas, lobby and guest room were very clean.  The only two things that kept me from giving the 5th star were minor, but this is a new hotel and these should have been attended to right away.  If the small, minor things aren't fixed right away, maintenance  problems get bigger.  The foldable luggage rack had a broken leather strap.  It's minor, but noticeable. The second was that there was only one bottle of body gel for the shower. It was empty.  Jump out of shower all wet to grab the bar of soap.  

The plus side is that the windows do open, and the weather was very, very warm for the weekend we were there, and we had fresh air.  There are plenty of USB connections to charge all of your devices. There is an in room safe to store your valuables, a small refrigerator to keep beverages, etc.   

If you arrive by subway, the Fulton St. Center is a larger MTA subway hub.  It's serviced by several lines: A,C,J,Z,2,3,4,5 lines. There are a lot of connecting underground walk ways connecting all the lines.  If you find your way to the main hub/lobby area at Broadway and John St., the hotel is just across the street from the John St. entrance/exit.   

This hotel's staff show that they are truly people oriented and care about making you feel welcomed and important. I will definitely consider staying again when we return to NYC later this year.

title: Definitely consider staying here
text: Friendly helpful staff. We were allowed to check in one hour early, which was convenient. Our room on the 14th floor was quiet, clean, cozy, and comfortable. We're always looking for a quiet place to stay and this certainly fit our needs. We appreciated the daily complimentary bottles of water (included as part of the "resort" fee). The location was convenient for users of the Subway and close proximity to Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 Memorial, and the financial district. But many places are closed in this area during the weekend. The only downside of the room was that the pillows were really uncomfortable. My husband found the room to be on the small side, but for me it was fine. The bathroom was nice, small, but with a great shower; however the sliding doors are placed in a way such that water leaks out onto the tile floor (depending on shower head direction). Overall we recommend this hotel and hope to return.

title: Great place for visiting NYC
text:
The Artezen was the perfect place for my wife and I to see New York. You are just down the street from the Oculus, the World Trade Center Memorial, and other "must-do" financial district places. Getting uptown is easy, too. The subway is around the corner and a quick 15-20 minute ride to anywhere you need to be. When you're done, you can get out of the full hustle-and-bustle of Times Square and relax in a very comfortable room. We had a deluxe King and it was perfect for the two of us.

A special shout-out the the staff, particularly Carmello. The staff was quick to help find a good spot to eat, get transportation around town, and a wealth of knowledge of the area, in addition to just being efficient in the check-in and check out process. Carmello helped arrange roses and champagne (and the evening staff executed the plan!)  in our room after we returned from my wife's birthday dinner. 

This is my first TripAdvisor review. I've enjoyed hotels before, but this one checked all the boxes of luxury, comfort, location, and a helpful, friendly staff. We will be back!

title: Amazing level of service!
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Artezen.  The staff was helpful, responsive, and always pleasant!  The hotel is clean and modern.  We were very comfortable and so happy that we chose this hotel.  I left an article of clothing in my hotel room when I checked out and the staff was so helpful in recovering it.

title: Overall an upstanding hotel with great service
text:
We were first impressed by the level of courtesy and attention from the doorman. Each time we left we met a different gentleman working at the door but they were always helpful and provided recommendations in the area. The hotel was clean, modern, and quiet. The front desk responded quickly and courteously to our requests. Located in the financial district, a walk away from the subway, wall street and the 9/11 memorial. The room was quite small, but probably not unusual for Manhattan. 

The only concern I had was with housekeeping - my luggage was unzipped when we returned after the room having been cleaned. I am thorough to make sure my suitcase is fully zipped and tucked away when I leave a hotel room, so I was quite surprised and concerned that it had clearly been opened. Luckily, nothing had been taken. My boyfriend had also put one of the hotel toiletries in his toiletry bag which was left open on the counter. When we returned that small bottle of lotion had been removed from his bag and put back on the counter with the replenished shampoos, etc. Kind of strange.

title: Thank you Carmelo
text:
Très bonne accueil et grand professionnalisme de notre concierge Carmelo, nous le remercions pour sa générosité et son sourire.
Hôtel très confortable dans un cadre agréable , bien situé au cœur du quartier d’affaire et bien desservi par les transports.

title: Excellent Choice
text: We were here the week of December 14.   The hotel is small and hidden away in Deep South Manhattan — all the better.   Quiet, and clean, with a very attentive and friendly staff.  The subway is across the street, and it goes everywhere.   We will be back.

title: Well located.
text: Modern and clean. Excellent Staff! Wish the A/c was more effective in cooling the room😊. Had to open the window to cool down. Overall a great experience. Close to popular attractions and the subway. Great restaurants nearby. Will revisit this hotel

title: Wonderful located hotel with incredible people!
text: Our stay at the Artezen Hotel was easy and comfortable with a great location to walk to so many sights in NYC.  Manager Francisco made our arrangements an ease and our arrival was made easy with their bellboy George.  The concierge, Carmelo was so knowledgeable about surrounding restaurants, parking, taxi services, outings and sightseeing making our days filled with fun things to do!  I highly recommend The Artezen Hotel for anyone who wants a good stay in NYC!

title: The hotel is outstanding but the staff makes it special.
text:
For the Thanksgiving holiday I spent a week at the Artezen.  Everything about this boutique hotel was enjoyable but I particularly enjoyed the staff who went out of their way to make sure my stay was a pleasant one.  The concierge, Joseph, and house keeper, Liliana, called me by name, and offered assistance.  
After numerous stays at the Artezen, my family already considers this our "go to hotel" in NYC.

title: Great Service!
text: I have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and I love here. The location is excellent (easy access to the subways) and the room is clean. Specially, the service is incredible. I lost a pair of shoes in the room and I already checked out, and they just helped me ship my shoes to my home! I feel safe and they are just so reliable. Big thanks to Erica!

title: Incredible Stay All Around
text:
You would think being down in the financial district may be out of the way but you would be WRONG. Subway access is a 2 minute walk away. Takes you anywhere you want to be in NYC faster than Uber or Taxi and a fraction of the cost. If you are not a Subway person - Uber and Taxi friendly. But for me Subway is the way to travel and part of the NYC experience.

Which brings me to the staff. Friendly is just the start! Incredibly helpful and welcoming. About as good as they come in NYC.

Rooms are well appointed. Great Furniture. COMFY Bed and Linens. The hotel is modern, comfortable, accessible - everything you want in a NY Hotel Room.

I highly recommend this hotel for Leisure or Business. And there is tons to do and see in the area of the hotel. Not to mention too many places to eat a great meal.

Stay here and enjoy NY the way it should be...

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text:
We loved the location, the staff were very kind and helpful
Our room was very comfortable and quite. Room was done everyday. Staff offered great suggestions for food etc. 
George was amazing.
Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Bravo
text: I don’t leave many reviews, but my stay at the Artezen was so enjoyable I felt the need to post this. The staff and doormen are a credit to the hotel, my king room was spotless and quiet. I’ve stayed in many NYC hotels and this was the best by far. Location is unbeatable, with popular pizza, Japanese and Korean take-out places nearby and steps away from multiple subway lines. The Irish American bar across the road is great for a solo traveller like myself looking for a drink and bite to eat.

title: Outstanding NYC Gem
text: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Artezen.  The staff was excellent, they went above and beyond in making sure I had everything I needed. They were kind, responsive, caring, super helpful and informative. They stood out to me, particularly George the Doorman, Carmelo the Concierge, and the ladies at the front desk - Kathy, Jennifer and Michele. Also, the rooms are modern and very clean, love all the white, and the bed was so incredibly comfortable. And the location is great, blocks away from the Oculus and World Trade Center and Freedom Tower. The Artezen is the perfect boutique hotel that makes you feel immediately at home. I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Almost
text:
We really want to give them five stars, but it just didn't feel like five stars.  With one small exception, the staff was delightful.  The bed was insanely comfortable.  The location cannot be beat.  The patio is a rare treat.
But...
The room doors closed very loudly.  The shower was never completely cleaned.  The laptop safe door didn't open all the way, making it impossible to get our laptop in it.

Yes, one can do much worse than this hotel, but it feels like it isn't quite what it could be.

title: Great gem
text: The service at this hotel was efficient and wonderful. It’s a great place to stay, super comfy beds and linens, bathrooms were big for nyc, and everyone was so friendly. It’s very close to the train station and cute little restaurants near by and easy access to the airport

title: Modern and convenient hotel in financial district
text: Had found the hotel via T.A. prior to Covid and was impressed by the enthusiastic reviews. Unfortunately, our trip had to be cancelled.  Working with Erica, a manager at the hotel, was like a dream. Helpful, quick to respond, easy to talk to. Thankfully, we were able to re-schedule our visit and we have only positive things to say about our exerience.  A very friendly, yet professional staff are there, willing to help with any questions, needs. The hotel itself is new, modern, clean, comfortable, and very conveniently located at the hub of subway lines in lower Manhattan. It's just so easy to get wherever you're going. We can wholeheartedly recommend the Artezen!

title: Phenomenal staff/service!
text: In-room refrigerator and complimentary FIJI bottled water was a huge plus!  Exceptionally clean bathroom with incredibly soft towels!  Just be prepared that the rooms are SMALL.  Ask for an upgrade--it's definitely worth the extra sq. ft.  Joseph, Jonathan and Steven at the Front Door (Bellman) were FABULOUS as were the ladies at the desk.

title: My Fabulous stay at the Artezen Hotel
text:
The hotel staff are very friendly and professional from the moment I arrived to the moment I check-out and left the hotel to enter my taxi ride to the airport and in between my stay!!!!! I will remember Kathy and Jonathan at the front desk and Jhonathon, Steven, Joseph, George and Carmelo all of these folks were great!!!
I will be using this hotel for all my travels to NYC!!!

title: Nice hotel with friendly personel
text: This is the second time we stay at the Artezen. The rooms are comfy and very clean. Nice and friendly staff. Good location very close to a big metro station, shops and restaurants. I think for the price is a good deal.

title: Great Staff
text: The staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Steven at the front desk was especially helpful. Thank you Steven!  The hotel is clean, modern and up to date with good towels, pillows and a fan that works well in the bathroom.  This will be our go to hotel wen visiting NYC.

title: Fulfilled the expectatives
text: We chose this hotel thanks to past reviews. We felt welcomed since the very beginning by Carmelo and the hotel staff. Carmelo goes the extra mile and takes great care of the guests. Love the Nespresso machine and all the room amenities. Great location in lower Manhattan. Requested a higher floor and gave me a second floor with a partial view of a construction scaffold with trash on it and a door opening towards a column that makes it uneasy to exit the room.

title: Perfect little hotel in a great location!
text: We loved being walking distance to the 9/11 Museum and Brooklyn  Bridge.  We had a 2 queen bed room.  The room was nice and clean.  Carmelo was very helpful in giving us tips on where to get good coffee and food.  They even had umbrellas for us when it was raining.  All of the staff was amazing!

title: Can recommend this hotel.
text: Hotel is 3 years old, great location in the Financial District although construction is all around. One of the best parts of this hotel is Carmelo, concierge. He’s a great source of information & very personable. Front desk staff were also friendly & helpful.

title: Will be staying here again!
text: My husband and I just spent the second half of our honeymoon in NYC and I’m so glad we stayed at The Artezen! Friendliest staff I’ve ever met, rooms were fantastic, and it was a great location close to a lot of the things we came to NYC for. We will definitely be staying there again the next time we’re in the area.

title: THE ARTEZEN  High Marks!!
text:
Absolutely wonderful hotel near south street seaport. Everyone that is employed in this building deserves praise. All  caring  and helpful staff. Carmelo is an asset. Perfect stay. You won’t be disappointed.  
Rooftops bar is being added that should be finished for the holidays with music food and exclusive to hotel guests only!!

title: Exceptional experience
text:
We stayed at the Artezen over the weekend to visit the 9/11 Memorial and to visit friends. The location is great as there are restaurants & shopping nearby as well as the subways. The room was spotless with nice amenities like free snacks, Nespresso coffee & water. 
The Concierge, Carmelo & assistant George were super helpful, knowledgeable & friendly. This was our first time staying there. We visit NYC often for business & we will definitely return to the Artezen. We highly recommend it.

title: Absolutely Fantastic Stay. Felt Like Home
text:
It has been a month and a half since my guests and I stayed at the Artezen. Despite the length of time that has passed, it has meant a great deal to me to make sure I post a review of my excellent stay. 

My guests from out of state and out of town and I stayed in 2 of Artezen's rooms for three days/two nights, end of July into August 2021. Our experience was simply fantastic.  We were all made to feel comfortable and respected as guests immediately entering the hotel and throughout our stay.  

The check-in was smooth, the employees were kind and conscientious. Zero pompous attitude. 
The wonderful manager, Francesco, was so truly awesome and had such amazing patience and a great attitude. He welcomed us to the hotel in such a sincere way, and even kindly kept a lookout for my car, to make sure it didnt get a ticket as I checked me and my guests into the hotel (I  was on a real time crunch and had no choice but to briefly stick my car in a loading zone). He was truly so helpful! 

To make matters better, I overheard the manager tell a guest that he was going to clean his room to prepare it for what seemed like an unexpected check-in. The guest asked if the room cleaning personel were available.  Francesco sweetly told the guest that as the manager, he is willing to do everything needed for his guests. Wow. This made my day.

My guests and I all loved the rooms and felt very comfortable. The rooms were clean, the furniture stylish, atmosphere peaceful.  I stayed in my own room and it was wonderful. The bathroom, sheets, table, everything, was clean and appealing. 

My bed was literally - literally - the most comfortable bed I have EVER  slept on in a hotel. EVER.  My body melted into the sheets and the mattress. I was exhausted and this amazing room allowed me to get rest that I really needed. It was definitely a home away fron home, and I do not say this lightly. 

Joseph was terrific and at my request, twice arranged  car service for my guests.  Despite mutiple phone calls back and forth that were needed to get the arrangements done, he remained patient at every call.

The young lady at the front desk at checkout  (sorry that I forgot your name) was very sweet and made nit just my stay but my departure great too. Who does that?? She did!

From the young doorman to management, everyone I dealt with was professional, always respectfully referred to me by name, and made my experience the number one best hotel stay I have ever had. I have zero complaints and in fact, this hotel experience exceeded all of my expectations. The level of service at this hotel is the definition of top-notch. 

By the way, the hotel location is great! There are blocks of stores, restaurants, and all kinds of eateries accessible by foot just by stepping out of the hotel.  A 15-minute walk will take you to the South Street Seaport.
The area around the hotel is fantastic. There are restaurants, stores, everywhere and accessible just by exiting the hotel and walking on the block or across the street. A 15 minute walk will get you the South Street Seaport.

Without a doubt, this hotel high quality, high standards, and now for me, a home away from home. Can't wait to stay there again.

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: Great location in the financial district.  Staff was very friendly, including Carmelo in concierge.  They also offer a shuttle option to the airport which was very convenient and affordable.  Hotel is close to many of the great neighborhoods.

title: 20th Anniversary of 9/11
text: We knew nothing of NYC, and just guessed at a place to stay close to the Memorial but affordable (for nyc).  We were incredibly blessed at our stay at the Artezen. The customer service was awesome, the place was super clean, and Carmelo and the rest of the concierge folks were the icing on the cake. Our heart felt thanks for helping us remember this special time for NYC, our Country- while not having to worry about a thing, was awesome.

title: Perfect
text: NYC overwhelms me.  I used to live there, but the city has changed almost beyond recognition.  This trip I chose the Artezen, and from now on, this is where I'lll stay.  (My only hesitation is making it more popular.)  It is small, personal, and super clean.  The concierge staff is ever-ready to help with subways, directions, hire cars. (Thank you, Carmelo and George!)   Room, bathroom pleasant.  Security strong.  Fulton Station is a block away which makes Manhattan and Brooklyn very accessible.   I will be back.

title: Great location and wonderful staff!
text:
Booked 2 nights at the Artezen with my sister based on reviews and we were not disappointed. We specifically wanted to stay near the 911 Museum and it was just a short walk away. It was also just steps away from the subway so we were easily able to jump on to visit family in Queens. 

The customer service was THE BEST! They were so accommodating to requests and helpful with information. I will definitely book again.

title: Clean, quiet, comfortable and excellent location!
text: All the staff at the Artezen were exceptional and made for a fantastic experience. The rooms were quiet (only around 5 rooms per floor, so much less hallway noise than many other hotels) and clean. Great location to easily access many attractions nearby either by foot or nearby metro stops (Fulton St., Cortlandt). Many eating options nearby as well - would highly recommend Joe's Pizza and Zuckers Bagels (just a block away) if you're looking for a great quick meal. We will absolutely be coming back to stay at the Artezen the next time we're in NYC.

title: Amazing staff and great hotel
text: From the minute we walked in and Carmelo greeted us, we knew we chose a great hotel. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. The room met all of our needs, was immaculate, and the bed was very comfortable. Close to the subway, walking distance to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, and multiple little shops to fill your needs near by. Highly recommend.

title: New York favorite!
text: This is my 2nd time staying at The Artezen & I was happy to be back. The rooms are so clean, the upgraded bedding is so soft, the rain shower was amazing & the doormen, Carmelo & Joseph were helpful!!

title: Excellent service!
text:
Carmelo and George made the stay. The extra level of service and kindness from the moment we walked in the door had us feel like we were social elites. We are going back because of them.
 Carmelo in particular is very knowledgeable, connected and personable. He will help you find a great time whatever you are looking for. He made us feel safe and welcome and as two young queer women this is so important! 
the room and amenities were are a great value. Clean comfortable and convenient. But what makes us want to come back is the wonderful staff.

title: Concierge with a smile
text: From check-in to check-out it was seamless. Beautiful room with comfortable bed. Convenient location to local attractions. The best part was the concierge Carmelo.  He made us feel at home and assisted us tremendously with a big smile!  We will definitely be back.

title: Improvements needed
text:
We stayed there for only two nights and experienced very opposite service quality. The front desk staff could be friendly or distant, courteous or « dry ». The only person who showed some genuinely warm attitude was the Concierge on our check out day. 

The bed and bathroom are quite clean, we would have enjoyed more the very quiet A/C if it was not blowing directly on our heads. 

There was plenty of storage space even under the bed. The bathroom is equipped with heavenly shower head and decent toiletries. 

Outside the streets were relatively calm at nighttime, and inside we loved the soothing effects of « Golden Bamboo », the subtile fragrance diffused all over Artezen Hotel.

title: Good hotel
text: Clean hotel , good and quick service in a good area of Manhattan. Close to nobu , Wall Street and other good dinner spots. King sized rooms are spacious and clean. Would recommend this hotel for couples and friends.

title: Great trip to NYC
text: The hotel is great! Close to most everything in South Manhattan and in a quieter area. All staff were great and Carmelo is phenomenal and a wealth of information. I could not recommend this place more!

title: AWESOME SAUCE
text:
This was a sweet hotel !! It was very uniquely decorated with an amazing staff !! The rooms were very nice clean cute and they smelled good too. Carmelo was an excellent concierge; always had great info and very nice !!!
We really enjoyed our trip to New York and would stay at The Attezen again !!!

title: Chic,  spotlessly clean, modern, with easy access to transportation
text:
My husband and I chose this hotel for an anniversary trip to New York.  As we can’t travel abroad safely, we figured that New York would give us an international feeling.  We found the hotel perfect for us.  We were greeted with smiles and cold bottles of water.  Although check-in wasn’t until 3, there was a room ready for us early.  We just loved our room!  Although small, the layout was clever and mirrors gave a feeling of more space, as did the beautiful floor to ceiling windows.  Decor was muted and modern.  The air conditioning, so essential in these dog days of August, worked beautifully.  The room was very quiet.  The bed was comfortable and the Frette linens were absolutely amazing…so smooth and comfortable!  A desk and chair, a fridge, and snacks, bottled water and coffee (although it was Nespresso, which we don’t care for) were waiting for us.  For people like us, who like regular coffee, there is a nice little breakfast spot directly across the street called “Toasties”.  We got coffee and breakfast sandwiches there daily.  Toiletries were of high quality.  We were on the 17th floor, but found the elevator quick and smooth.  

You can get anywhere from this hotel on the subway.  You need only walk a half a block to a huge “station”, which is much more than I would have expected.  You can find excellent chains there, escalators, and elevators.  We took the subway to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Chinatown, the Meatpacking District and Washington Heights.  

Our room, with its excellent shower and plush towels, was our oasis with this very hot summer weather.  Cool, clean, modern and comfortable, we found the Artezen a perfect choice!

title: Very nice!
text:
We booked this hotel to enjoy part of a vacation week we had at the end of July. We had stayed a couple of nights in Brooklyn and wanted to be based in Manhattan for a couple of nights. The Financial District often has good deals on quality hotels and the deal for this property was no exception.

We had a relatively easy drive over from Brooklyn and found the hotel. There was some scaffolding up, so it may have been difficult for someone to find the property. John Street is quite narrow and between outdoor dining setups and parking only on one side, there was no real loading zone for the hotel. I was able to idle in a spot reserved for City employees and dropped my wife with some of our bags. I called the hotel to ask about their parking garage and they gave me the name and address of where to park. Google maps led me astray and I had to call again and this time got better directions to the garage. I walked a couple of blocks from the garage to the hotel and checked in. The hotel was well-staffed with three employees working the front desk and a concierge. Our room was not ready, so the concierge checked our bags and the front desk staff offered us bottled water and keys to use the bathroom while we were waiting for our room. The staff was always very courteous and well-meaning, but did not properly activate the key for the elevator and bathroom, so we had to call for help. Luckily they came right away and got us where we needed to go.

We ended up going out to lunch and came back later for our room. This time we were able to check in and had no trouble getting to our room. The room was quite spacious and very well appointed, especially for NYC. The queen bed was opposite the doorway and faced a big screen TV which had a fridge, desk, pre-programmed tablet, water, chips, cookies, and a coffee maker underneath. The hotel charged a small resort fee for the in room snacks and water, but it was worth it considering we would have bought multiple bottles of water every day. The bathroom was also well-appointed with a large shower and good sized sink area. Central air conditioning was controllable by a wall-mounted thermostat and directed air towards the bed. Next to the bed was a window with a south-facing view.

We slept very well both nights and everything was in working order in the room. The water bottles we had used were replaced the next day, but we did not receive any other housekeeping services. If that was the protocol due to COVID, that is fine, but I would have preferred that was explained to us. We used the gym one day, which had free weights, a couple of cardiovascular machines, and a multi-purpose weightlifting machine. There was also a separate yoga room. The weightlifting machine was a little difficult to use and was broken for some exercises.  We made do with the exercises that were available.

We checked out on the final morning and once again stored our bags as we were not quite ready to leave. They were willing to store our bags, but the concierge said something about coming back before 5:00PM. We were going to leave well before that, but it would have been nice to have the option to stay a little later if we really wanted to. We came back to retrieve our bags and walked to get our car from the garage. The hotel negotiated a discount rate with the garage as long as you give the hotel the ticket upon check-in and they give you a sticker. If I hadn’t needed the car for the first part of the trip, I wouldn’t have brought it. The subway and PATH trains are accessible right across the street from the hotel.

Overall, I would definitely stay here again given the good rates they were offering and having a safe and quiet stay.

title: I Found a Gem in NYC!
text: Amazing hotel! I was in NY for a night to visit our NY office. The rooms are clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff is pleasant and accommodating. I plan to have our DC staff stay here when they visit NYC.

title: Amazing stay in NYC! Definitely will come back!
text:
Amazing Stay! Great location! Super nice rooms and above all the nicest staff! Especially Paul at the door. This was the first trip in a while. Everything was super clean and cared fir.
We felt safe and almost at home in this amazing City. The staff were super friendly and always attentive to our needs.

title: Perfect NYC Stay!
text: I really enjoyed the 3 nights we stayed at this hotel. We arrived late and were super tired and they made check in a breeze, took our bags while we parked, and got us into our room ASAP. The location was perfect as we were going to an immersive art experience near the piers and we walked everywhere we wanted to go. Super close to some good nightlife and historic bars and a quick walk to Brooklyn bridge and the Fulton st. subway. I would definitely stay  again. Staff was friendly and willing to answer questions which made things very easy.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Great place, we stayed for one night but the room was very clean and spacious (especially for NYC). It was also an excellent value for the money. The staff was also very nice and helpful! It’s on a narrow street so the parking directions on the website were very helpful.

title: 5 star reviews are true.
text:
Review from a picky and skeptic traveler.
Área: a very short walk to trinity church, Wall Street, the WTC memorial. Fulton street MTA hub is huge and has pretty much every train line, it’s directly across hotel. John street is narrow, so when you pull in, you’ll have to hop car on the side walk so you can drop off luggage. Parking lot a short drive away, but ask for directions because it’s easy to miss as the streets are super narrow and unlabeled. Numerous fast food within a block. 
Hotel lobby: small, but Extremely clean, it smells very pleasant. Concierge very helpful. Check in was easy. You need a room card to access elevators. If you arrive early they’ll give you a card for the bathrooms. Hallways are narrow but not a problem at all. Wheelchairs fit. 
Room: reviews are correct in saying small. However that means smaller than most hotel rooms. We stayed on a double room standard, and we fit a twin blow up mattress easily. There’s room, I was expecting a tiny room but it was not. The bathroom is very modern exactly like the photos, it is small, but not horribly so. Everything is so so clean I had zero complaints. You get free Fiji water every day, nespresso shots, and snacks included in price, cleaning staff does a great job. Beds super comfortable and 4 pillows per bed. We did not order room service but they have an outside place that brings food in. Gym modern and clean. Tv has chromecast. Fridge is the super small square ones, no microwave in room. 

Conclusion: all the reviews are true. I was surprised because usually reviews tend to be enhanced but that’s not the case here. Great pick.

title: Amazing
text: Best stay in NY in a long time. Staff are amazing, friendly and very helpful. LOVED IT. It location was great, easy access to Battery and the Piers. Easy to get to and very quiet and comfortable. Again, BEST STAFF EVER. Give them all raises. :)

title: Amazing hotel in the Financial District, with the best staff!
text: An amazing boutique hotel in the financial district.  We just returned from an 8 day stay in NYC and we loved the Artezen!  It was our first trip to NYC with our daughter to visit colleges, after reading reviews decided to stay at the Artezen and we are so glad we did!   Very clean and modern decor.  Within walking distance to many great restaurants, 911 Memorial Museum, Ferry to the Statue of Liberty,  World Trade Center and Fulton Street Station right across the street.  The staff was amazing and beyond helpful. I’ve never stayed at a hotel where our requests were fulfilled so promptly.  Joseph the Concierge was the BEST!  He was so helpful, very friendly and great at making recommendations and reservations for whatever we needed.  We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in NYC! Loved it!  ❤️

title: 5-star stay
text: We chose this hotel for it's proximity to the 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park, South Street Seaport and Chinatown. The rooms are good size for Manhattan. Beds are very comfortable and the street is quiet at night. The rooms are also replenished daily with Fiji water. Price was also very decent. It definitely made for a memorable stay in NYC.

title: Exceptional!
text: Had a wonderful stay here. The hotel was nice & quiet, which isn’t easy to accomplish in Manhattan. Also very clean & staff were very polite. My only complaint is that I ordered room service and one of my dessert items was 3 weeks old per the date on it. It was stale & inedible. Otherwise, this hotel is run as hotels should be, and I’d be happy to stay here again.

title: Not to be missed hidden gem!
text: Excellent service. Scent is delish. Late night front desk showed me where to grab pizza!! Looking forward to the upcoming sky lounge opening. Concierge Carmelo is a ROCKstar! Just keep doing what you do do well and thank you for a welcome stay.

title: Ok but a little off, probably wouldn’t return
text: Not bad but a few issues. Air conditioning in the room didn’t work properly, was extremely warm all night. Had a balcony which was cool but there was a huge camera on this private balcony which was an extension of the room really so that felt invasive and odd. Lastly, i believe they were loaning out rooms through the city and there was no mention of this, might make some ppl from out of town feel less safe

title: Glimpse of a beautiful city
text: Loved this hotel.  Would come  back in a heartbeat. Beautiful sleek contemporary hotel. Enjoyed the intimate atmosphere. Warm friendly and efficient staff. Staff quick to offer service without being asked. Immaculate.  Would highly recommend.

title: Great hotel in the financial district.
text: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel.  The staff were extremely helpful, pleasant and wanting to do anything they could to make our stay the best.  The room was very clean and up to date. Joe, the concierge/bell boy, was the best.

title: Superb stay for our Mother/Daughter NYC getaway!
text: I took my 2 teenage daughters on a Mother/daughter trip over Memorial Day weekend and I chose the Artezen based location, safety, bedding configuration (we wanted 2 queens) and proximity to many subway lines, as our trip had us travelling all over Manhattan. The Artezen exceeded our expectations! Check in was super smooth, and I had requested a quiet room with a nice view. Our 5th floor room did not disappoint! Everything was in excellent shape and it was super clean. We appreciated the mini fridge in the room, along with the small touches like a special makeup washcloth, in room safe, and lots of USB ports for our chargers. The staff was top notch...very friendly and readily offered suggestions on nearby places. It poured rain on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, so there were umbrellas available for you to take if you didn't have one. The Fulton Street Subway hub was a mere 1 minute walk down the street.  There were plenty of dining options nearby and we felt safe walking around the area, even late at night. I will be returning to NYC in the fall, and would stay at the Artezen again in a heartbeat!

title: Exceptional service and rooms!
text: Exceptional service from all employees, especially Joseph the doorman, who went out of way to make us feel welcome and made sure our stay was wonderful (spoiler - it was!).  Family friendly, super close to subway and ground zero, clean room/super comfortable beds.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Great hotel in the heart of lower Manhattan.
text: We really enjoyed our 3 day stay.  We chose The Artezen hotel as it is very close to our daughter’s apartment.  It is very clean, modern and the lobby greets you with the best fragrance.  The staff was great, especially Joesph.  He is the concierge and doorman. Joseph is so helpful and kind.  The hotel is a great location, close to metro. We will definitely be back.

title: Great experience
text:
The hotel was very clean and well appointed. Free chips, water and biscuits were very nice.   The thing that impressed me the most was how extremely friendly and accommodating the staff was. NYC isnot typically know for this.   The front desk staff bent over backwards for us, but it was Joe that really made us feel welcome everytime we saw him.  
This is the place to stay in lower Eastside financial district.

title: Great hotel!
text:
The hotel was lovely.  Very clean, well appointed rooms.  The bed was comfortable.  We had a room with a terrace which was wonderful to have morning coffee sitting outside.  
The staff were all welcoming and went above and beyond to make our stay terrific. 

We hope to stay again soon!

title: Absolute GEM in Downtown NYC
text: This hotel couldn’t have been lovelier!  My husband and I stayed for a quick one night “staycation” to soak up the city before moving cross-country and we needed a clean, comfy place to crash after a full, hot day of touristing.  Full disclosure, the Petite Queen room is, in fact, the tiniest hotel room I’ve ever seen, but it was just what we needed, as we just had backpacks for our overnight and no large luggage.  The room could also work nicely for a quick solo business trip, but if you’re staying longer, one of the larger rooms would be worth it.  The night guard who checked us in couldn’t have been more pleasant, despite it being 12:30am when we arrived, and the receptionist at check out was also very friendly and made sure we enjoyed everything.  There’s an $11 “resort fee” which covers the 2 waters, chips, biscoff, and nespresso in the room which was a welcome and thoughtful touch.  There were so many small details, like a black make up towel, nice toiletries, convenient outlets, and a full length mirror that made this room really stand out.  Not to mention the updated, sophisticated design of the rooms, and the large, totally luxurious shower.  The blackout curtains and silent A/C made it very easy to sleep in.
