My only VERY minor complaint was the pillows, which are the kind that look fluffy and then kind of deflate as soon as you lie on them.  I prefer something a bit more supportive and substantial.  But would absolutely recommend this place and would stay again in a heartbeat, hopefully for longer next time!

title: Convenient, lovely hotel
text:
Going to stay here again. Convenient to subway.  Friendly helpful staff, especially 
Francisco, Carmelo and Javier. Comfortable room, although a little warm, I would have liked to open the window. I was on an upper floor.
Only downside, my wife and I were accosted by several homeless on John Street, and the smell of urine on the sidewalks neighboring was appalling. This hotel is a gem in the sea of homeless, trash, and foul odors. The hotel is clean and the staff obviously care. I'll stay again soon, but hope the NYC Mayor decides to get his head out of his ass and do something about the street issues.

title: Excellent stay for a short weekend or longer!
text: This hotel is very nice and focuses heavily on excellent customer service. We has a very quick visit to NY however if we ever go back we will stay here again. All personnel were extremely helpful from the doormen, to the front desk to housekeeping. Hotel is extremely clean and smells good as well. The entire staff was extremely helpful however,The one person that stood out for us was Carmelo. He was  a world of knowledge when we needed any recommendations or on how to navigate through the city. Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful one night stay!
text:
My husband, two teen daughters and I stayed at the Artezen this week for one night. Normally, I wouldn’t take the time to write a review for one night but the service at this hotel was exceptional!  

Carmello helped us with our luggage and couldn’t have been more friendly and accommodating. He anticipated our every need from suggesting a breakfast spot, getting us extra umbrellas and helping us with the logistics of parking and subway stops. 

Guiseppe at the front desk was also very warm, welcoming and helpful. The room was nicely appointed with very comfortable beds, free snacks and water and a mini fridge. The room and bathroom seemed to have been updated. It’s NYC, so expect a smaller room but, it was clean and quiet. It’s one block from the Fulton St subway station where you can get multiple trains (2,3,4,5,A,C,R). If you are driving in, the hotel has arrangement with a garage a couple of blocks away for $45 for a 24 period. The hotel is on John St off of Broadway close to the 9/11 Memorial, Trinity Church, etc.

title: Pretty close to perfect! Highly recommend!
text:
I highly recommend this hotel. I had some initial concerns prior to booking, yet after speaking directly with one of the staff, I was put at ease. 
The hotel has safe guards in place-extra staff, a hotel room key is needed in order to ride the elevators, the front doors are locked from 11:30-6:00am (room key access or ID matching reservation). 
I booked a queen deluxe room at a fantastic price. The room (#1804) was away from the elevator/stairwell. The room was quite spacious for NYC standards, with plenty of room to move around. The bathroom, a bit tight with the door open, was fine with the door closed. A large vanity top, with a shelf underneath made unloading all of my toiletries a breeze (with room to spare for more than one guest). The lighting could have been better, but not bad. Fancy toiletries, thick white towels and a beautiful tiled shower with an amazing rain showerhead. The bathroom and room appeared to be spotless, including items being dust-free. The bed, on the softer side, was super comfortable, the pillows felt fine at first but quickly flattened. The heat/ac worked perfectly. And finally a room with a larger trashcan to dispose of carryout food packaging! The resort fee included two bags of chips and two bottled waters on arrival. After that, each day there were 3 bottled waters. A mini fridge and Nespresso machine as well. 
Everyone of the staff were pleasant and welcoming, especially Carmello, who always seemed to be at the door greeting all guests coming and going, always opening the door. He offered to make dining suggestions if I needed them. The hotel's team can make or break a guest's visit and here they excelled at making it. Another mention, there was hardly any wait time for the elevators, as in many NYC hotels. 
The location is fantastic for exploring, especially lower Manhattan and even walking the Brooklyn Bridge. 
The only negative I could find with this hotel, which is a big one for me, is the quality of sleep in regards to noise. I am a light sleeper and always use a fan or white noise app when traveling. The first night I was awakened by conversations of noisy guests coming/going from their rooms. With each entry/exit, the doors to the rooms slammed shut. The second night I was kept up from 10:30pm-2:30am by loud music with heavy bass coming from a nearby rooftop (about a block away). I could see them from my room. This was no fault of the hotel's. In fact, I called the front desk at 12:30am to see if there was some sort of noise ordinance for the city. The gentleman was apologetic and recommended I call 311, or faster would be to call the police. I did neither, hoping some one else would call as I didn't know the exact location. I had my tablet and iPhone both playing a white noise app, along with pillows over my ears...still could hear the bass. The third day after returning to my room around 3:30pm, housekeeping was cleaning rooms on my floor. Once again, door slamming from the housekeeping closet and guest rooms. A bit annoying, yet I wasn't trying to sleep. And finally on my last night, I could hear a man's voice and his conversation. I got out of bed, no one was outside of the door. I listened and found it was coming from the bathroom, perhaps his voice was carrying from another room through the exhaust fan or possibly the walls. The noise would normally be a deal breaker for me, but  everything else was so perfect that I would over look it in the future. Perhaps there is some sort of mechanism that could be put on the doors of the rooms to minimize the doors from slamming. I would definitely stay here again, but next time I'll be sure to bring some earplugs.

title: Spring break trip
text: What a great hotel! Super clean and the staff was amazing. So friendly and helpful. We loved Carmelo - what a great guy. He helped us find restaurants, things to do and assisted with how to get everywhere. A great location and stay!

title: Artezen Boutique Hotel
text: This hotel was very clean and had a great rain shower. I loved the complimentary water and snacks! The doorman was polite and the room was very quiet!  Hotel was close to Wall Street and very convenient to everything in FIDI. Would definately stay here again!

title: Love this hotel
text:
My husband and I were visiting our son in FIDI. We were at another hotel a block away and left after the first night. We found Artezen and I am so glad we did!! From the minute we walked in, I could feel such a good energy. We were welcomed by Francesco. He was so helpful and always asked if we needed anything. Very friendly! Actually, every person who worked there was friendly and helpful! I don’t remember all their names (Carmelo might have been one of the other great staff members). We found out that this is a family owned hotel and it felt that way. 
We stayed in the Petite Queen and it was perfect for us. Small, but accommodating and the bathroom/shower were great. 
We will definitely come back when we visit again! 
I highly recommend!!!!!

title: Birthday/Girls Trip
text: I don’t even know where to begin ! As soon as you walk in you get a warm & friendly welcome from the staff from the concierge to the front desk to the manager .. AWESOME. The room is just as lovely as it is in pictures ! words really cannot cover my experience at the hotel. Management is very on top of the game. Hotel is very secure. You aren’t allowed to go up or move levels without your guest card. Room has extra security and if you want your room made it has a special button to request it as well as for privacy. Big windows bring in all the light! This is definitely going to be my go-to hotel when i plan on going to New York again !

title: Gretchen y Richard (PR)
text: Excelente servicio. Habitación cómoda. Te tratan como en tu casa. El consejero Sr.Carmelo es un ser amable y servicial nos ayudó con los boletos de regreso a Puerto Rico. Hasta sombrillas nos dio para la lluvia.Todo limpio y camas cómodas.

title: Found a new “hidden” gem, phenomenal experience
text:
Recently stayed at the Artezen while exploring the FiDi area. Extremely close and awesome proximity to the Wall Street area, WTC, and the battery. 
The service was PHENOMENAL. We arrived early and were granted an early effortless check in process with no issue. 
CARMELO the concierge man at the front door was hands down one of the most professional, friendly and helpful people I have encountered among hotels. The rooms are great, bathroom is extremely nice and shower is A+. We spent too much time eating, so I did not hit the gym but their gym has more equipment and space than any chain hotel I have ever seen.
Overall the hotel is as clean as can be, smells great and I highly recommend. I created this Trip Advisor account just to leave my first review. 

Thank you ARTEZEN & Staff

title: Excellent Location!
text:
We stayed at Artezen Hotel because it would be more convenient to hang out around Financial District and other nearby attractions. Rooms are small but it doesn't matter at all because we are mostly out exploring town. 

What I loved about this hotel - Service is great and there are heaps of restaurants near the hotel. Our favorite breakfast spot is Toasties just right across the hotel. We would definitely come back again!

title: Localização boa, quarto satisfatório
text: O quarto é pequeno mas suficiente para uma estadia tranquila e curta. Localização perfeita com acesso fácil ao metro e algumas atrações. Preço ótimo e hotel novo. Check in e out fácil e rápido. Não tinha café da manhã mas pelo preço valeu muito!

title: Not good
text: I wanted to love this place so bad. It's in the perfect location. The staff was so friendly. BUT.. the first night we got here the smell of weed was so strong on the entire floor we were on.. to each their own! I was cool with it. But it went on for 11 hours! 11 freaking hours. I had a headache was feeling light headed myself. Then 2am came along, the sweet guests next to us decided we ALL needed to party and the music began.. for HOURS.. loud music..No relief. It sounded like I was sitting in their room it was SO loud. Now we are sitting here with a room full of cigarette smoke.. choking on it.. AND weed so bad we had to put towels under the door. Just..... think twice about booking here since it's obviously a party spot and no one cares to make it better. For paying $189 a night for an "upgraded" room and then paying $40 a night at check in to get "upgraded" room on top of that .. I expected more.

title: Love this hotel!
text: We’ve stayed at the Artezen twice now and absolutely loved it. It’s a lovely little boutique hotel right in the heart of the Financial District, within walking distance to many sights including Battery Park, the Brooklyn Bridge, Wall St. with all it’s historical landmarks, the South Street Seaport, Trinity Church, and an extremely short walk to the 911 Memorial and Museum. It also borders Little Italy and Chinatown, and is close to other trendy neighborhoods including TriBeca and SoHo, and we even walked to the West Village, which wasn’t too far. There are many nearby dining options, with so many offering outdoor seating, and it’s a very safe neighborhood. The hotel itself is pretty new and the rooms we stayed in were lovely, spacious, nicely decorated and extremely clean. We had a terraced room which offered a lovely place to drink our morning coffee and just relax. The service couldn’t have been better, and the concierge, Carmelo, was THE nicest, and the most helpful and hospitable we’ve ever experienced at any hotel. We’ll certainly book here again, as our daughter goes to college very close by, and the Artezen is fast becoming our home away from home!

title: Great place to stay!
text: My now husband and I stayed here leading up to our wedding day and we had a fantastic stay. The rooms are cozy, very clean, and well equipped and the staff we encountered were lovely. The location is also fantastic, close to the trains and also a large number of essential NYC sites. Would def recommend the hotel to family or friends visiting the city.

title: Good service
text:
Decent rooms, not the most spacious but good sized for NYC.  We asked to store our bikes with them, but we had to keep them in our room.  We were just about able to move around with the two bikes in the Deluxe Queen room.  

The staff is friendly and responsive.  They delivered to us utensils when we found that our takeout food was missing them.  I also called about noise in a nearby room.  They actually called me back a little later to follow up and see if the noise has subsided.  This was the first time that a front desk called me back when I've complained about noise (just a couple of other times).  A solid choice if you're staying downtown.

title: Amazing Balcony
text:
I rented the King Suite w/Balcony for my birthday/anniversary weekend in September.  The staff was very helpful, and management even took the time to surprise us with balloons and champagne!  I even received a kind note from the owner!   Room was very cozy, balcony was something special, hotel and room were very clean as well.

Overall couldn't be happier and confidently recommend the Artezen for a special time

title: A Gem on John street
text:
Very nice hotel.  Unbeatable location.  Walking distance to so many attractions, including Battery Park, South street Historic District, and Ground Zero.  The service was great.  The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  For example, Jonathan was born and raised in the neighborhood so I felt pretty confident about taking him up on his dining and running route recommendations.  So I did and they were perfect...And Giuseppe was very attentive and made sure my accommodations were just right.  I will definitely be back.  

Gio

title: 9/11 Memorial Stay- Great Job!
text: We stayed at the Atezen last minute because VP Mike Pence took over 2 floors at the hotel we were supposed to be staying at...  And we're glad he did!  The building is unassuming from the outside and definitely on the "boutique" side, but the overall stay was fantastic.  The staff was extremely helpful and attentive anytime we interacted and they went out of their way to make sure our needs were met.  They were always professional and always had a smile while still making you feel at home.  The rooms were small, but the mattresses were very comfortable.  Next year we are planning on staying here again and I'm just waiting for management to call me so I can book my King Terrace Suite for more room next time.  Hats off to the staff we had the pleasure of meeting and interacting with- Giuseppe, Javier, Kathy, Michell and especially Carmelo who made sure we got everything we needed and found every place we were searching for!

title: Excellent service by Francisco
text: My fiancé and I have been to the Artezen about three times  already and I must say Francisco is the best !!!! Anytime we make a reservation to stay here he greets us by name shows complete respect and is such a sweetheart. He makes sure to go above and beyond for his customers to make them feel welcomed and have a great stay. He makes the experience of staying at the Artezen wonderful.

title: Surprisingly good, better than photos
text: This hotel is a big surprise. The photos on the website are nice, but not perfectly inviting. It's actually even nicer in person. It's very clean, very new and extremely comfortable. The colors are actually better in person than on the website. I've already stayed here a couple of times and I'm sure I'll be back again. The free chips are a good bonus. But, really - for the price - it's the steal of the century. I've worked with three or four people at the front desk and they've all been great. I stayed in a king deluxe the first time and I can say I prefer it slightly to the queen deluxe. It's just a little bit nicer, a little more spacious. This is well appointed with extra storage cleverly built into the room. It has all of the extras that you'd expect at twice its price point, including the bathrobe, the slippers, room service, good toiletries, nice design, good sheets, completely clean an iPad and a refrigerator. It's just comfortable and kind of a steal right now.

title: Tremendous Service
text: Stayed for 2 nights while dropping my daughter off at college, and was blown away by the attentive and eager to please Concierge staff.  I wanted a bottle of wine, he told me right where to go and when I returned brought a bottle opener and 2 freshly cleaned wine glasses. When I wanted a taxi to take my daughters 6 huge bags to her dorm, which was only a six minute walk from the hotel, Carmelo offered to personally walk the bags over using his luggage cart saving me from the over inflated cab fare.  You can tell that Carmelo loves his job, and willing to go above and beyond.

title: Staycationing
text:
This was truly a wonderful stay. I have been working on Covid19 centric studies and I really needed a getaway. The staff were amazing and very professional. Chrome casting to the tv was a breeze. Warning for those who prefer a bathroom far from the bed..the bathroom is small but it has a wonderful rain shower head that more than made up for the small space 

I’ll definetly be back.

title: Stay At Home Birthday Staycation
text:
I'm still mentally enjoying my stay at the Artezen 8/9 to 8/13 while working out the details for my next stay. I booked the King Deluxe Terrace room and cannot wait to return. The hotel was perfectly located: walkable for treats, shopping, eating, sight seeing, commuting and parking. Scented and clean from entrance to room. The staff was so darn friendly and accommodating to all of my needs without question or hesitation. They gym was on a scheduled basis due to Covid and they were so good about helping me find the best availability. The room was small but perfect for my needs. That mattress!!! I forgot to ask the make because my body was loathe to leave it and 2 nights later at home wants it back. Loved the bathroom. LOVED the terrace feature even more. While the view wasn't something to look for, being able to sit outside and take in the Manhattan energy was worth it alone. My only issue was the real lack of separation between the terrace and the adjoining Though the privacy effort was great. All in all, it was an amazing space to celebrate my 50th in my hometown when the world has gone crazy. 

My advice: street parking is a thing from 7pm-7am which lowers the cost for day parking. Use the throw feature for TV viewing as it works seamlessly.

title: Excellent stay!
text:
I cannot say enough about our time at the Artezen. The hotel is exceptionally clean and the location was perfect for us. The staff were always very professional. Carmelo, the concierge , was very personable and helped us with local recommendations. He made excellent recommendations and even went out of his way and had a "thank you" cocktail waiting for us at one of the recommendations.
The room itself was clean, beds were comfortable, shower was super clean and the air conditioning was spot on.. much needed on this very hot weekend. 
 We will definitely be back soon!

title: Amazing 6 night stay
text: I planned to stay at this fabulous hotel for 5 nights but ended up extending my stay to 6 because I wasn’t ready to leave. The Artezen is immaculately clean with a spotless lobby and rooms. The rooms are nice and quiet and have insanely comfortable beds and nespresso machines.  The staff is incredibly friendly and was super helpful and accommodating during my stay. The owner Sal is amazing and really prioritizes customer service! I have never stayed at a hotel before where I have received such personalized treatment. The location is also awesome as it is in a very walkable area. This has to be my favorite nyc hotel.

title: Covid-19 Issue resolved
text:
Unfortunately, we had to cancel our trip early in the Covid-19 pandemic, just a couple of days before things took a turn in NYC. Once they realized how bad this pandemic actually was, I received a call from the owner of Artezen, Sal, who authorized a full refund. Everyone I spoke to was friendly and helpful during a very unpredictable time. Sal and the Artezen are on the right side of things in NYC, and I look forward to staying with them when things open back up and we are able to take our trip. It looks like a lovely place, and I appreciate the resolution to a very unexpected problem. We definitely will be staying there the next time we are in the city. 

The hotel had to close due to the pandemic...if you are planning a trip to NYC after all this is over, please consider supporting Artezen, or another small independently owned property, with owners who truly care about their customers. (The billion dollar corporate hotels will be just fine, and the owners will never know your name)

Well done, Artezen!

title: Very friendly staff
text:
Stayed for three nights with my husband over labour day weekend. We go to NYC around once a year so our goal is to find hotels that are at great value and not necessarily near any particular tourist attractions. Here are the pros and cons:

Pros:
- Definitely the staff! They always greet us with a big smile and ask us how our day was. 
- price - I think we paid around $200 cad per night which is very reasonable for New York
- bed is very comfortable. Robes and slippers are provided which is not typical of boutique hotel
- the hotel is fairly new so everything feels brand new 

Cons:
- not much nearby, except for the 911 memorial and century 21 store. Not a lot of food options either but eataly and blue bottle is a short walk away 
- room is on the smaller side, but again so is the rest of New York, especially for boutique hotels
- no on site restaurant. They do have room service available through a third party company though.

Overall great value and would recommend to anyone who doesn’t mind not being close to the major attractions.

title: Excelente hotel em todos aspectos!
text: Minha estadia em New York foi durante este triste período da pandemia do COVID-19, em que ainda nos encontramos quando escrevo esta avaliação. Em virtude disso, não foi possível a visita a muitas atrações turísticas, algumas reservas previamente. No entanto, o saldo da viagem foi positivo. New York sempre proporciona momentos inesquecíveis. E entre as boas lembranças da minha viagem foi certamente a estadia no Artezen. Ele atende a tudo que eu espero quando escolho um hotel. A localização excelente: a alguns passos da Estação de metrô Fulton St.  e do One WTC.  Da porta do hotel, você já pode vê-lo! Muito próximo também de Wall St., da Brooklyn Bridge e do Battery Park, de onde partem os barcos para a Estátua da Liberdade. O hotel é muito novo e bem decorado. Infelizmente, não tenho os nomes dos funcionários da recepção, mas quero deixar registrado minha gratidão pela extrema atenção e cordialidade que têm com os hóspedes. O quarto tem decoração de muito bom gosto e bem mobiliado, com escrivaninha, frigobar, tablet, cortina blackout. O ar condicionado funciona muito bem. Água mineral e café Nespresso fornecidos (Não é propriamente cortesia, mas inclusos em virtude da taxa a ser paga no momento do checkout denominada “Hotel fee”). Tudo é muito limpo: as roupas de cama, toalhas, o quarto e banheiro. O chuveiro é excelente. A cama, muito confortável. Recomendo esse hotel sem qualquer ressalva. Excelente! Espero voltar a New York e quando isso acontecer, eu me hospedarei novamente no Artezen.

title: Enjoyable stay in great location
text:
We stayed here 4 nights.  The room was well appointed and very quiet.  The reception staff were very friendly.  The location is great, very near to Fulton subway and the Oculus.  Restaurants, supermarkets, shops are at the doorstep as well as Ground 0, One World Trade Centre and many other attractions within walking distance.
Would love to return.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Acabo de pasar 5 días con mi novia y nos ha encantado el sitio. Se nota que lo abrieron hace poco ya que las camas y mobiliario son muy nuevos. Los precios son muy competitivos y la localización es estupenda. Esta muy cerca de la parada de metro y muy bien comunicado. 100% recomendable

title: Nice hotel with great location
text: Nice hotel with a great location next to multiple subway lines. Rooms are small but modern and clean. Staff was great as well. The only knock is that my room had thin walls and you could hear the neighbouring guests.

title: One could not ask more . .
text:
I loved this space, very close to the One world observatory. It’s a 3 star place, just basic for your needs

Key positives 

1)	Check in was a breeze
2)	The room was great, lovely bed and sleep quality
3)	The writing desk and the blue tooth speaker was great. Loved what the team created with the little space they had.
4)	The amenities were great. Fiji water was provided, at no additional cost. The team really did a great job there
5)	House keeping team was excellent! Kept the room super clean

Key improvement areas

1)	The commode is positioned very awkwardly close to the wash basin (or sink). One can easily dash their head on the sharp sink corner. Especially if you are 6 foot +

Practically this was a great 3 star hotel and I would love to come back here and try another room.

title: Very nice hotel
text: This hotel is really nice and clean. The front desk staff was nice and helpful as well. The hotel doesn’t have parking & the nearest parking lot is a little ways down the street and can be pricey but that’s not uncommon in NY. I would definitely stay here again if staying in/near the financial district (this area is about a 25 min. drive from Times Square FYI)

title: Great Hotel
text:
Very clean and confy.
There’s a girl at front desk in the morning, she really helped us!! 
Michael the coincierge was also so nice!
The room service is fast and in a reasonable price.
We enjoyed our stay!

title: Great experience
text: Stayed three nights in February 2020 as a result of all the great reviews. Hotel is pretty new, and spotless. Staff very friendly and helpful. Half a block from The Fulton Street subway station which goes pretty much anywhere. Two blocks from World Trade Center and memorials. Only downside and it's not a criticism because in New York most hotels are not very big but the room was a little on the small side. Bathroom and shower very nice. Towels good quality as well as bedding and robes. Would absolutely stay again.

title: Posizione eccezionale ma attenzione alla scelta delle camere
text: Hotel si trova in una posizione invidiabile. A qualche centinaio di metri dal World trade center e vicino al fiume Hudson. A meno di cento metri c'è la fermata della Metro. Il personale è gentilissimo e hotel è pulitissimo.  Ha una piccola palestra. Hotel è circondato da tantissimi ristoranti. Non vi è la colazione in Hotel a meno che non vogliate il servizio in camera.  Il cibo arriva da un catering.  Raccomando una attenzione nella scelta della camera. Le petit room sono veramente piccole e consigliate solo per 1 persona. In ogni caso tutte le camere sono moderne e ben attrezzate. Resta uno dei miei candidati per una prossima volta in New York City.

title: Perfect Stay
text:
Having just returned from a 3 night stay, I can not recommend this hotel enough. All staff we met were helpful and polite, printing tickets for us that we had forgotten to do at home and giving us tips for restaurants and getting around the city. Location was great for us, out of Times Square but easy enough to get anyone via the subway as the Fulton street hub is a minute away. Lots of places around for food and drink. 
We stayed in room 1104, small but perfectly formed, comfortable bed, fridge, tv and a lovely big shower. A tablet in the room provides a load of information as well as an outside room service menu from go butler. Plenty of clean fresh towels and toiletries daily and as part of the resort fee, water, nespresso and crisps. On our last day the concierge held onto our luggage for 10hrs with no issue. Thank you to all the Artezen staff who made our trip that little bit more special!

title: Uma excelente aposta
text:
Este hotel boutique tem tudo o que é necessário para passar uma excelente estadia. As dimensões dos quartos são boas para Nova Iorque, a cama excelente,  tem ginásio e é muito central se sofre de dores de pescoço  ainda lhe arranjam  as almofadas "memory foam" que são  infalíveis.
Em frente,do outro lado da estrada, tem upma estação de metrô (Fulton) que é muito central e tem acesso a muitas linhas de metro. 
Assim é  só  atravessar a rua e em poucos minutos pode apanhar o metro para qualquer lado.
Tem perto restaurantes excelentes, (Nobu downtown -mais caro) ou então a famosa pizza do Joe's Pizza (barato) numa esquina muito próxima. 
Se.gosta de bagels tem muito perto o District Bagels onde pode encontrar bagels fresquinhas, de todos os sabores que possa imaginar. 
Em termos de atrações tem perto o famoso museu de 9/11 bem como o respetivo memorial. 
Pode igualmente  caminhar até ao ferry para Elis Island ou staten Island.
Como vê está muito bem situado, tem um preço justo e um serviço muito bom.

title: Qualité et placement parfait
text:
Un accueil très agréable avec une mention spaciale pour le portier, toujours à l écoute et souriant. 
Une chambre agréable, propre et avec les commodités nécessaires.
 L emplacement est top. Restaurants à proximités, centre commerciale, boutiques et plusieurs lieux incontournables faisable à pied.

title: Great hotel for our honeymoon
text:
We stayed here for our honeymoon for 9 days, the staff are very friendly from the concierge, reception staff to the maintenance and cleaning staff, the room was big enough as we got the king deluxe, the wardrobe is a little small but we managed, we stayed on the 16th floor in a room that was facing the road some days we heard a little noise but that was just the bin men and didn’t keep us awake, you get daily coffee pods and water in the room the IPad was a great touch for ordering room service, we ordered breakfast on the first day which was on the pricey side but the food was lovely, the hotel does not provide the food it was catered for by an outside service, we found a nice breakfast place just 300m down the road called jubilee market, where they do a great breakfast and is half the price of the room service.

The gym in the hotel has enough for what you need and there is also ice on the fourth floor, we loved our stay in the hotel the bed was comfy and had a great sleep for the 9 days we were there.

The hotel is very close to the Fulton st subway for all directions and if you can’t find a subway ride on those the WTC has a station too, we purchased a metro card for unlimited travel for 7 days which is only $34, we had no trouble getting around.

The hotel is just around the corner from WTC 10min walk under the subway underpass so you dont get cold or at the end of the street, the shops are very close with loads of bars restaurants and takeaway places, we explored all the area for the better deals, it is also in walking distance to the statan island ferry, battery park and wall st. 

I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, you will not be disappointed

title: Agree with all fantastic reviews, however......
text:
We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children who stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in mid Feb. Room was a good size for NYC. I requested a higher level room but was given one on the 3rd floor facing the street. I was told that our room type was only available up to floor 5 anyway. This in itself was not a problem as we didn't experience any street noise and it was light enough, however - the room type (2 queen beds to accommodate the 4 of us) has connecting\adjoining doors and we were woken up on 2 separate nights by loud talking which felt like it was happening in our room. This was at 3am and again at 1am. The first occasion I rang the front desk and they went to speak to the people in the adjoining room. The noise stopped but it happened again 2 nights later. We were told we could move rooms but the problem may not be resolved as the room type with adjoining doors was not as soundproofed as the rest of the rooms. 
Having said all of this, I would still recommend this hotel. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, rooms are spotlessly clean, bathrooms and furnishings great and practically brand new. We enjoyed chatting with Carmelo (concierge) and the location was perfect.

title: Great lower Manhattan boutique hotel.
text: The Artezen was a great find in lower Manhattan.  Three blocks from South street seaport area and two blocks from the Oculus and WTC.  Minutes away from Fulton station which covers all major metro lines.  Nicely appointed rooms, excellent service, comfortable beds and nice shower.  Very reasonable rates, great value.  Highly recommend for family or business travel.  Only complaint is that street facing rooms can be noisy at night.

title: Boutique Hotel Convenient to Subway with Helpful Staff
text: This smallish hotel is just south of the Fulton St. subway center and a few blocks from the World Trade Center. Well-laid out quiet rooms, helpful staff, and well-appointed baths. Complaint: Charging a resort fee for use of the exercise room and a couple of bags of potato chips on your first night was inappropriate and a sour note on an otherwise good stay.

title: A great find in New York City
text: What a great new hotel .... the place is not even a year old yet. Location is ideal, staff are extrememly friendly ( not Disney friendly ! ), rooms are clean, wifi works well, free water & Nespresso in the rooms, proper iron & board available on request and all at a very good price. I cannot fault anything about this hotel ... give it a go - you will not be disappointed.

title: Not enough coat hooks in the room...
text:
When you read reviews on trip advisor I have now learnt to take a lot of them with a pinch of salt and have to read the sub texts to get the real feel of the place you are looking at. 

The subject of the review is the ONLY thing I can possibly say negatively on the Artezen. 

The hotel is lovely, the staff are friendly the location perfect! I can’t praise it enough. 

Ok they don’t have a restaurant or bar, but as you’re in NY you have the pick of the bunch. 

This hotel concentrates on what they do best, and perform it to perfection.  The rooms are cozy, with a big smart TV, shower and a very comfy bed.  We were on the 18th, a floor with just 5 rooms in this one, higher up enough to be extremely quiet. 

AMAZING PLACE - thanks for a lovely mini break. We will be back.

title: Artezen hotel hospitality
text: Artezen was incredibly lovely to me and my sister while we were staying! The entire staff was warm and welcoming and made sure we had everything we needed during our stay there. Carmelo was especially hospitable and definitely made my day when helping me check out by making sure I was taken care of on my trip back to the airport. I would recommend Artezen hotel to anyone regardless if the stay is for business or pleasure!

title: Séjour parfait !
text: Tout d’abord quand on rentre dans l’hôtel, dans le hall cela sent vraiment très bon! Le personnel est adorable, aux petits soins.. Très facile d’accès depuis et vers JFK (le métro se trouvant juste en face de l’hôtel ce qui n’est pas négligeable) ! Dans le quartier de Wall Street, plus calme que vers Time square mais idéalement situé à deux pas du one World Trade Center et du mémorial ... Beaucoup de choses à faire à pieds dans cette partie sud de downtown et plein de restos/ magasins. Je recommande George’s pour le petit déjeuner (à une dizaine de minutes à pieds) c’est typically le petit dej à l’américaine ! En ce qui concerne la chambre, elle est certes un tout petit peu petite mais cela ne nous a absolument pas dérangé! Elle est très mignonne et bien décorée... Le lit est aussi confortable ! La salle de bain avec la douche italienne très bien aussi. On voit que l’hôtel est récent et c’est appréciable ! En bref, pour le rapport qualité/prix c’est inbattable à New York ! Je reviendrais sans hésitation ! Merci pour avoir rendu notre séjour encore plus agréable

title: Great option in Wall Street district
text:
When I go to NYC, I usually stay on Midtown Manhattan, close to Central Park and Times Square. This time I wanted to try something different and the Artezen Hotel was a great alternative. The hotel is pretty much new so the place looks really nice. The rooms are spacious (for NYC standards) and the bathroom is really big, including the shower. For sightseeing, both the Brooklyn Bridge and the new WTC are walking distance. The Artezen is located at a low traffic street so that is a plus if you are looking for a quiet place to stay. The metro stations are around the corner so you can move easily. You also get free water bottles and coffee from a Nespresso machine in your room.

The staff is really courteous and they try to go the extra mile to make your stay great. Every person working at the hotel is always greeting you with a smile and trying to help you in any way they can. 

Overall, if you're looking for a place far away form the crowds and chaos of Midtown Manhattan, you should definitely consider the Artezen Hotel on your next stay.

title: Perfect NYC if you're fickle about sleep
text:
Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling for business or leisure.

Picked this hotel for its location. Was on a mother-and-daughter "girls trip" and we wanted to opt for somewhere that was quieter, but well connected via subway. This hotel was perfect. Being on a side street in the financial district meant that it was quiet at night, which allowed for the perfect sleep. It is also steps (literal steps) away from Fulton Street subway station, which gave us access to each subway line we needed. 

Furthermore, the staff was very helpful. One of our girlfriends got to the hotel earlier than we did. Despite not being in person to check-in (as the reservation was under my name), the hotel staff allowed her to go up to the room earlier than us. They were also very courteous every night we returned from our outtings, as well in the mornings when we hopped off to our adventures. 

Accommodation-wise, the room felt very spacious for NYC. Additionally, the beds were really comfortable. I'm a stickler for a comfy bed and plush pillows, and our sleep was heavenly. This was underscored by the fact that the air-conditioning was quiet (a rarity for NYC, it seems!). The only two downsides to our room was that the bathroom was quite compact (challenging for multiple girls getting ready in the AM) and the alarm clock being very bright. We had to turn the alarm clock upside down and cover it with a pillow to tame the glow. 

Overall, a very pleasant stay. Would definitely stay again.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I stayed 3 nights and was very happy with all aspects. Check in, concierge were amazing, kind and helpful. The room was clean, modern, quiet, and a comfortable bed. Great location. I would stay there again!

title: Perfect location and fantastic value for money
text: A modern facility in a great location, but in a quiet street. Main subway station on the doorstep. Ground zero 1block away. 10 minute walk to river on either side of island of Brooklyn Bridge. All staff could not do enough to help and it was immaculately clean

title: EXCELENTE ATENCIÓN, FANTÁSTICA UBICACIÓN Y DESCANSO ÓPTIMO
text: Mi marido y yo nos hemos escapado a Nueva York el pasado mes de noviembre, y sin duda tenemos que decir que este hotel ha cumplido con todas nuestras expectativas: atención al cliente perfecta, limpieza y habitaciones en condiciones óptimas, hemos descansado y dormido como en casa. Se sitúa en el distrito financiero, cerca de Wall Street y la salida de los barcos para Staten Island. El Barrio tiene todo tipo de restaurantes pequeños de comida variada, japonés, coreano, kosher, vegetariano...sin duda volveremos, gracias!

title: First class
text: A special friend and I stayed for 2 nights and had an absolutely beautiful experience. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home. They even brought us a complimentary bottle of wine. I'd recommend Artezen to anyone looking for a reliable and affordable place to stay in Manhattan.

title: Tolles Hotel -einfach spitze!
text: Das Hotel liegt direkt an der Subway Station Fulton in unmittelbarer Nähe des WTC. Viele kleine Cafés quasi um die Ecke. Ich war gemeinsam mit meiner Erwachsenen Tochter. Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit Kingsize Bett im 17th Floor mit grandioser Aussicht. Das Bett und die Doppeldecke wie in USA üblich war unfassbar kuschelig wie in Wolken eingepackt😍Jeden Tag wurde mit 2 Flaschen gratis Wasser aufgefüllt. Am Zimmer eine Nespressomaschine mit Cups und Milch. Die Sauberkeit hat mich sprachlos gemacht und ich bin mega pingelig. Das Badezimmer und die Dusche jeden Tag war so gründlich geputzt wie ich es noch nie erlebt habe. Und ich reise viel und um die ganze Welt. Ich habe dem Zimmermädchen dann bei Abreise Trinkgeld gegeben da ein sensationeller Job gemacht wurde. JEDEN Tag komplett neue Hand- und Badetücher. In der Rezeption auch alle unfassbar freundlich. Ich komme sicher wieder. Hier machen ALLE einen super Job!

title: Perfect for a 7 days stay
text: A lovely and very clean hotel located in the financial district of Manhattan. The room is small but perfect for our needs. Big TV though. You have everything you may need in the nearby: donuts, sushi, pharmacy, burgers, supermarkets, subway station (Fulton street station is just a few meters away), department store. Very good wi-fi speed. The staff was very polite and always looking to help you. Umbrellas for the rainy days, unfortunately, at 9 AM there was none left. No restaurant (butler delivery for room service though).

title: great stay
text: I just stayed couple days in NYC with Artezen hotel in late Jan. This hotel is a great deal. New, tidy, convenient, nice customer services, have everything I need, even better than some other hotels I stayed in Manhattan. Definitely will come here again next time in NYC. I would recommend this hotel to the others as well.

title: Comfortable room, very good staff
text:
I stayed at the Artezen for a 4-day NYC vacation. The room was perfect - very quiet at night, very good quality bed, very clean, great bathroom and desk set-up. The staff was very helpful and polite. One very pleasant surprise - I left an expenive sweater in my room, called the hotel after I left to ask them if they could mail it. They mailed it to me at no cost - it actually arrived at my home before I did! 

This hotel served my needs for a quiet, clean, comfortable room in a location convenient to most subway lines.

title: Fantastic stay in NYC!
text:
My partner and myself stayed at this hotel for 4 nights , and it was a lovely stay. I was slightly skeptical before arriving because the price seemed to good to be true but thankfully it was just as the photos and excellent reviews suggested. 

The room and bathroom were very clean and actually not too small considering we were in NYC. 

Bed was also super comfortable and really appreciated the complimentary Fiji water daily throughout our stay. 

Receptionists and concierge staff were all very welcoming and polite.

I have zero complaints; the only tiny suggestion I have is to add a few hooks to the back of the hotel door in order to hang extra coats during the winter months! (This is not even a complaint just the only suggestion I can think of! Hehe)

Would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for great value for money. 

I hope it keeps its standards this high! Would definitely return.

title: Recommended
text:
Two night stay. Very close to Fulton St Metro.

No issue with a slightly early check in. Pleasantly welcomed.

Allocated 802 and advised snacks, Fiji water, are on the house as part of the resort fee.

Room wasn’t huge but more than adequate for single traveller. Overlooked John Street.

Used the gym which has a yoga room that was great for stretching out.

There’s no restaurant but lots of coffee shops and eateries around.

Absolutely no problem with hot water either. Bigelow toiletries and Nespresso machine.

Only issue that spoilt a 5 rating was the water pump in the gym needed a refill advised colleague, who said no issue and we will get some water to your room. Gave my room number.

Upon leaving to go out, mentioned to the same staff member and he said I called your room, knocked on and your water has been replenished and ask my colleague. Pointed to the front desk.  

I advised there was no call nor any knock....I can 110% say you didn’t knock on 802.....he kept going on about it.....am not there to argue with you.

Emirates chauffeur had no issue locating hotel for rode back to JFK.

Regardless, excellent stay and would stay again without issue.

title: Fantastic little boutique hotel; Amazing value
text: We stayed 3 days at this lovely boutique hotel. I am usually hard to please but I must say I was so impressed with this hotel. It is small but perfect for a few days in the city. I never expect large rooms in nyc, but I do love an impeccably clean room, a fantastic bed and a great shower. This hotel excelled in all 3. Our small quiet room had everything you needed and they invested in the best quality things. I adored the bed with Frette Linens (usually found at luxury hotels) and super comfortable down pillows and comforter. I love that their small resort fee included spring bottled water (Fiji & Poland Spring), wifi as well as a nice espresso machine. Since the hotel is only 9 months old, there were no smells, bathroom was impeccably clean with high quality fixtures. I even loved the toiletries with a bit of vintage apothecary feel. The hotel is also located in a nice area, super close to city hall, Brooklyn bridge and with a subway stop right outside the hotel entrance. All the staff was wonderful and extremely friendly, ready to help with everything you needed. I stayed in much more expensive hotels that do not even compare in quality with Artezen! I can't wait to go back.

title: Sensational
text: Have just spent 10 fabulous days at the Artezen for a family holiday. The rooms are small - like most NY rooms, but they are super quiet!  The hotel is really worth a visit. Friendly service - front desk and concierge were so helpful. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are well appointed. Fulton Subway is virtually opposite. Do yourself a favour and stay at this awesome hotel!

title: Lovely Hotel, but......
text:
The rooms are so small!  We stayed in a ‘Superior Queen’ room.  It was only me & my husband w 2 regular sized suit cases & 2 smaller ones, AND we were literally tripping around the room with NO space! Check-out the size of the room before you book, but hey, it’s NYC.  The room was very clean & cute.  The glass shower was great.  There was 1 robe & a pair of slippers in the room.  We had to have an iron & ironing board brought-up.  The bed was very comfortable.  There was a down comforter & down pillows. 
The check-in staff was nice, but the Concierge (Claudio) was phenomenal!! 
I’m only giving them 4 stars because of the size of the room.

title: Wedding & Honeymoon
text:
Staying here currently on day 7 of 10.  We chose this Hotel due to location & reviews, & definitely made the right choice. The staff are so lovely & always helpful. We got married 5 days ago here in NYC and the Hotel went above & beyond to make our day stress free. 
Our room is lovely with a spacious terrace, & the shower is amazing.
2 minutes walk to 911 memorial. Subway station at end of the road.
Pubs and restaurants close by.
25 dollars in taxi up to Times Square.
Carmelo the Concierge deserves a special mention, always has a smile & recommendations of where to eat.
Lovely Hotel, can't fault anything.
Definitely recommend anyone to stay here.
Still enjoying our honeymoon period here 🗽🥂💍 & special treat of snow yesterday so went up to Central Park which looked beautiful.

title: Adorei!
text: Adorei esse Hotel. Próximo a uma estação de metrô, pela qual fizemos todos os passeios.  Ótimas acomodações . Fornecem água diariamente.  Tem cafeteira no quarto.  Funcionários da recepção falam espanhol e inglês,  mto educados e prestativos.

title: Great place
text:
Stayed here for five nights in twin double room. Nice area (financial district by Fulton st station) down a quieter road! Are any?
reception and doormen very helpful. Given umbrellas for the rainy day. Free coffee and water in the room daily.
Clean, well decorated place. Has a gym but no restaurant but this is NY so not short of places to eat.
Walking is easy to Brooklyn bridge and 9/11, got a metro card and went everywhere else!
Thank you to all at Artezen.

title: First Class, INCREDIBLE
text:
Me and my parter came to NYC from the UK, to see the New Year in. We stayed at The Artezen Hotel for 7 nights. We have stayed in many hotels, and this hotel tops every single one of them. 

INCREDIBLE were the staff, who every time we passed in and out greeted us, asked what we were up to, if we needed any water or umbrellas to take with us, offered us restaurant recommendations, had a laugh with us, and simply treated us like family. The kindest of staff and it really is from the heart.

To top it off the rooms are GORGEOUS. Perfect in size. Everything brand new. The bathrooms are something you’d dream of having. All white and black marble and tile with a powerful shower. The hotel smells so good, every time we entered we commented on how good the hotel scent was. Silent are the rooms. It was a relief to leave the chaos of Times Square uptown, to be able to come back to this hotel which is in a quiet peaceful area. 

Location: 
Opposite the hotel is a huge pharmacy that sells everything one possibly needs, especially snacks. It is a 30 second walk from the all famous ‘Joe’s Pizza’. Cute coffee stores near by. The Fulton Subway Station is at the end of the road which carries some of the best food chains also, and is one of the main stations in NY.
It is also a minute’s walk away to the One World Trade Centre and 9/11 memorial. 

We’ve been back to the UK for a couple of weeks now, suffering with January blues and grieving over this hotel and how we wish to be back.

Thank you Artezen for treating us so good. You will forever all be a huge memory to us as we entered a whole new decade in with you. 

We can’t wait to stay with you again.

title: Top Notch Downtown Hotel
text:
Stayed only one night after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and it certainly lived up to its billing. Front desk folks were very friendly and also efficient. The room was basic but it came with 2 bottles of Fiji water, another water bottle for coffee/tea and a few little biscuits - all for free.

What made this hotel more convenient than a hotel in the Times Square area was that there is almost no traffic downtown and it made getting around via a Lyft/Uber so much easier. There are also a lot less people to deal with and a lot of the bar/eateries are open well into the night and early morning.

title: Mycket bra!
text: Bra läge i financial distrikt med flera sevärdheter inärheten och tunnelbanestation precis över gatan. Jättetrevlig och hjälpsam personal och fräscha fina rum med bra standard. Vi var jättenöjda och kommer bo här igen.

title: Good experience
text:
I stayed 3 nights in Artezen during October. 
The location is very good, many underground stations, restaurants near to the hotel. My room was very clean and kept clean the entire time I was there, but the size is quite small. The furnitures modern and nice, many plugins, comfortable bed and huge bathroom. The staff was very helpful and kind. They were really nice. I gave 4 doubles because the fridge in my room was very loud and because no restaurant in the hotel at all.

title: Hotel espectacular!
text:
Nuestra estadía fue por unas vacaciones familiares, somos 4 personas,  nos hospedamos en una habitación doble, con una hermosa ventana. Cada detalle del hotel está pensado en sus huéspedes, las alfombras, almohadas, ropa de cama, ducha, lámparas y detalles como el café, la refrigeradora, los snacks de cortesía, las toallas, etc. Algo importante es la ducha espectacular que tienen, te masajes mientras te duchas!
La atención del personal, espectacular, cada vez que llamamos a recepción para consultar algo, nos atendieron con amabilidad y prontitud. 
Busquen a Carmelo y Ashley son espectaculares! nos atendieron super bien.
El hotel está en una ubicación clave, salimos por las mañanas a nuestros tours que estaban a 4 minutos del hotel.
Lo recomiendo al 100%

title: Experiencia
text: Nos encantó el hotel, estuvimos por un finde semana largo y fue muy cómodo, muy relajante, el personal nos atendió muy bien, el servicio muy bueno, si hacíamos llamadas al front desk nos contestaban muy rápido, con amabilidad y nos solventaban las dudas y solicitudes. Nos gustó mucho que a la hora del check out aunque ya habíamos entregado la habitación pudimos dejar nuestro equipaje unas horas más en el hotel en lo que salimos un rato más a turistear y luego regresamos solo a recogerlas. Las habitaciones son muy cómodas, amplias y en nuestro caso teníamos una vista muy buena.

title: Wonderful experience
text: After reading excellent reviews of the Artezen Hotel, I booked a night for my husband and me a few weeks before Christmas. We could not have been happier with our choice. The staff was wonderful, especially the concierge Carmelo, the room was clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, the linens were lovely, and the shower was great. It was convenient having the subway mere steps away. We especially liked the location, especially during the busy holiday season. We will definitely stay here in the future.

title: Soggiorno perfetto!
text:
L'hotel si trova in una posizione ideale per visitare i posti più importanti di Manhattan vicinissimo alla metropolitana. Le stanze sono confortevoli e ben arredate, avendo un bambino di 6 mesi ci hanno fatto trovare una culla per lui, il letto molto comodo e spazioso pulizia impeccabile. Anche l'offerta di ben venuto con acqua, snack e caffè ( con tanto di macchina e cialde) in camera fanno molto piacere, c'era anche una mini guida di New York.
Compreso del soggiorno avevamo anche l'ingresso nella palestra. L'hotel nuovissimo ha classe ed è molto curato nei dettagli.
Il personale molto gentile e disponibile. Ci ritorneremo sicuramente

title: Not so great
text: Rooms are not that special. There are other hotels in the area with bigger and nicer rooms. The balcony has no view, which defeats the purpose of paying for one. TV was not working upon my arrival and it had to be reset. There’s no actual restaurant in the hotel.

title: Amazing time
text:
We stayed at the Artezen Hotel over Christmas and New Year and adored the hotel; the location, the rooms, the facilities and the staff were all amazing (Ken and Omayra on the front desk stood out for us, nothing was too small for them to help make our stay more pleasant).

The hotel is across the road from the Fulton Station entrance which you can walk through straight to the World Trade Centre (handy if it’s cold or rainy) where to can get a path or subway train to all of the attractions.

The rooms were perfect, the view was spectacular (we were on the 17th floor), always well stocked (Nespresso coffee, chips and water provided) and kept spotless. 

The gym on the 3rd floor was one of the best I’ve used in a hotel, the equipment was good quality and a decent range, the yoga room was handy for doing circuits. The room service (provided by an outside company) was good value and very high quality which can be ordered from the ‘guest services’ button on the iPad provided in the room. The chrome cast on the tv in the room was a nice touch as you can access your own Netflix or Amazon prime.

Honestly our stay was spectacular with the hotel being the perfect place to touch base at after a long day sightseeing. Everything felt in easy reach and the staff were incredibly helpful from helping us find the right subway routes to the nearest medical centre we couldn’t have asked for more.

title: Very pleasant stay
text: The room was well appointed and very clean. The staff is nice, helpful and accommodating. You can’t beat the great location close to shops, restaurants  and a block away from the subway. Highly recommend!

title: The Absolute BEST!
text: I honestly couldn't love this hotel any more. I've stayed at the Artezen several times now and each visit exceeds the prior one. Hands down, the best staff of any hotel in NYC. Kind, attentive, helpful, truly exceptional. The rooms are very well appointed, extremely clean, and are furnished with the most comfortable beds you can imagine. They make it hard to get up. I work near Wall St, so the location couldn't be better. The nearby subway stop has access to most of the lines. Plenty of great coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. A drug store is located directly across the street. When you consider the attention to detail, location and fantastic staff, this is truly one of the best bargains in all of Manhattan. Don't hesitate to book your next stay here. I absolutely love this place!

title: Very Good could be Fantastic
text:
Hotel location very good. Quiet area near Station and all connections. 
New hotel. Well furnished. Check was lovely. Lady was so pleasant. 

However...room service not brilliant. Room wasn’t touched on the first day until after 6.30pm  and the clean isn’t that good. 
Coffee station hardly replenished Altho good to have the machine in the room rather than usual dreadful American coffee. 

Family complained of noisy room for 2 nights and Front Desk did little to sort it. 

On check on they store bags Altho quite a surly attitude from Carmelo who threw my coat in a bin liner to store for the day ! “That’s what we do here sir!”  See photo 
Not a nice way to leave the hotel for the last day. After much protest he got a hanger.  Wasn’t that hard was it ...not sure if they remember last impression is as good as first. 

Overall great hotel. Would stay again.

title: A TOP RATING - STAFF ARE IN THE BALL AND THE HOTEL FUNCTIONS AT A HIGH PROFESSIONAL STANDARD.
text: The hotel is solid. It earns its four stars justly. Solution based staff.High quality bedding, high quality soaps bathrobes and slippers. Most importantly, everything works well. A solid four star hotel with outstanding staff. A special thanks to Omayra and Michael at the front desk. You were so helpful. And Daniel Molestina - you are a star. Thanks for saving the day. - shimon.

title: Mr. and Mrs. McEwen
text: Our stay at the Artezen hotel was fantastic! Carmelo the concierge was so delightful and so helpful anytime we came in and out. The hotel itself was beautiful and located in a great location for walking to shops and restaurants. We would highly recommend this hotel when staying in the city. You won’t get customer service like theirs anywhere else!

title: Excellent hotel, very good location.
text:
It’s a modern boutique hotel. The room is nicely decorated and very clean with a really comfortable king size bed (We loved it). There was a Nespresso machine which we used daily for our wake up coffee. It’s also great that you receive daily 2 bottles of (Fiji) water.

Rooms were cleaned every day with new towels. The bathroom was really good with a nice Rain shower. 

The hotel is located in the center of the Financial District and across the Metro Fulton Street Station. WTC is just 2 blocks away. And it’s even possible to walk over there completely underground via Fulton station and the Oculus. Wall Street is at Walking distance.

This location downton Manhattan is way better then mid or uptown. During weekend and evening traffic is light in the Financial District and it’s not that crowded.

The Fulton street hub is a few doors down the street. You can get everywhere and we used the metro every day. 

I arrived at JFK and took the airtrain / train to Penn station followed by the metro to Fulton street to get to the hotel. Our departure was from Newark, so we took the metro to Newark Penn station (departs from the Oculus) followed by the Bus to Newark airport which was an easy travel and took around 40/45 minutes.

Next door is a wonderful bakery with good quality croissants, sandwiches and friendly staff.

The room was pretty warm to sleep but you can set the temperature yourself. During night we lowered the temperature which turns on the airco.

We really enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Cozy and Nice
text: We chose this hotel because of its good reviews and the possibility that weekend traffic would be light in the Financial District, making it easier to get to lower Manhattan destinations. Good on both counts. The hotel rooms are small but they are well laid out and have everything you'll need in them, although it's a little odd that the coffee machines only make espresso. The staff bends over backwards to be helpful and there's a nice gym on the 3rd floor. One annoyance is that there's only one ice maker in the hotel,  on the 4th floor, but the staff will be happy to bring ice to your room any time. One tip, book early. Our room doubled in price from when I booked it to when we stayed in mid December.

title: Artezen is lovely
text: Four of us stayed at the Artezen hotel last weekend.  It is a lovely hotel, ideally situated.  Artezen is privately owned, in Tribeca.  Location is a few doors down a wonderful bakery and conveniently located across the street is an Irish Pub, which we made use of.  Across the street is a little grocery.  We found exceptional restaurants in the neighborhood.  Carmelo is a fantastic concierge who helped our group with transportation recommendations.  The hotel is spotless, decor modern, the people caring.  I would go back in a heartbeat.

title: Perfect stay
text:
We recently stayed her for my boyfriends birthday and it was a great hotel! I’d stayed near
Time Sq on my last visit and found it far too crowded and busy and when I visited the FD liked the vibe hence why we opted for this hotel in this location. 

Staff: Always welcomed us when we came in or left. Even printed out tickets for the Rockettes for us. They also let you use umbrellas for when it’s raining which was so helpful.

Hotel: It’s a boutique style hotel and it’s lovely and quiet even for NYC. Room was beautifully designed - small but most rooms in the city are but has all you would need. They have an espresso machine, crisps and biscuits and water provided. We never used the gym and knew in advance they had no dining/bar options. With there being a bar across the street it didn’t really faze us. They do provide room service via Butler. We used it on our first night due to jet lag and the chicken wings were amazing the best we had on the trip! 

Location: Perfect, it was the reason for choosing the hotel in the first place and I’m so glad we did. The Fulton st subway hub is a few doors down and we used the subway every day to get about - so easy and cheap. There is an Irish bar across the street which we went to every day for drinks. It’s so close to the WTC and tower and there are many coffee shops, bars and restaurants nearby all more reasonably priced that what we paid in midtown establishments. A Duane Reade is across the road for any snacks or toiletries you may need.

title: Fantastic boutique hotel in lower Manhattan
text: We stayed here for a week and loved it.  Staff were very helpful and personable.  Location was perfect for seeing the city as it is across the street from the Fulton street subway terminal.  Lots to see and do within walking distance.  The room, although small was quiet (5-6 rooms per floor - we were on the 19th), clean and the bed was super comfortable!  Would easily recommend!

title: Resolved reservation issue very amicably!
text: I have not stayed at this property yet, but recently had to resolve a reservation issue. They were very clear in their communication of their policy and more than fair resolving my issue. I respect their customer service approach and would be positively inclined to stay with them in the future.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
At first, when we arrived at the hotel, it wasn’t the typical drive up, large entrance, and is tucked down a street among businesses and stores.  Well, once you entered the lobby, everyone was so nice and greeted us with smiles every time we walked in.  

The room is slightly smaller, but everything was great, from the comfortable bed, amazing shower, and snacks. The closet space is a bit tight for sure, but we made it work.  We did find it amusing to people watch out our window because we were so close to other buildings.  Our friends who travelled with us got a room with a balcony, but with the cold and rainy days, they said they didn’t even really enjoy it much.  We made espresso coffees every morning.  We didn’t know but the hotel supplied umbrellas to use on the rainy days! 

Location-there is a store across the street that you can get all travel items in case you forgot anything.  There is an entrance to the subway a few doors down.  There are coffee shops and restaurants everywhere within walking distance.  

Overall, a fantastic hotel, great location for everything and definitely recommend!!

title: Soggiorno perfetto
text: Sono ritornata ieri da un soggiorno di 6 notti all'Artezen hotel ed è stata un'esperienza positiva per mille aspetti. L'hotel è nuovissimo, situato in lower Manatthan, in ottima posizione, e con poche fermate di metro si è a Times Square. A piedi si raggiunge in breve tempo l'imbarco per il traghetto diretto alla Statua della libertà, il ponte di Brooklyn, il World trade center ed il Memoriale dell'11 settembre. Le stanze sono pulite, confortevoli e dotate anche di macchina Nespresso, e le cialde vengono rifornite quotidiamente, come anche l'acqua, gratuitamente. Inoltre tutto il personale è gentile, disponibile e sorridente. Consigliatissimo!

title: Wonderful hotel with even better staff!
text: Don’t hesitate to book your room at the Artezen! Super clean, spacious rooms (for NYC), wonderful amenities, comfortable beds and pillows and the best staff around! So friendly; super helpful and professional! The concierge, Carmelo, went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed to make our day out in NYC a success! Thank you! We will be back!

title: Excellent!
text:
We have recently just returned from New York and our stay at the Artezen Hotel. From our first enquiry through to check out I have been very impressed. 

I was concerned about Location as I’d always stayed uptown near Central Park, but this hotels location does not disappoint, it is very close to the 911 memorial and new Freedom tower and the ease of getting the subway to other locations is great. There is a subway Center on the corner of the road the hotel is on. 

The hotel itself is beautifully designed and decorated with lovely facilities like the gym and designated area to use once checked out. 

The rooms and bathrooms were more spacious than I expected for New York. 

The staff were very polite and helpful and took a personal interest to ask how my daughter was whom had been ill. Everyone was so helpful. It felt very friendly and welcoming. 

It is family owned and you could tell. It was a lovely family atmosphere. 

I would recommend this hotel and stay here again without hesitation! 

Thank you for not disappointing!

title: Bel hôtel bien situé
text:
Ce « boutique » hôtel est relativement récent (2018) et dispose donc de chambres neuves et bien équipées au niveau du confort et des technologies. Nous avions une Deluxe Kingsize au 4ème étage (no 401). Il se trouve à 300 mètres su mémorial du 11 septembre et peoche de Wall Street. Parfaitement bien situé dans la partie downtown. En effet, comme indiqué par d’autres commentaires, les chambres - bien que relativement petites - sont propres, jolies et correctement agencées et équipées avec de nombreuses prises (dont des USB) et toutes les options qu’il faille avoir telles qu’un peignoir, une télévision écran plat, une tablette tactile, un frigo, un coffre, du café en capsule et de l’eau (complimentary). Le lit - pour notre part King size - était confortable avec un metelas assez dur et un surmatelas. Bonne douche italienne. Produits de toilette. Les WC ne sont pas séparés. La situation de l’hôtel (Downtown) est agréable si l’on connait NY car moins fréquentée que la partie aux alentours de Time Square. Nombreuses bouches de métro aux alentours. WIFI gratuit et top parfait (stable). Petite salle de sport à disposition. Le prix reste correct pour NY. 
Certains points un peu négatifs sont probablement imputables à ma chambre (4ème étage / no 401) tels que :
- les bruits de la route (on donne sur la rue)
- l’insonorisation des chambres (on entend un peu les voisins
- la machine qui fait des glaçons était sur notre étage (très bruyant!)
- pas de petit-déjeuners mais possible de se faire livrer sinon nombreux cafés aux alentours.
Le staff est souriant et agréable. Pour toutes ces raisons je sonne une note de 4/5 mais vous recommande cet hôtel notamment pour le (rapport qualité-)prix qui reste correct au regard de nombreux autres.

title: Nice Hotel...just a couple things...
text:
My wife and I along with another couple came back to nyc to see the lights. Having never ventured south to this area, we were excited to try something new. (We usually stay in Midtown our north)
The hotel is nice-the people are super. (One odd exception I will explain later) We loved Artezen and enjoyed the size and number of rooms. (Rooms are not big by any stretch, but are comfortable) We didn’t have a view, so I’m not sure if there are viewers available. As a Traveling planner, I should’ve asked for a tour. The rain shower head in the bathrooms is amazing. One thing I’d suggest... once the bar of soap goes into the shower, replace it so your patrons don’t have to constantly move it back & forth. (It’s the small things that matter.)
The room stayed warm...too warm. I had no way to cool it down for sleeping. We opened our window but the noise from the street kept us awake. 
Front staff & guys at the door were great.. very friendly. However, this morning when we tried to check out, the front desk person was hard to wake. He was upright and eyes were slightly open but he was almost unresponsive. I asked him several times for a copy of my bill and it never happened. It was surreal. I asked him to print it & asked if he was ok several times. He got the print button because I heard it print, but when I asked him yet again, he mumbled something and said it wasn’t ready?!?
Only other critique... there’s no coffee in the room, only tiny nespresso pods. And, without a restaurant to fall back on for a cup of coffee (not to mention a glass of wine) it doesn’t check all the boxes for me.  For that reason & those preciously started, I likely won’t be back or put clients up here. Glad I tried it. Loved the area & proximity to great places to eat & visit.

title: Great Stay!
text: We just got back from a five night stay at Artezen Hotel. We had a wonderful stay. The room is a nice size and the bed is comfortable. I’m a very light sleeper and the street noise was minimal. The room had a Nespresso machine and bottled water, which was a nice touch. On two occasions during our stay, the alarm clock went off randomly in the middle of the night (I suspect it was accidentally turned on by the housekeeping staff while they were cleaning). The hotel is conveniently located to the Fulton Street Station which makes sightseeing much easier. There’s also a great French cafe (La Parisienne) that was a block away from the hotel; it was delicious!

title: Amazing Gem
text:
Just back from 5 days in New York and stayed at the Artezen.
I cannot fault this hotel from the time the concierge met us at the taxi until the time we left.
This has everything you need in a hotel and more.  Located 2 minutes away from One World Trade Center and the Occulus it is ideally situated for shopping and sight-seeing.
The staff are extremely friendly, polite and helpful.  Being British, on the first day as we were leaving to have a look around I asked for a kettle to make a cup of tea. By the time we came back a kettle and everything to make tea was in our room. There is already a nespresso coffee machine provided
The rooms are spacious, modern and very clean and towels, robes and slippers are all provided. The safe also comes with the room at no extra charge and the beds are very comfortable. On the last evening after an exhausting day shopping and sight seeing we ordered room service which arrived within 15 minutes and was delicious
I cannot praise this hotel enough
Thank you to all the staff for a great stay.  Would love to come back some day

title: A hidden gem in NYC
text:
Our first trip to NYC, and after many hours spent on Google looking at hotels we stumbled upon The Artezen and I’m glad we did.

Great hotel in great location.

Room - We stayed on 10th floor in a deluxe king room, lovely room, super comfy bed & pillows, great shower, overall a lovely room, others have commented on rooms been on the small size, we found ours more than adequate, the only criticism would be the room could’ve done with more hanging space for clothes and perhaps another comfy chair, but we really couldn’t fault it. Room service came every day, replenished the water and any coffee used. Our room was on the front of the hotel and there was minimal noise from the street.

 Hotel – Very clean throughout. All members of staff were very friendly & pleasant, very helpful when needed and asked questions of, nothing was too much trouble for them. Got loads of great tips off the concierges. On checking out they made the time to go through our bill to ensure everything was as it should be. If you’re on a late flight like we where they’ll store your cases and arrange airport transfers for you. They are the ‘faces’ of the hotel and they certainly didn’t disappoint.

Location – After a couple of afternoons experiencing the uptown hustle and bustle The Artezen certainly is in a great location. Walking distance of all downtown landmarks. Yards away from the subway with connections to everywhere. Loads of bars, diners, coffee shops etc. within a couple of blocks.

Overall a great hotel in a great location, friendly staff, lovely room everything you could ask for.

Will defiantly be visiting again.

title: Beautiful new hotel in great location
text: Excellent location in FiDi, on the same block as the Fulton St. station so it was incredibly easy to get anywhere. Super comfortable beds, very nice finishes in the bathrooms, even had a handheld clothing steamer in the closet which was a nice touch. Robes and slippers also provided in the room. Highly recommended for business or vacation travel.

title: Super Hotel mit top Lage
text:
Wir waren für eine Woche in diesem Hotel. Die Lage ist perfekt, direkt an der Wall Street. Die UBahn direkt vor der Tür. Die Zimmer sind luxuriös und der Ausblick aus unserem Zimmer in der 18. Etage super. 
Wir können es nur empfehlen!

title: Wonderful Stay, Super Pleasant Staff
text: Very nice hotel.  All employees super friendly and helpful!  The rooms are not large, but functional. Room had an espresso machine, mini frig and safe.  It does not include a microwave.  The rooms do not include an iron board, but you can borrow one (just call front desk). Each room does have a steamer though. We did use it and was surprise how well it did removing wrinkles from our clothes.  The beds were comfortable but we did not like the pillows (I believe they were feather stuffed. They were too flat). Plenty of plugins for our electronics.  The bathroom was roomy but the sink space was limited. There was a rain shower head and it was  high on the wall. The stream was strong and warm.  We loved the shower head was high on the wall. My husband is 6'1" and some times hotel shower heads are too low.  The lobby, hallways and rooms were very clean.  The hotel decor was modest, modern and simple.  It rained 2 out of the 4 days we were in NY, but the hotel had umbrellas guest can borrow. They were placed near the door on the way out.  That was a much appreciated perk. Fulton subway stop was only 250 ft from the front door.  Other subway stops were within 5 mins of hotel.  Many places to eat nearby.  The 911 memorial was only a few minutes away; within walking distance.  The concierge ordered us a car to the airport.   Very good stay.  We would highly recommend.

title: Great hotel + amazing Staff
text: The hotel is beautiful, brand new, great location, but is the staff that makes the real difference. Wow!! Congratulations!! They greet you with an honest smile, give the best recommendations, anticipate your needs... they make you feel at home away from home.

title: Great location and base for a NYC trip
text: You may never have heard of John Street - it's small and short - but it connects Broadway with the South Street Seaport area, much improved since Hurricane Sandy immolated the area in 2012. Opened in 2019, the Artezen is a full service hotel, minus catering (except for bought-in room service). But that doesn't matter, because within a tight radius of the hotel there are very many restaurants, diners, pubs, bars - raging from super-trendy to old style NY. Close to the World Trade Centre, there is a choice of several subway lines running up-town, or across to Brooklyn and Queens. Super friendly front-desk and concierge. Rooms small, but well equipped and very modern. A budget hotel by NY standards, it still provides a gym and a yoga space.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Loved this hotel! Great location and service. If you can, get a room with a terrace. The terrace is almost as large as the room. Really great staff. Super clean. Very near One World Trade, easy access to Fulton Street Station. Awesome!!

title: Anniversary
text: A friend of ours recommended this hotel and we couldn’t be happier! We visited the city for our anniversary dinner and stayed the night at the beautiful Artezen Hotel. The staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful. The hotel lobby and room were immaculate. The bed was SO comfortable! The streets were quiet at night. It’s located near the World Trade Center Memorial. I recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay again!

title: step out the door and see the Freedom Tower
text: I was looking for a newer property, downtown, and found this one, which opened in April 2019. What a find!  On safe and quiet John Street, with snazzy lobby, friendly doormen and front desk folks, roomy bed and bath rooms, and windows that actually crack open. The 9/11 memorial is literally one block away.
