A brand new subway hub is on the corner. A few nice restaurants and bars are within 1-2 blocks and a miniscule coffee roaster is right on the corner (altho espresso is available in the room). Prices are reasonable. I come to NYC once a year and have stayed in every conceivable neighborhood, but I believe I have found my new fave in Manhattan.

title: Great hotel only one problem
text: Stayed here with my wife for 5 nights. It was a great stay and the staff was excellent and the hotel was very clean. They also had very good pillows! The only problem was on the day of checkout. Checkout was at 11:00am and we had housekeeping knocking on our door at about 8:15am with the do not disturb light on. Knocking to the point that even with the do not disturb, and us not responding, they tried to open the door which was stopped by the lock. We then got a phone call at about 8:30am reminding us to check out. It felt like we were trying to be rushed out hours prior to checkout. There was also some confusion at check out with the front desk saying that someone had already checked out of the room when we had not.

title: Fantastic place at a great price, outstanding location.
text: I stayed here for three days in November 2019. The staff is superb - friendly but not overbearing - the quality, modernity, and cleanliness of the room was outstanding, and the price was terrific. My room  - which was quite small, but all I needed - was on the 18th floor. I opened the window and heard the chaos of NYC, but when I closed the window, I had quiet. There is a nicely equipped gym with barbells, one each of treadmill,  elliptical, and exercycle, and some weight machines. A separate yoga room is attached and can be used for stretching. The location is just  steps from many subway lines and there is fantastic ramen place literally next door.  My only complaint is that the bed and pillows were not as firm as I like, but they weren't sponges; should be fine for most people!

title: Wonderful stay, great location.
text: This boutique hotel is perfectly located a half a block from Fulton Street subway station with just about every line you need to get anywhere in Manhattan. The hotel is new and chic and surprisingly quiet. There is no restaurant or bar on site, but loads of food options in the surrounding area. Rooms are on the small side, but the beds are super lux. We had an issue on our second night there, which was handled perfectly by the owner himself. The rest of the time our stay was great. Concierge "Carmello" really made sure we were taken care of like VIP's. Highly recommended!

title: Short break
text: Needed a hotel for a couple of nights to enable us to visit Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty and to walk over Brooklyn Bridge.  This hotel was situated in just the right location we were able to walk to the bridge easily and also Battery Park.  Good size room, very modern with everything we needed.  Restaurants nearby were great. Staff helpful and friendly

title: Thank you Artezen
text: My husband I stayed stayed here for 13 nights. It was in a great location close to subway, ATM and sites. We made use of the gym and we were able to open the windows in our room which these days is not that common. Carmelo, the concierge was brilliant and provided us with some great tips. We have already recommended Artezen to friends thinking of visiting NY. Thank you Artezen for making our stay so memorable 👍🏼

title: Great base in NYC
text:
We stayed at the Artezen for 4 nights and cannot fault it. The room was comfortable modern and well appointed. The location is perfect for the statue of liberty, Wall Street, the world trade centre memorial and Pier 17.  If you want to head uptown there is also a subway station about 100 yards outside the front door.
The staff were superb, very friendly and helpful on all occasions we needed them.
Would definitely recommend to all.

title: "Great location"
text: We travelled from Ireland and arrived on an extremely wet evening. The staff were extremely welcoming and made us feel at home straight away. The location is situated near a subway station and in close proximity to the World trade centre and Brooklyn bridge. This was our second time in New York and we would highly recommend The Artezen and would definitely stay again if we return.

title: Ferie
text:
Super rent, roligt, dejlige senge, super badeværelse, badekåbe, super føntørre, dejlige sæber og creme, søde og imødekommende, hjælpsomme personaler.
Desværre fik vi ikke anvendt fitness rummet som var super.
Hotel kan vi varmt kan anbefale.
Har ikke lovet noget som de ikke kunne holde.

title: A fantastic stay in NYC
text: Brilliant modern and clean hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We would 100% stay here again. The area is perfect with Fulton St Station a 2 min walk away. Lots of shops and restaurants near by. Staying here made our holiday.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Staffs were very welcoming and friendly at check in and and check out. They all have a smile and made you feel at home. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. The showers updated. Really nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. Very happy we stayed here. Would definitely recommend and come back!

title: Faultless
text:
Stayed here for a few nights in the summer and would definitely stay here again. This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of downtown NYC, near Fulton Centre which is served by many of the main Subway lines.

It's a new hotel with fresh, modern styling, and given that space is at a premium in that part of NYC the double room did not feel cramped. The staff were also very friendly. 

The price we paid for the few nights was very reasonable, and when you take all factors into account, it was excellent value.

title: Fantastic Experience
text:
I ended up at the Artezan Hotel last-minute after checking in to another 4* hotel nearby which turned out to be a 2* in terms of cleanliness and facilities.
What a contrast to where I had come from!
From the minute you arrive at the Artezan you are greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The hotel itself is shiny, new and has such a wonderful atmosphere. As soon as you step off the street you feel like you’re in a different world. 
The room was spotless. The bed was so, so comfortable. I appreciated the fridge in the room and the free snacks and drinks were a really nice touch. I highly recommend this hotel for people needing accommodation in the Financial District.

title: A Lovely Stay
text:
The Artezen is a new, fresh hotel with beautifully appointed rooms.  We stayed for 5 nights in a room with two queen beds.  The hotel is somewhat small with 21 floors but only 6 rooms per floor which makes it quiet.  The staff are all young, energetic, friendly and very helpful and it was a joy walking through the lobby each day.

The room had plenty of drawers and storage and a small fridge is built into the chest of drawers.  The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows.  The bathroom was small but had great lighting and space to set toiletries plus the rain shower was awesome!

The hotel is in a great location on John Street which is a narrow one way street with little traffic so it was quiet.  The Fulton Street subway station is across the street with multiple lines to get around quickly.  The station also contains a Shake Shack, a Dunkin Donuts, and other food options.  Toasties is across the street from the hotel for great grab and go options.  Joe's Pizza is around the corner for whole pies or a late night slice. 

We will be back!!

title: Wow!
text:
Spent a week at this Hotel at Early November...and everything was PERFECT.
From the bed until the last small detail:
From hotel staff,room details,cleanness,noiseproof.....EVERYTHING.

Also,great area with subway at 50m,(9/11 memorial at 3 minutes)and surrounded by a bunch of restaurants.
Well-deserved reputation.

I will for sure repeat!

title: Great location, great amenities, courteous service
text:
Yes, this hotel is located right near a main hub for the metro, so it's great if you want to travel around Manhattan! The location is much quieter, by far, then staying in the middle of manhattan for sure. The amenities are great, you even get a robe and slippers and a Nespresso machine in the room. The bathroom was clean, modern, and the shower was terrific with how spacious it was and for having the separate hand shower!

Service was polite and courteous, and they currently offer to hold your bags on check out day free of charge. Excellent for those who still have things to do in the city on the same day!

title: La mejor sorpresa de la vida
text:
Viajamos a Ny, pues corría el maratón de esa ciudad del 3 de Nov. tenía reservación a partir del 31 a las 3pm, pero llegamos ese mismo día a las 5am. Ángel nos recibió en el lobby, ofreciéndonos todo tipo de ayuda. No nos dieron habitación pues todas estaban ocupadas. Ángel se encargo de hacer amena nuestra llegada. Nos ofreció hidratación, resguardar la maleta, y a las 10am nos dieron habitación (cuando tocaba a las 3pm). Primera gran impresión. 
La gente del hotel nos atendió siempre de maravilla: Ángel, Carmelo, Ashley, Michael y Sal. Todos pendientes siempre de nuestra estadía, y de cómo me había ido en el maratón. Gente muy humana. 
Las instalaciones del hotel espectaculares, limpio en todo momento. Buscaban siempre la perfección, cosa que se veía en cada detalle y en cada saludo.
Recomiendo Artezen Hotel para vivir unos días maravillosos en una ciudadela maravillosa!!!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: We travelled as a family for 5 nights to take part in the NYC Marathon.  The hotel is clean, tidy and well equipped and decorated.  The coffee machine and pods were very much appreciated!!  It is also very conveniently located for the financial district, the Staten Island ferry for the marathon start (10 minutes walk) and for many of the metro lines.  There is a good selection of eating places within easy walking distance.  I used the gym everyday, which was adequately equipped for the size of the hotel.  We stayed in a delux two queen bed room which was fine for two adults and 3 and 6 year old.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  Just two observations; if you are easily disturbed at night you don't want a room on floor 4 as the ice machine is incredibly noisy when operating.  Also, our room was facing John Street, which was noisy from around 0600hrs onwards, but in reality most hotel rooms in NYC suffer from road noise and our room was reasonably well insulated.  Don't let these two observations detract from my very positive review of an excellent hotel.

title: Wonderful Marathon holiday
text: Excellent service, helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and convenient downtown location. My experience changed my belief that midtown locations were the best option. Close to Chinatown, South Street Seaport and World Trade Center and Memorial. Easy access to mass transit for public transit travelers. Refreshing experience.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text: High quality hotel with a great location in FiDi. Friendly and helpful staff, nice room with a good bed, and surprisingly quiet even when staying close to the ground floor. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Concierge Carmelo,Front Desk, Ashley the Angel.
text: Amazing from beginning to end. Ashley was wonderful as she booked my reservations.   I was greeted by Angel whom checked us in and He made sure he informed us of all the amenities within the hotel. The  recommendations of Carmelo were simply amazing and always smiling and providing a homely feel to our stay. Staff was professional, courteous and kind. The hotel was immaculately clean. The bed was comfortable. Snacks we great.  I Will be recommending this hotel to family and friends. Stores and eatery are lose by. I rate this hotel and my stay excellent. We will be returning. Thank you

title: Loved it.
text: We loved staying here. We were in NY long enough to try 3 different hotels and this was by far our favourite. Great location, really friendly and helpful staff and perfect rooms with everything we wanted - including being able to open the window to get fresh air! We'll be back for sure.

title: Consistent Friendliness!
text: This property just opened in April, 2019, so it's nice to stay at a hotel where everything is fresh and new.  The bathroom is great, the location is great (across street from Fulton station), and what's best is that the staff is uniformly friendly and helpful.  My two suggested improvements:  a real coffee maker in the room (not the mini one that just makes espressos); remove the resort fees (it's not a resort).

title: Great Hotel
text: We loved this hotel - the beds are super comfy and we found it quiet at night. We stayed for a week and had adjoining rooms (2 adults & 2 teenagers). Was lovely to come back to after busy days out. The staff are all really friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome.  Very close to lots of attractions and the subway is right across the street for getting uptown. Loads of great restaurants nearby (Eataly & the Malt House highly recommended, also Hole in the Wall for breakfast). We didn’t use the room service, but the menu looked good. Will definitely stay here next time we come to New York.

title: Very Clean, Super Friendly Staff
text:
My (almost 6 yr old) son and I stayed at the Artezen from Oct 12-16, 2019. We had a Deluxe King room on the 5th floor facing John St. Overall, it was a nice stay. Almost everyone at the front desk was very friendly, and the concierge/doormen were helpful. We stayed on West Coast time during our trip, and the curtains in our room kept out almost all the light. We never felt unsafe coming back to our room at midnight. The Fulton St Subway station is practically next door, and it's a huge station that takes you almost anywhere.

We didn't have much trouble sleeping, but if you have noise issues, I would recommend earplugs and/or not having a room facing the street. There is no soundproofing from the hotel hallway or the street. 

The bathroom looks gorgeous, but functionally could use some more hooks (there's one on the door), and a place to hang your towel that is by the shower door. Also, the bottom of the glass shower wall leaks, which we found out the hard way on our first night. If you mistakenly hit it with water from the handheld showerhead, or even splash it while showering, be prepared for floor flooding. The toilet paper roll is also in an odd place. Great selection of toiletries.

Pros: Bed was very comfy, room size was good for NYC standards, subway station on the same block, friendly staff, fast elevators, Chromecast capability on the TV, plenty of USB outlets, great blackout curtains

Cons: Noise buffer is non-existent (street noise and hotel hallway noise came right into our room), glass shower wall does not prevent water from coming out on the bottom, weird placement of toilet paper roll (you have to reach forward from the toilet)

title: Great location, modern, clean hotel
text: We loved staying here. The rooms are modern and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was large, modern and the shower was excellent. The hotel is half a block from a subway stop and two blocks from Century 21 shopping centre and the Oculus. I would stay here again!

title: What a fabulous hotel!
text:
We just stayed 10 nights and would definitely stay again. Fantastic location in the financial district minutes from Fulton St Subway. Bed was so comfortable, could plug your phone into the lights by the bed to charge them. 

Room wasn’t big but it didn’t feel cramped. New bottles of Fiji water every day. There was very little outside noise so we slept well. Could order in food at reasonable prices but we didn’t use that service.

Nothing was too much trouble, from getting printed directions to going by train to a laundry where we could wash our clothes, or help to find an electronics store. And umbrellas in the lobby for those wet days.

title: Very nice hotel!
text: Great location within walking distance of the subway,One World, and many other locations. Very clean and the staff was nice and helpful. Comfortable and cozy rooms. Even loaned us an umbrella on a rainy day.

title: Einfach tolles Hotel - nix zu meckern:-)
text:
Tolles Hotel- liegt sehr gut und zentral bei der Wall Street. Ubahn um die Ecke mit den wichtigsten Linien. Viele kleine nette Cafes in den Seitenstrassen.
Sehr freundliches und professionelles Personal. 
Zimmer zwar klein aber sehr hochwertig und modern ausgestattet. Super Bett!! Laut erwartet war aber perfekt ruhig.
Transfer auf Rückweg für 80 Dollar angeboten - wäre interessant gewesen auch auf Hinweg. Könnte deutlicher auf der Webseite angeboten werden.
Alles super - kommen gern wieder:-)

title: Enjoyed this little hotel
text: It's new to New York.  The staff was so helpful and friendly.  The bed was so comfy asked to know where they are from.  The rooms are small but very well appointed.  Very close to the 911 Memorial.  Great bar around the corner.  There is no room service thru the hotel, but can order from next door and it's delivered to your door within 10 minutes if not sooner.  The coffee was $4 - can't beat that.  Also a great little coffee machine in the room that can make espresso (too strong for me).

title: Great location in lower Manhatten
text:
Staff friendly, helpful, and made our stay great. Location was great. Walking distance to 9 11 Memorial, the Battery, and the Brooklyn Bridge. Room service was fast and accurate. Just a lovely stay. We also were near the Stock Market in the financial district. 
When we came back from walking we were handed another water bottle. The cab was gotten for us to the door. The room was clean and nicely appointed.

title: Parfait !!
text:
Hôtel parfait, personnel très attentionné. Les chambres sont récentes et très propres.
L’hôtel est très bien situé car il est en face du métro (50m) et à 5 mins du mémorial du 11 septembre.
Super séjour.

title: Very good!
text:
This hotel was clean, quiet, and in a great location.

The staff were friendly and polite, helpful and kind.

The only thing I wish had been different is that while we were there we got married and we were wished well but a personal touch would have been greatly appreciated, e.g. even a glass of wine or something like that to acknowledge our special day.

Other than this it was a lovely stay.

title: Muito bom!!
text: Hotel novo, funcionários muito simpáticos, gentis, auxiliam para transfer, passeios e afins. Quarto limpo, super silencioso. O hotel está localizado próximo à estação Fulton, o que praticamente faz conexão a Manhattan inteira.

title: Great location in a great city
text:
The Artezen, which opened earlier this year was a great find. 
If you are looking for a hotel in the financial district the location is excellent. It is on a relatively quiet street, (if there is such a thing in NYC), it's close to a subway station  and there's lots of options for food and shopping close by.
My only disappointment was we had requested a high floor on booking but unfortunately they gave us a room on level 2 which meant we needed to keep the curtains closed all the time to stop people seeing in when they looked up! 
As others have mentioned, the rooms are small with just short hanging for shirts or jackets hence I could not hang up my dress.
Water and coffee machines are provided in the rooms, no creamer or milk though which would have been great, I know I could have probably asked but who wants to bother doing that first thing in the morning.
Good toiletries, which always makes the difference.
The roof bar will be an added bonus too when it opens later in the year.
Would stay here again if we could get a higher floor.

title: Trivsamt hotell med mycket trevlig personal
text:
Detta var vår första resa till NY och till USA överhuvudtaget. Därför går det följaktligen inte för mig att jämföra hotellet med andra hotell i NY eller i USA. Jämför jag med hotell i Sverige och i andra delar av Europa så är Artezen värd en fyra. Möjligt att det är värt en femma om jag viktar det i framtiden mot andra hotell i NY/USA.

Servicen var toppen! Trevlig och tillmötesgående personal konstant under vår vistelse. Det uppskattade jag. Rummen var ganska små, men fräscha. Sängen otroligt skön! Vi hade en terass också som höjde upplevelsen. Städningen perfekt. Läget bra nära Fulton Street där många tunnelbanelinjer går. Vi är mer än nöjda och Artezen snuddar vid en femma!

title: Last minute surprise
text: My wife booked this hotel at the last minute for a business trip to New York. New York can be a hard city to do business in but the Artezen makes the visit worthwhile. The concierge as well as the entire staff went out of their to make my stay feel personal and welcoming. Extraordinarily clean and comfortable. First rate location if you need to be in the financial district. Looking forward to future visits to the city if I can stay there.

title: Amazing Hotel and fantastic staff
text: Our family stayed at the Artezen for 7 nights in September. This was our 9th trip to New York and the Artezen is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. We normally stay in the Financial District so we are familiar with this area. It has everything you need on the  doorstep of the hotel. The rooms were perfect and the staff are so friendly and courteous. An amazing team!  We were so sad to leave and can't wait to make a return visit to this wonderful hotel . Keep up the good work!

title: Awesome hotel
text:
My wife found this hotel and I am very glad she did. 

We arrived early, dropped our bags off and set about exploring the area, so much within walking distance and the subway just down the block.  

The hotel was very well kept, room was well appointed and stocked with complimentary water and snacks. All the staff was very friendly and pleasant to talk to. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel and location
text: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. The rooms were a bed room plus shower room and though small (we lived out of a suitcase) have everything you need. You get daily bottled water, a coffee machine in room plus a kettle on request. Fulton subway is across the road as is a great American Irish bar. 20 minutes or so and £2.75 each gets you to Times Square. A cab ride will cost nearly $20 with tips. Georges is 5 minutes away for a great breakfast. Or McDonalds is 1 minute around the corner.

title: Great for a getaway!
text: We had a fantastic stay for our Anniversary! The Concierge was more than helpful and everyone was courteous and friendly. The rooms were very modern and clean.  The tablets in the room containing room amenities, weather, sightseeing, etc; info is a great touch!  We will definitely be back!

title: Amazing hotel , Amazing staff
text: We spent two weeks staying at The Artezan Hotel in August/September. The staff were so friendly & greeted us by name every time they saw us. We mentioned that it was our 30th wedding anniversary & about 10 minutes later a beautiful bottle of wine & card arrived. The room was immaculate. The hotel is very close to the subway- it’s across the street. The Occulus & Freedom Tower are a 5 minute walk. There’s a supermarket in walking distance as well as many restaurants of many different tastes & prices. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone & we will be returning here again on our next trip to New York.

title: Good location, great service, very clean
text: About 2 blocks from the Freedom tower and 1 block from the Fulton subway station - great location in the heart of the Financial district. Rooms are comfortable and modern  and gym is reasonable. Lots of restaurants are nearby which is good since the hotel doesn’t have a bar but it’s not essential. Irish bar across the street. I will return for sure.

title: Exceptional value - excellent staff
text: This is welcome new addition to lower Manhattan. We prefer to stay in the Wall Street area as it’s quiet on weekends and holidays. Steps away from the Oculus, Old Saint Paul’s, Trinity Church. The rooms are small (not surprising in NYC), but well appointed with high end furnishing, Fretta linens, s as nd Bigelow grooming products. The staff is friendly, good humored and hospitable. A full gym and yoga studio are on premise.

title: Perfect
text: No traffic sounds from the street or screaming from the next room. Perfectly quiet, clean, comfortable, well situated and affordable. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Subway stations too. The perfect hotel in NYC.

title: Perfect location, great service, beautiful new hotel at a great rate. A gem downtown!
text: What a find! I needed a room in the financial district that was walking distance to a Saturday night formal event, close to the ferry for access to Governors Island the next day, and accessible to the subway, and this place exceeded my expectations. Small, bright, clean and perfect room, and at a great rate. Everything was brand new (not to mention the softest, most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in), free snacks, great technology, tablet in the room, great TV and wifi, high-tech finishes, and a brand new fitness center. Beautiful bathroom, high end fluffy towels, and delicious spa-quality toiletries -- sounds simple, but these things make a difference! The best part of the stay, however, was the friendly customer service and wonderful care and attention I was shown by the staff. I will definitely try to stay here anytime I need a place downtown in NYC. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Love this hotel!
text: I stayed at The Artezen with my husband for 5 nights. It’s conveniently located steps from the Fulton St subway station and there is a drugstore and abundance of food nearby as well. I believe the hotel opened in spring earlier this year, so everything is still sparkling and brand new. I stayed in a deluxe king room which was a good size for New York standards. The bathroom was small, but perfectly fine for one person at a time to get ready. The bedding and mattress were extremely comfortable, so much so that I never missed my own bed at home, and I also loved all of the furniture in the room.  The room had a mini fridge and 2 Fiji water bottles were restocked every day. The staff were always friendly and greeted us every time we passed through the lobby. Overall I loved the style and cleanliness of the hotel, and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again in the future. It’s expensive, but everything in New York is, and I felt like this hotel was a good value - good amount of space, very new and clean and a good location. You can pay close to as much in other areas in Manhattan and get less space in an older kind of run down hotel.

title: My stay in Artezen
text:
The hotel is located very conveniently close to Fulton Metro station and Broadway. The hotel is surrounded by number of store and take away. 

For the exorbitant rate, the facilities are very limited. There is no restaurant or even a coffee shop, which means no breakfast in the hotel.

I checked into the room late. Later in the night, I realized that AC was not working and the room temperature was around 25C! The next day after my complained, they rectified it late in the evening, almost after 20 h!

The staff are very cordial but not necessarily professional. They charged me twice $100 and $275 for security deposit and just brushed it aside saying that it was only blocked amounts and it was just a mistake. I hope that I will get the money back.

I booked for Liberty Statue cruise through their concierge and that I found that the cruise I booked would start from Time Square and not near Ground Zero, as I was told. Of course, the staff at that time helped to cancel the wrong booking and put me onto a right cruise. He apologized for the mistake by his colleague.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel!
text: The Artezen is a gem of a boutique hotel! It has a fantastic staff and manager who went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional!  It has a convenient location and being a new hotel the rooms are pristine. There is an espresso machine in each room which made great coffee and was a special touch!  Highly recommended! We will stay here again!

title: Great and very conveniently located hotel
text: We recently stayed in the Artezen for a short break in New York. This place is fantastic. Whilst it doesn't have facilities such as a restaurant, we felt very comfortable in this very modern hotel, located really close to the World Trade Centre and about 30 seconds from Fulton Street metro station. I can't fault the hotel. It had every thing we needed and we had a very pleasant stay.

title: Amazingness!!
text: This was my first time actually staying in the city and I am so glad I chose to stay here!!  The staff was so very friendly and accommodating!  The deluxe king room was absolutely gorgeous!  The bed was so luxurious and comfortable.  The views were also great.  I plan on staying here the next time I visit the city!  😊

title: Belle découverte au cœur de financial district
text:
Formidablement bien situé au cœur de financial district, à quelques pas de la station de métro de fulton street, où convergent de nombreuses lignes qui vous emmèneront partout dans nyc.
5NYC.
5-7 a pied pour rejoindre le pier 11, pour emprunter le nyc ferry pour une balade sur l east river, soit vers le Nord jusqu au queen (gantry, voire astoria) ou vers le sud (brooklyn)
La chambre avec lit king size au 7ème est certes petite, mais compensé par la terrasse. Sdb ok. Par contre l armoire est vraiment trop petite et les murs un peu "legers" concernant l insonorisation.
Housekeeping en dessous des attentes pour ce genre d hotel. Il vaut mieux laisser quelques instructions sur le bureau en partant pour être sur que tout soit fait en bonne et due forme. A défaut, la réception réglera vite le problème le soir zu retour à l hotel.
Malgré cela, nous reviendrons tout de même lors d'une prochain séjour dans la grosse pomme.

title: Great stay, convenient location!
text: What a wonderful stay! My mom and I spent a few nights at the Artezen hotel and the staff were so kind and welcoming. Our room was very clean and the location was conveniently close to the subway. Easy access to get where you need to go. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Thank you !!
text:
What can we say - brilliant hotel and staff are fantastic. We arrived into JFK and used the air train/metro which was very easy and Fulton metro station is literally outside the door. Carmelo is the man to speak to if you need help or tips !! I cant recommend this hotel highly enough 

Thank you again.

title: Wonderful Property
text: Just spent 9 wonderful, pampered days at this property and could not be more pleased with my choice, in the Financial District. Clean, well run, wonderful airy quiet room. Staff could not have been more helpful. No request went unanswered to my complete satisfaction. I would not mind moving in here permanently if I could be assured the current staff would remain. I have been spoiled!

title: Amazing experience!
text: The location was perfect and easy to find. Also, the staff was great and the room very comfortable and pretty. Thanks to Erica and Carmelo for all of their attentions! We hope to be back and stay again soon.

title: Fantástico hotel
text:
pasamos 9 días en el hotel, hermoso en todos sus aspectos, la habitación con terraza Soñada
la atención de todo el personal excelente, la ubicación muy buena, en la esquina el metro, cerca de muchas atracciones y lugares de compras

title: Friendliest Place in Manhattan
text:
We had the best stay!  The hotel was easy to find.  Every single person greets you when you walk in, and Carmelo’s smile immediately put us at ease after our travels,  he gave us water, and helped us store our bags for the day.  The front desk lady, Grace? (I think that’s wrong) Amanda? Was so welcoming.
Once we got back, our room was ready and was so much more spacious than I thought it would be.  We stayed in a queen room with an armoire, desk, and nice bathroom.  The walk in shower had great water pressure, and everything was sparkling clean.
The bed was the most comfortable we’ve had in a long time.  
The location itself was perfect for us.  Next to the subway as well as the Path.  Lots of great eats around too.
There was a well situated gym, but we were too tired after our days of walking.  
All in all, our new favorite place to stay.

title: Excellent new hotel in the Financial District
text: We stayed 3 nights at The Artezen, and would highly recommend the experience to others. Unlike older hotels that come with some negative features like bad smells, loud pipes, and tiny rooms, this is an updated property in a prime location. The rooms were clean, reasonably spacious, with comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom was well appointed and the room is stocked daily with complementary water, nespresso, and chips. The staff was friendly and attentive. They provided complementary umbrellas when it rained and were enthusiastic about helping you. Conveniently located neat the Fulton subway stop and near Wall street, the neighborhood boasts several fine coffee shops, an Irish pub, and the Fidi location of the famous Joe's Pizza. Great for business and vacation travelers.

title: Prima
text:
Das sehr zentral bei der Wall Street gelegene Hotel hat uns durch die gepflegten und sauberen Zimmer
überzeugt.
Man fühlt sich Willkommen hier.
Ein Glücksgriff gerne beim nächsten mal wieder.
Es gibt eine Nespresso Maschine und einen Kühlschrank im Zimmer.

title: Perfetto!
text: Hotel perfetto!! A pochi passi dal Memorial dell'11 settembre e comodo al traghetto per la statua della Libertà. Stazione metro vicinissima per raggiungere qualsiasi altra zona. Camera perfetta, spaziosa, silenziosissima a disposizione nespresso e acqua. Abbiamo usufruito anche del servizio lavanderia: impeccabile! Personale molto cordiale e soprattutto volevamo fare i complimenti a chi ha pulito la nostra stanza: grazie, era perfetta. Complimenti a tutti!!

title: Fantastico !!
Simply perfect
text: Logistically well located next to Fulton Center (metro station and mall), 9/11 Memorial. Brand new, spotless clean, cosy room not too small, complimentary coffee, tablet, good bed. The staff is very attentive and professional. Simply perfect.

title: Consigliato !
text:
Hotel situato nella zona del Financial District, nuovo e molto pulito . Camera carina con macchina da caffè nespresso, ogni giorno acqua e snack.
Metro linea Fulton vicinissima .
Personale discreto e gentile. 
Per chi desidera soggiornare nella zona di wall street è il top!

title: An excellent hotel
text: What a gem this hotel is!  We booked direct with the hotel and stayed in a twin queen bed room - two adults and two children (10 and 12).  The room is average size for Manhattan (a bit of a squeeze for 4 people with suitcases) but it is well laid out and very comfortable.  Beautiful room with  lovely amenities.  The Fiji water daily was much appreciated.  The bathroom was also very nice.  The beds were extremely comfortable and most importantly the room was very quiet - very little noise from outside.  The staff were always very friendly and kind - very time we walked through reception we were greeted with a friendly smile and welcome.  Close to the Subway - literally steps away with many dining options close by.  Carmello at the door is an asset to the hotel - friendly and knowledgeable - make sure you book your transport through him - you’ll not only get a quality transport he’ll also make sure you get a good price.

title: Great stay
text:
Everything was wonderful, we arrived early afternoon and were able to check in early. The staff were very kind, helpful and courteous. 
Very clean and fashionable rooms. They have a very nice room service menu. Kept a small fridge in the room for personal items, and had a great shower. 
They were even able to hold our luggage at check out while we went into the city. Very close to tourist attractions- 9/11 memorial and museum, several metro options available nearby to take you anywhere in the city. Would definitely return and recommend to anyone looking to stay in Manhattan.

title: Great place to stay in FiDi
text: I got a great deal on Artezen for a weekend that I was in NYC, and I was very pleased with my stay.  The rooms were clean, comfortable, and made good use of the small space without feeling cramped.  The supervisor on duty, Ken, was also very attentive and quickly resolved any issues that came up.

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC
text:
We really had 4 fantastic days in NYC and like to thank the Artezen Hotel!
The hotel location is perfect: the subway is just across the street, several lines to all important attractions and a lot of tourist things in walking distance.
Our room 202 was great: enough space to store 3 suitcases and several backpacks, hardly a noise from the street. But what I liked most was to sit on the bed next to the window drinking some tea or coffee and watch the people outside.;-)
The price of the room was fabolous. We were checking several websites like Expedia and Tripadvisor but finally booked directly on the hotel Website as it saved us alot of money.
The room was very clean at the check in, the housekeeping did a very good job all days! One day we came back to the hotel an the maid was not ready yet. We wanted to wait outside of the room but were kindly asked to take a seat in a conference room. 
We did not book breakfast in the hotel. There are so many restaurants and take aways just around the corner so you won't starve. We also ordered breakfast and dinner once with the room service. It is a delivery service and worked quite well.
Last but not least I have to mention the staff: everyone we had to deal with was very friendly and helpful. Special THANX to the doorman Carmello.
We really liked the Artezen Hotel and recommend it!!!

title: Really amazing place/staff
text:
I'm 5 days in with 5 to go
Absolutely stunning hotel, it is spotlessly brand new, smells amazing and fresh when u walk through the doors, and a breath of fresh air walking inside rather than outside.

The rooms are beautiful, very comfortable beds,  and air conditioning in this August heat is a great comfort to come back to after a day of sweating and gasping for air.

The Fiji water is such a nice touch, and the shampoo, conditioner and shower gel are actually really nice as I always like to use what I'm use to when I'm home, but i used it today as I ran out and it was actually spot on!

The staff, where do I begin omg...each and every one of them are the friendliest of people, they cannot do enough for us, asking if we need anything, if they can help us, to opening doors, ringing taxis, and especially Carmello who helped me sort out a misunderstanding i had with a New York pass I bought before I arrived in NY and taught I was covered on the hop on hop off buses, to getting us a great deal on another one with greyline, and we where good to go, he really helped us out in a city we where kinda lost in and we cannot thank him enough, and he also recommended the Victorian gardens fair for my young kids which I knew nothing about, and ended up having a wonderful day there yesterday that was not planned.

Stay here if u are looking for cleanliness, great staff, great location, comfort, and most importantly a holiday worth your money!

title: Parfait - durée du séjour 11 nuités
text:
Les élogieux commentaires de cet hôtel sont largement mérités , tout est au top 

Chambres spacieuses et bien équipées : Tv, nespresso, frigo, clim, prise ethernet, defroisseur vêtement, séchoir, peignoir et chausson, necessaire bureau et surtout des prises USB  absolument partout ( même dans les lampes). La literie est très confortable, la terrasse agréable bien que bruyante  (c'est NY on n'y peut rien  ). Des petits plus amusants et bien pensés comme par exemple le fait de mettre une serviette à démaquiller noire au lieu de la traditionnelle blanche qui est tout de suite salie.

L'emplacement est au top puisque face à la station de métro world trade center dans laquelle passe quasiment toutes les lignes de la ville ainsi que la gare qui part vers le New Jersey. Outre l'immense centre commercial la petite rue regorge de boutiques et on est a deux pas de tout ! 
nourriture/ vêtement abordables , restaurants et boutiques plus haut de gamme ( nobu/eataly )  teinturerie en face ainsi qu'un duane reade , 

Le personnel est absolument adorable. Quelque soit le service demandé, ils sont toujours prêt à répondre à vos besoins et cela avant même votre arrivée . Je leur avait adressé un mail pour savoir s'ils possédaient une navette depuis l'aéroport : j'ai reçu une réponse d'une demi page m'expliquant toutes les possibilités offertes et les tarifs .

Une seule petite ombre au tableau : le jour de notre arrivée la chambre contigue à la notre était occupée par deux personnes complètement sous l'emprise de la drogue et qui ont écouté de la musique  et hurlé sur la terrasse toute la nuit : Nous n'avons pas dormi une seule minute de la nuit entière . L'hôtel est intervenu semble t il une fois, sans que cela ne change rien . Un peu plus d'insistance aurait été la bienvenue . Au vu de ce problème nous aurions apprécié un petit geste commercial ou un petit cadeau de dédommagement . Cela n'a pas été le cas . C'est regrettable .

Quelques petits ratés au niveau de la chambre . Sur les 11 nuits il est arrivé plusieurs fois qu'il y ait des ratés sur les produits de toilette ( oubli d'un shampoing ou autre ). Il va de soit que si nous avions demandé on nous l'aurait sans aucun doute amené.

Néanmoins nous garderons un excellent souvenir de notre séjour et nous conseillons vivement cette adresse

title: Friendly and helpful staff, Clean, Comfortable and Great Location
text:
We were a party of 6 people and stayed for a week during August 2019.  We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The rooms are very nice - clean, well equipped including very comfortable beds, flat screen tv, coffee machine and steamer for clothes to name a few of the features.  The hotel also has a fully equipped gym which was fantastic. 
The location in Lower Manhattan is ideal - a stone's throw from Fulton St subway with great connections to the rest of Manhattan. Local places of interest include Wall St, 9/11 Memorial, Westfield shopping centre, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry and Brookfield Place with it's beautiful marina.  No restaurant in the hotel yet but were told that there would be one very soon.  Plenty of restaurants and bars in the area so wasn't an issue for our party on this trip..

Finally, a special thanks to the lovely staff at the Artezen.  Very welcoming from the outset and the standard of customer service was excellent for the duration of our stay.  We certainly were made to feel at home and nothing was too much trouble.  Carmelo in particular was superb - always smiling, excellent local knowledge and always willing to offer advice including help with airport transfers etc.

We look forward to returning to this hotel and would highly recommend.

title: New, Fresh and Clean
text:
Really liked my stay here.  Hotel is new so feels very clean and fresh.  Not too big so easy to get in and out of and John Street is not as busy/hectic as the larger streets. 
 Room was nice and quiet.  Service was super friendly.  Very fair price.  Will definitely stay here again.  Very convenient for WTC.

title: Amazing staff!
text: This place has absolutely shocked me an my wife with how amazing there costumer service is every single time you come in you are greeted by every single employee from the moment we got there to the moment we left. Not to mention how close everything is to this hotel all the spots u wanna go are wishing 15 mins of a subway ride.They also had great recommendations for food an places to see all of that. But nobody was more helpful then Erica when my wife an I left this hotel we were going to Niagra Falls NY with trips already booked going into Canada but we forgot our passports in the safe!!! So we urgently called the Artezen to see if they can help us in anyway to ship them over.. an without a hesitation Erica helped us right away an sent them to us overnight shipping so we will have them for the rest of our vacation can’t even to describe how great full we are there costumer is top notch!! Book an don’t think twice!! Thank you so much Erica an all the staff at the Artezen for such an enjoyable time there.

title: 居心地の良い、そして立地の良いホテル
text: ホテルのスタッフはとても親しみやすく親切でした。ウォール街、９１１メモリアルパーク、バッテリーパーク、ブルックリン橋、センチュリー２１すべて徒歩圏内です。部屋はコンパクトですが清潔で快適に過ごせました。また機会があったら宿泊したいです。

title: Not a Million-Dollar View, but a Million-Dollar Hotel and Staff!
text:
Based upon the reviews I read, I decided to try this newer boutique hotel, and I am very glad I did.  It was located  close to both the Financial District & Battery Park.  Plus, the Fulton Street Subway Station is located almost directly across the street.  The 911-Memorial, along with the 911 Museum and Tower One are less than half a block away, as well as the Oculus Center with its shops & eateries.  

The hotel only has a few rooms on each floor. The intimate lobby is beautiful & elegant. But what sets this hotel apart are two things:  their world-class staff & the amazing beds/bedding in the room. It was a quiet, relaxing retreat from the heat during our stay. The bed (king-size) was probably the most comfortable one I have ever slept in, & the pillows downy soft & luxurious.

The hotel staff is amazing!  I developed a cough while there and asked the front desk where I could get some salt to gargle with. One of them actually walked across the street to a deli and returned with four packets of salt for me!  A little thing, but it demonstrates their willingness to go above and beyond. They also let us check out an hour late to match our departure schedule better.  

A special tip of the hat for Carmello, who always had a smile on his face as well as the other concierge (sorry, I did not get his name), who, too, was always willing to help when needed.  

I loved this hotel!  Will definitely stay again the next time I travel to NYC. TY to everyone for such an enjoyable stay!

title: New small hotel
text: Great customer service and location. Small rooms, bed, desk and one chair  and no food or bar facility, but cafe and lounge on the way. Great price for NYC. I would return, especially when in NYC for leisure.

title: Excellent customer service!
text: This little gem is in a great location for touring sites and has the best concierge staff in town!  The rooms were clean and very comfortable.  There was a mistake with our bill and I called back to the hotel - they immediately corrected it and apologized.  I would go back to New York just to stay here!

title: I'd Stay Here Again and Again!!!
text: Upon arrival, we had parked around the corner from the hotel to inquire if they had valet service. They didn't but Carmelo (concierge) came out of the hotel and around the corner to retrieve our baggage so we didn't have to walk a few blocks with our bags. This was super kind and helpful. But, in addition to that, he was extremely helpful, funny, and kind throughout our stay. This was an impressive start to our visit. The lobby and our room were beautifully decorated and nicely appointed. Clean doesn't begin to convey how spotless this hotel was which is so important to me. This hotel is within steps to the nearest subway station, a very short walk to the 9/11 Museum and Memorial, and close to many restaurants. It's also on a quiet street which helps with getting a good night's sleep. The mattress in the room was another key factor to great sleep. I would love to find out what it was because I would sincerely purchase one! Each time we came back to the hotel, we were given small bottles of cold water to help given that it was rather hot during our stay. This was a very nice touch. Miguel also was extremely helpful, printing out directions and offering advice for our daily itineraries. I simply can't say enough about how welcoming they were! I'd stay here every time I go back to NYC!

title: Great Hotel
text:
We stayed a couple of nights at the Artezen hotel, the place is clean and the service (front desk) was appropriate. The room was clean, the . bathroom contained an appropriate amount of towels / soap. We loved the idea of providing mouth wash too. 

The hotel is located in the bottom half of Manhattan, it's a great location, there are a large number of metro lines close to it. We used the metro to go around and to visit lady liberty it's a perfect location. It's also 2 hours walking distance from central park (we walked up and down twice, and we loved it, at allows to explore the city).

The location is safe, we didn't had any problems at night, and we usually walked back from upper Manhattan every day. 

One minor point that could be improved in the future; 

 I) At the check-in, we were told that included in the price was a charge of 9.99$/day for snacks, water, biscuits and coffee within the room. On the day of check-in we indeed found all the items described, although as the days passed, only the coffee and water were replenished, which is a bit disappointing  (First Day : 4 Biscoff Cookies, 4 Coffee, 2 Fiji water, 2 packs of crips) Second Day onwards (4 coffees, 2 Fiji waters), I don't think it's a big deal, but as we were told, to use the snacks as we paid for them, it would have been nice to have the snacks we got on arrival.

title: Brilliant hotel!!!
text: What a brilliant hotel! As the hotel is brand new everything is well kept and has been finished to a high standard. The rooms are a really good size, much bigger than other rooms I have stayed at in New York. As lots of the reviews mention the staff are so friendly and welcoming, opening the doors for you when you enter and leave the hotel, always speaking and smiling. The bed is so comfortable, we have slept really well! I have really enjoyed the location, not as busy as other areas but still close to restaurants and shops! One evening we were too tired to go out for dinner and go a fantastic Japanese takeaway from 2 doors down which I would recommend if you are tired out from all the site seeing! Great, faultless hotel and stay.

title: What a find!
text: My husband , daughter and I stayed here for 10 days in July for her 18th Birthday. We booked before it had even opened so it was a leap of faith, we were not disappointed. The location is excellent, subway, shops, restaurants and attractions are i your doorstep and we walked away r took the subway to everything the city has to offer. The financial area is much quieter at night than uptown where we stayed last year and the comfortable beds meant we had always got a great nights sleep. The attention to detail in the rooms is fantastic and you have everything you need from charging ports to Nespresso machines but in a large anonymous city it is the staff that set it apart. Without exception they were warm and welcoming, knowledgeable and efficient. Thank you, especially Carmello and Michael, to enter the lobby after a long day and have someone smile and say ‘ welcome home’ made our stay very special. Don’t look any further, stay here.

title: Hidden away off Broadway (Don't tell anyone this hotel is a secret to those who have visited!)
text:
Beautiful hotel in a great location for the Business District, the subway and the WTC memorial, and South Street Seaport.
The staff are wonderful, friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are big enough  (very quiet at the back) and the bathroom has a proper shower room!  They have a fridge but no mini bar when I visited so I stocked up on Gatorade and one or two beers!!  The bed is really large and very comfortable and the decor clean and modern.  (for some reason they switched my wardrobe (closet) while I was staying??
They provide water and coffee (that is in the "resort fee they add so it's not actually free).  
They outsource room service that can can order via ipad they provide and it is very quick and a reasonable price (but the menu is not the best).  Breakfast and a proper cup of coffee in the morning is a challenge, the coffee they provide is espresso, I personally like a large americano first thing in the morning and most US hotels provide a coffee pot..  
There is no bar or restaurant so no late cocktail or early breakfast, but hey this is NYC you can get both literally across the street from the hotel.

Pleas keep this wonderful place a secret!  I'll be sure to be back.  Thanks to all the Artezen team

title: Great place, wonderful staff stayed 8 nights with my granddaughter
text:
I took my granddaughter for a "bat mitzvah"  trip to NYC. We choose the Artezen Hotel both because of its location and the great price we got on Expedia. The hotel is opposite the Fulton St subway station which offers a selection of trains to most of the city. For us it was perfect.
   The room was spacious, the bathroom fine with all the toiletries and spare towels there if needed. The shower was good though no bath tub if that is what you want (not us). There was a fridge and coffee machine. We asked for and quickly received a second rack for the suitcases. Elevator service was speedy.
   But the very best part of the already good experience was the STAFF!  They really were wonderful, especially Carmelo, going out of theirway to be friendly even giving my 12 year old a small gift at the parting.
 In addition, my partner (who is writing this), who found and booked the hotel made a mistake and booked us for 8 instead of 9 nights. The Aretez was completely full but quickly found us a room almost literally next door and helped us move. I simply can not recommend it more highly.

title: Bday Celebration
text: I just want to commend Janelle, Michael, Carmello, and Sal. They were extremely helpful and took care of our very need. Shoutout to Michael for getting in touch with his manager to see if we could talk the slippers with us and found out we could! Will be back. Thanks again!

title: BEST HOTEL STAFF IN MANHATTAN!
text: I absolutely love this place. The hotel itself is fab; super clean rooms, nicely appointed bathrooms, crazy-comfy beds and fantastic snacks. For me though, it's the staff that make this place so perfect. Truly, the nicest and kindest hotel staff I have ever come across. They go out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. I've stayed at the Artezen twice and will be staying there for a third time next week. I'm sincerely looking forward to seeing some familiar faces and having what I'm sure will be another excellent stay. Honestly, look no further. This place is the best. (Side note: It's also very close to most subway lines and the PATH train, plus great restaurants within walking distance.)

title: Fabulous
text: I reluctantly chose to stay in the Financial District and decided to secure reservations at the Artezen.  We usually stayed in Times Square or Central Park. We could not be happier with this location and the exceptional service from the front desk. Jenelle and her colleagues were welcoming and provided a very positive impression at check in and the whole team welcomed us daily during our 6 night stay. This is a newer hotel located within a minute walk to a main subway called Fulton station. The subway system was initially daunting and intimidating but we found it easy to navigate and all of the riders were always happy to assist with directions. This hotel offered convenience to attractions like WTC, walkable to Statue of Liberty ferry at Battery Park, walkable to the Brooklyn bridge and some great food! The room was exceptionally clean and reasonably spacious for New York and the King bed was comfortable and air quality excellent. The air conditioning was great and not excessively loud. Being a newer hotel the wifi signal was excellent and the resort fee was reasonable less than 15 bucks and included three bottle of water daily. The elevators were quick and never an issue and ice machine is conveniently located on the forth floor just outside the elevators. We had a nice view, and and look forward to future stays at this great hotel. It is a smaller boutique and most likely the reason for the friendly and personable experience!!

title: Very accomodating Managers, wonderful staff and super modern rooms
text:
We recently stayed at the Artezen hotel for 2 nights as part of a trip to New York. I have to say, I wish we had stayed for longer as this was our favourite hotel of the 4 we stayed in. The location was great- a short walk to all main attractions in lower Manhattan. We had stayed in the East and West previously and really liked downtown and the more relaxed atmosphere. 

We did originally book a Queen Terrace but asked to change rooms as we were a little disappointed at the placement of the terrace. The Managers were extremely helpful and accommodating of our request to change, they couldn't do enough for us. We ended up in a Superior Queen which was an absolutely lovely room, very spacious for New York and new with all modern technologies. Everything was really clean and comfortable. We thought the Ipad was a nice modern touch and the ability to cast from our phones to the TV was great. I would advise requesting a room at the front of the building if possible, as there is more distance with other buildings and a better view. 

The daily coffee and fruit infused water was really nice, as well as the welcome snacks and bottled water. The resorts fee was actually less per day for this hotel than others we had stayed at but you get more for your money. 

All staff we encountered in the hotel were extremely helpful, including doormen, front desk and even the Janitor/cleaner that helped me find the ice machines. The Supervisor on the evenings was also really helpful when we were looking to watch a movie that wasn't yet showing on the 'on demand' section of the TV. 

I would highly recommend this hotel and we will be returning when we stay in New York again.

title: Great Hotel Downtown NYC
text:
This was a great hotel as it just opened a few months ago.  

The staff was quite nice and the room was a decent size especially for NYC and we were a family of 4.  Everything they advertise was true, good linens, good products, a food delivery service menu in the room that was actually good prices.  

The location is right near the subway which can take you where ever you want to go.  This is not my 1st choice of areas to stay but this hotel worked great and I would stay here again while visiting my old lovely city NYC

title: An Absolute Gem
text:
If you’re looking for a hotel that is clean, comfortable, and reasonably priced, this is it. We had two queen sized beds for a price that would normally get you only one at other hotels.

Beds were super comfy. Bathroom was clean with fresh towels every day. Snacks and water were restocked daily. 

The hotel is located near many different train stations. It was very convenient to get around the city. 

More importantly, the staff was amazing. They were very friendly and welcomed you back with a smile each time you returned. 

I highly recommend The Artezen and it would be my hotel of choice for any future visits to NYC.

title: The reviews don’t lie!!!!
text: Thank you so much for the staff and management for giving my family from Spain the best NYC experience they could have imagined. This is why the reviews don’t lie!! Michael from concierge went above and beyond for arranging to get some birthday balloons and cupcakes from nearby stores for my mom’s room once she came back and she was happily surprised. Ashley from front desk was such a doll and let me borrow an iPhone charger so I would be able to charge my phone. Housekeeping has also been such a delight and making sure we were fully stocked with our basic essentials needs. Honestly this hotel and their staff made it feel like home. Thank you Artezen! We will definitely be back!

title: The Artezen made our stay in New York so easy and memoriable.
text: This is en extraordinary hotel! The concierges and staff are 5 star. This was truly a awesome experience being in New York near 911 Memorial and "The Artezen" went above and beyond to make our stay exquisite.  Thank you!!

title: Best hotel for enjoying NYC
text:
Artezen is the best hotel for NYC touring -
-  close to the Fulton Subway Station where you can access most of the subway line and the port to take the water taxi to upper Manhattan, Brooklyn, New Jersey

-  near all types of restaurant - healthy, value, high end, fast food, slow food, Asian, Western 

-  near sights - 9-11 memorial, Wall Street, water taxi, World Trade and via subway to all others

-  near shopping - lots of branded stores and specialty store and supermarket

-  near place of worship.  Numerous Catholic Churches nearby

-  excellent and friendly staff.

The slight feedback is the addition of resort fee for Fiji water which adds up if staying for a week plus.

title: A jewel of a hotel!
text:
We were thrilled to find this lovely hotel in the financial district. Comfortable rooms with a pretty lobby that more importantly offered great service! Special thanks to Giuseppe and to our concierge Carmelo.
I look forward to staying at this hotel the next time I am in NYC!
Location is super convenient to 9 11 Museum.

title: My new fave
text: Great design, well done, with comfort in mind. Comfy bed w ample pillows. Staff was awesome. Ready to please. No breakfast but more than adequate food close by. 2 min walk to train (nice station - Fulton str) had me to my uptown meetings in minutes (better than sitting in an Uber for 40 mins with a big bill). All in all a great, convenient stay in an interesting part of town with landmark buildings all around. A definite “try it”.

title: Pretty darn perfect
text: This hotel is beautiful, and I was amazed at how quiet my room was, given that major construction was happening only a half block away.  I had an amazing night’s sleep, and the staff was lovely and attentive, but not pretentious or in my face.  I am sometimes reluctant to stay in luxury hotels, because some of them charge for absolutely everything, but that was not the case here.  Internet, good snacks, and Fiji water were free, and the towels and bathrobe were luxuriously soft.  The location is also incredibly convenient—all the major subway lines are very close.  If I had to quibble, I’d recommend an accent color other than navy to give the rooms more energy and make them feel less masculine (given the gray and brown background colors, the masculine feel is very strong), as well as a few mini-bar options. I got home late one evening, and would have liked to have a glass of wine without ordering room service.  A hotel bar would also be nice, but presumably there is no room.  As said, though, these are minor quibbles.  I will happily return.

title: Great Hotel! Great Staff!  Great Experience!
text:
My husband and I just spent four nights at the Artezen.  It's a relatively new hotel in the Financial District.  The hotel was great; ALL of the staff were ALWAYS helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to accommodate. No matter who was working the service was superb.  

My husband is Gluten Free so finding restaurants to accommodate his GF intolerance was a little bit of a challenge.  We were accustomed to more restaurants in other parts of the city where we have stayed in the past; however,  it was an easy walk to Battery Park and to Tribeca, where we ate most of our meals.

title: Great hotel
text: I stayed six nights on a recent trip to New York with my husband. Our experience echos the other reviews on this site. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right beside Fulton St subway station, two blocks from 9/11 memorial and Westfield mall, walking distance to Battery Park and the Brooklyn Bridge. The rooms are a comfortable size and new. Bottled water replenished daily was much appreciated and the in-room Nespresso machine. The walk-in shower was also very nice. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate staying here again and would recommend it to anyone travelling to New York.

title: Thrilled to have found this lovely hotel!
text:
The staff are friendly and professional.  I was greeted warmly when I registered.

My room was on the ninth floor and I was very pleased.  The room is small and the queen bed is positioned right up against the window but I was traveling solo so that didn't matter.  The 42 inch TV was a great treat for a political news junkie such as myself.  There's a tiny refrigerator in the room, too!  I like a cold beverage or two while enjoying the room and it was nice to be able to store a few bottles of soda and water.
 
Bed was super comfy with luxurious linens.  The bathroom was spacious and well stocked with towels and toiletries.  Was very happy to see it had a walk in shower.  Always hated the tub/shower combo in hotels.  Who takes a tub bath when traveling?  Nice robes and slippers are provided to slip into after stepping out of the shower.

Room service is provided by a service named Hospitality Butler.  I ordered breakfast online.  Tasty and hot breakfast was quickly delivered within 20 minutes.  The coffee left a lot to be desired but I'm a coffee snob so it's probably just me.  The room has a Nespresso coffee maker.  I prefer regular coffee so didn't use it.  A little disappointed there wasn't a drip coffee maker.

Parking is available on Gold street about a five minute walk down John street.  The hotel will give you a sticker to put on the claim ticket to receive a small discount.  Be aware that Gold street is a narrow almost hidden street.  I drove past it twice before realizing I had to turn down what I thought was an alley.  

This hotel will always be at the top of my list of NYC hotels.  I highly recommend this place.

title: Wonderful service and lovely room!
text: I had such a great stay at The Artezen last week! It’s a small hotel, and I think that contributes to the excellent, personalized service. Every staff member I met was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful (including sending up a wine glass when they noticed I had purchased a bottle of wine to enjoy in my room). The room I stayed in was small (#nyc) but very comfortable - great for a solo traveler or couple. I appreciated the thoughtful touches like welcome snacks, Nespresso maker, and robe and slippers. The bed was luxuriously comfy, and the waterfall shower was sublime! Highly recommend to anyone visiting the Financial District or just wants to get away from the Midtown crowds.

title: Parfait
text:
Accueil excellent ! Sourire et sympathie de l'ensemble du personnel. 
Emplacement idéal ! A deux pas du World Trade Center et du métro. 
La chambre est très bien équipée. TV, Tablette, Port usb..
La literie est très bonne également. Séjour d'une semaine au top !

title: A Gem
text: I almost hesitated to write a review because I want to keep this hotel a secret!! There were 3 couples in our group. The rooms were perfect!! Air conditioning was great! I like it cold!! Location was perfect to catch a subway. The staff were wonderful!! Everyone from the front desk, doorman, consierge were so helpful. This hotel has been my favorite so far with all my visits to the city.

title: Perfekt!
text:
Wir waren eine Woche in diesem Hotel. Und einfach begeistert. Die Lage ist super zentral. Die subwaystation fulton street ist schräg gegenüber und bis zum world Trade Center sind es 5 Minuten zu Fuß. Auch zur Wallstreet ist es nicht viel länger. Die Lage ist also perfekt. Aber auch das Hotel an sich ist wirklich klasse. Es ist sehr neu und das sieht und merkt man auch. Die Zimmer haben für new Yorker Verhältnisse eine gute Größe, ebenso das Badezimmer. Die Ausstattung ist jeweils sehr neu und ansprechend. Ich habe selten in einem Hotel in so einem bequemen Bett geschlafen, allein dafür würde ich 5 Punkte geben. 
Das Personal ist unglaublich freundlich und zuvorkommend! 
Fazit: beim nächsten mal New York werden wir wieder dieses Hotel buchen!

title: Superb find
text:
What a pleasure to be a guest at this little gem.  Away from the hustle of midtown and the throngs of tourists.  The hotel is two blocks from the 911 Memorial and a block away from Cortland St subway.   

Room was spotless , with all the amenities to make for a fab stay.  Room was super quiet , very comfortable and the walk in shower excellent! 

Check in Staff were  super friendly and efficient  , as was the Concierge.

I would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again

title: Outstanding new hotel!
text: I was a little hesitant to try a new hotel with so many unknowns. However, this is the best place we have stayed in a long time. The service is amazing, the rooms are clean & super comfortable, and it’s convenient to so many attractions.  I would highly recommend Artezen!  It’s 5 stars plus!

title: Simplesmente fantástico
text:
Amamos o hotel. Novinho, ótima localização, quarto com tamanho razoável, bem decorado, banheiro bom, ótima ducha. Tem cafeteira Nespresso, com cápsulas cortesia e também garrafinhas de água. Não sei se oferece café da manhã, não contratei, mas eles instalam frigobar no quarto se solicitado e dá para resolver o café manhã por lá mesmo, mas nas imediações há vários locais que servem desjejum com preços razoáveis.
A  equipe do hotel é muito educada e prestativa, concierge, recepcionistas e os porteiros fazem tudo para que você se sinta à vontade, inclusive chegamos 9h da manhã e nos conseguiram um quarto sem cobrança adicional, simplesmente um luxo em NYC!
O hotel está a alguns passos da estação de metrô Fulton Street, que tem linhas para toda a cidade, a uns 200m do memorial do  11/09, Century 21 enorme, Osculus, Broadway Street na esquina, Joe's pizza na outra esquina, Wall Street bem perto, assim como o Battery Park, de onde sai o ferry gratuito para o Brooklyn e os passeios para a Estátua da Liberdade.
Gostei tanto do hotel e da localização que já estou querendo voltar e me hospedar lá de novo!
Ah, o hotel tem um ótimo custo benefício e a antipática resort fee cobrada em NYC é "apenas" 10 dólares, mas vale cada centavo.
O único percalço foi que pedimos o frigobar no quarto desde que fiz a reserva, mas só instalaram no último dia de estada, mas nem ligamos do tanto que todo o resto foi excelente.

title: Correcta elección
text: Nos quedamos 8 días y tuvimos suerte porque recién lo acababan de abrir y los precios, para la zona en la que está, son excelentes. Estás a dos minutos del one World Trade Center y a 3 minutos de Wall Street. Tiene buenos servicios y limpieza pero que no tenga desayuno es un fallo por el q le quitamos una estrella. Es cierto q en la zona hay miles de excelentes cafés pero tienes que salir a buscarte la vida y eso complica la estancia. Tienes room service pero no es lo mismo. También es excelente Carmelo que siempre está dispuesto a ayudarte y aconsejarte. En general y mirando precios de otras zonas , el hotel es excelente.

title: Perfect
text: I'm glad I came across this hotel, as it was really good value in a location that was convenient to the main attractions at the southern tip of Manhatten island and with easy connections to the rest of New York.  The staff were all friendly and helpful, even telling me to ignore the tornado warning that came on my phone when I checked in.  The only issue I had was that the cleaners come round to clean the room a little later in the day compared to other cities I have stayed in, but this was nothing major.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is in a great location with a metro station, sights (9/11 memorial, wall street, etc), and restaurants close by.  Tidy rooms with nice up-to-date amenities.   Employees were very friendly and helpful.  This was our first time in NYC and would definitely stay there again.

title: Superb Location!!!
text: Amazed by the superb location, fulton subway in 2mins, world trade center/ 9/11 memorial, wall street, financial district are all 5 minute walk. Staff were extremely friendly & accomodating to special requests, shoutout to Jay Somera. Will definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Perfect stay
text: My husband and I stayed here from 8th-13th June for our first trip to NYC. We weren’t disappointed- the hotel was wonderful, and such a treat to stay somewhere so fresh and new! Everyone working at the hotel was super friendly and welcoming. It’s ideally situated for exploring the city. If we’re ever back in the city (fingers crossed we will be!), we’ll be sure to stay here again.

title: Fantastic Service, Great Hotel
text: Great hotel with tremendous service! Great experience all around. Carmelo and Janelle are wonderful and made my stay even better. Clean, efficient hotel that makes bouncing around downtown very easy.  Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Perfect Stay
text: We stayed at The Artezen 6/5-6/6 to celebrate my wifes 60th birthday.  Most likely the most pleasant and helpful staff I have ever encountered at any hotel.  It started when we went to check in and received an upgrade to a room with a terrace, without asking for one at no extra charge, very nice.  As stated everything you need is right there, subway hub, breakfast spot, bar, etc all right across the street.  It's a couple of block walk to the Trade Center Memorial, which was beautiful to just sit and reflect early on Thursday morning with coffee.  Between seeing a Broadway matinee, dinner at Delmonico's, which also within walking distance albeit a bit further and this hotel it made for a perfect birthday. Again, kudos to the staff especially the girls at the front desk and the the gentleman who who worked the door as well as luggage check, all genuinely down to earth nice people.  I would highly recommend!

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel in a great location. Staff were very friendly, very helpful and delivered excellent customer service. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on business or pleasure. Great location

title: Most helpful staff!
text: Stayed here because reviews were excellent and price seemed good. From the get go, the staff were all super helpful and kind. I think they are working out some kinks, but their kindness makes up for any bumps. Our room was very clean and comfy. The portable crib we needed was in our room when we arrived and was in perfect condition. It was cool to have Netflix and other streaming available when we chilled in our room after busy days. The patio available with our room was huge and lovely! I visit NYC fairly often but have never stayed in this area. Surely there are pros and cons, but overall we had a wonderful visit due in large part to the comforts of the Artezen Hotel.

title: Amazing hotel, location, staff and the best bed I've slept in years!
text: This amazing hotel was our first choice and we did no wrong! The location is perfect, right around the corner of numerous subway stations, clean rooms, softest sheets and the most comfortable bed, staff is beyond welcoming, helpful and they've always put a smile on your face while exiting and entering the hotel. We had a slight problem with our credit card when we arrived and they handeled the situation very professionally and made us feel calm until resolving the issue. Shoutout to the doormen and everyone on at the reception! The best staff ever!

title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel is wonderful. The location is great, the rooms are incredible. The staff is wonderful. Very close to every sightseeing and subway. The concierge would find you everything that you need. Very convenient in any way.

title: Accogliente, pulito ed in ottima posizione
text:
La nostra camera al quindicesimo piano era un po’ piccola ma assolutamente confortevole.
Quella dei nostri tre amici, con doppio matrimoniale, spaziosa.
La colazione non è compresa ma vi sono locali nella vicinanze (casa Toscana, ad esempio, a venti metri di distanza) che non fanno rimpiangere la cosa.
L’albergo è a pochissimi metri dalle metropolitane e dall’area un tempo occupata dalle torri gemelle.
Bello fare un giro nella zona prima di rincasare.
Personale molto gentile, in particolare Carmelo alla porta.
Ci torneremo

title: Awesome New Boutique Hotel
text:
This is a very new Hotel. ALL of the Staff are amazing, kind and helpful!
The room was elegant with fresh Figi bottled water provided everyday.
It was the best Hotel experience I have had in my many trips to Manhattan
Thank you to everyone there, especially Michael in helping with my Reservation.
Sincerely
Brad

title: Simply Outstanding Hotel
text:
When I first arrived to this hotel it was the second time I visited New York City in over 10 years. This hotel is a diamond tucked away on the historic John Street in the heart of the Financial District. I couldn’t have picked a better place to stay for four night. Everything is centrally located to this hotel and the bonus is that from the moment you walk in you’re treated with 5-star customer service, the rooms are exquisite as this is a brand new hotel and the views literally take your breath away.

Carmelo the concierge made sure my stay was impeccable from things to do, places to see and invaluable information about the city. When you visit ask for him if he doesn’t find you first. The entire staff Michael, Jeanelle, Sal went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and relaxed on my visit. Sure everyone is use to the major chains but this boutique hotel trumps them all. 

Scott Walker the General Manager was extremely personable, friendly and went out of his way before bracing for the rain to take time with me in answering all my questions and concerns. I will definitely give my business to this hotel again and again every time I come to New York City. If you’re wondering where to stay stop guessing and book your reservation. You will end up writing the same review: Simply Outstanding.

title: Amazing hotel
text: The staff were so helpful, the location is so close to the subways, ground zero, Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel itself is very nice, located on a quiet street, the room was fancy. The pictures of the room and lobby weren’t edited to look really nice, what you see is what you get. Highly recommend!

title: Tranquil stay in the city
text: I have stayed at a number hotels in this area before and Artezen is definitely my favourite  The staff were welcoming and helpful throughout and the room was light, stylish and super clean.  The stand out thing for me was the bed, which was extremely comfortable, but there were also lots of nice little touches throughout that gave the place a sense of luxury e.g. a bottle of water on arrival, an iPad for use in the room, good quality toiletries etc. The shower was excellent and I liked that the desk was slightly removed from the main part of the room: good for keeping work separate from rest. The curtains did a great job at blocking out light, the air con worked well and the room was very quiet - all in all a good recipe for a solid night's sleep.  There wasn't a huge amount of storage but there was a small cupboard/wardrobe which was enough for me to hang a few dresses and jackets and there was a room safe for valuables.  I didn't use the gym but i could see it was stocked will all the essentials.  Being so close to Fulton St station makes this a great location for accessing the rest of the city and there are tons of places to eat close-by (i would recommend Nish Nush for falafel fans!).
