If you're looking for somewhere with comfort, style and a chilled vibe then look no further.

title: Elegant Hotel
text: Our Experience could not have been any better, from the moment we walked in the door. We were greeted by two lovely informative young men. Who helped direct us to the parking garage. They also patiently explained our check in options. I was quite honestly blown away at the Decor! It is a Beautiful Modern Hollywood Glamour Style. Everything was done with precision and thought. The girls at the desk were very sweet as well! Our room was beautifully put together, spotless and perfectly detailed! The friendliness of the staff could not have been any better! I highly recommend The Artezen Hotel!

title: Good location, good staff
text: Location is very near with metro, foods around, including best food beside hotel and in front of hotel. There is supermarket near hotel and safe locatin even in night. Staff are very warm welcming guest, very helpfull, good hospitality, especially staff name carmello, that helped me a lot when i stay there about 2 weeks., Wuth direction and help with transport when i went to JFK

title: Divine!
text:
The location is convenient, the staff are super friendly, and the hotel is fabulously unique. My room was the perfect size with beautiful furnishings and very comfortable bedding. There is an iPad in the room, but it doesn’t really do much compared to Citizen M and the Wynn hotels, so that was a little puzzling. 

All of that would have been great but then there’s the little extras... a steamer instead of an iron, Nespresso machine, robe and slippers, luxurious towels! Some rooms also have a private terrace. 

It’s hard being away from family, but this hotel made it easier. I will definitely stay here whenever I’m working from my NYC office.

title: Unassuming Class
text:
Planned a night out during the workweek and decided to stay in the city in lieu of trekking home.
Booked a stay in the Artezen Hotel on John Street and was pleasantly surprised by the staff, ambiance, sundries and decor contained in this boutique type property. 
Upon entering you find a small lobby tastefully decorated and smartly engineered with subdued and comforting lighting. Well mannered front desk staff are most gracious and make your check-in experience effortless and timely. The room I occupied on the 8th floor was thoughtfully designed to make good use of the square footage provided and included a small armoire, desk and chair in addition to a comfortable queen size bed. Above the desk was a wall mounted flat screen TV of good size. On a side of said desk was a coffee/tea maker and 2 bottles of FIJI water. The bathroom was roomy with a good sized walk-in shower and controls that allowed the guest to dial up hot water without restriction (which is something most important to me). The toiletries provided were custom made from CO BIGELOW which was another nice touch akin to the gratis artesian well water. More thoughtfulness as concerns the guest experience is the inclusion of a high quality steamer in lieu of an iron : I was quite impressed how well this apparatus removed wrinkles in addition sanitizing my clothes.
I slept like a baby and was happy with the self regulating thermostat provided hence a guest can set a temperature to their liking.

title: Very enjoyable stay
text:
There is nothing like a brand new hotel! We searched the internet for a new hotel and found the Artezen. Couldn’t have been happier. Tastefully furnished, room spacious enough, heavenly comfortable bed. Very friendly staff, front desk and concierge.
Great location. WTC around the corner. Also Fulton underground with lines to almost everywhere. Loads of food places. Could not have made a better choice. Would stay there again.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: It took us a good couple of months to choose a hotel for our visit to NYC. With so many options it became a big task. My wife found the Artezen Hotel randomly and I’m so glad she did!! We loved everything about the hotel from the private balcony to the super friendly staff, we were completely satisfied. The location was amazing, 2 blocks from World Trade Center, a few blocks from Wall Street, and it was an easy walk to battery park where we caught the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. It’s also across the street from a major subway hub and a pharmacy for any forgotten traveling needs! The bed was super comfy, the google chrome cast was so convenient to watch anything we wanted, and we appreciated all the technology. We plan on staying here for every visit to NYC in the future!

title: Shows promise if they can work out issues
text:
Stayed recently for a few nights. This is a nice hotel, very clean, modern and convenient to financial district, 9/11 memorial, and subway.

Small European-feel hotel with a staff is very friendly and accommodating.

A few issues prevent a five-start rating:

1. Upon checkin, was told that the roof top deck was not yet open. This should be made clear on the hotel website because this was a selling point for us.

2. As another reviewer mentioned, the shower is not intuitive and we, too, were dealing with a cold shower for a few minutes until we figured it out.  The rain head is also located too close to the wall to be at all useful.

3. The alarm clock went off the first night we were there are 3:30 a.m.  Hotel maids should be trained to turn off the alarm clock as part of getting rooms ready between guests.

4. The front desk clerk told us that prices will go up soon once people find out about the property.  This is NOT how to sell your hotel if you expect return customers or good reviews.

title: Excellent Service!
text: Michael did an amazing job arranging a surprise for my parent during their recent stay. He went above and beyond, even staying late to make sure my delivery was received.  Thank you, Michael!   In addition, the manager on duty, Erika, was extremely helpful and very professional.

title: Great new hotel
text: Clean, New, friendly staff. You can tell everyone is trying to go above and beyond to provide excellent service and prove themselves. They offered to go to the store to get me tea because there was only coffee in the room. Great price and recommended. Near lots of subways.

title: Best Hotel!!!
text: The Artezen Hotel was absolutely beautiful. My husband and I stayed there and we loved it. The staff was so friendly, nice and made you feel so comfortable.  The rooms are brand new, clean  and  the bed was very comfortable. Hands down one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.  It’s near plenty of restaurants, pubs, stores, Fulton train station, Freedom tower etc.  Also if anyone is visiting Pace University it’s right by the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, beautiful, clean and convenient.  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: New hotel near WTC sites
text: Stayed here 2 wks ago. approx.  Loved everything about it.  The proximity to the metro at the Occulus means you can ride the subway with your luggage without transfer from near La Guardia and then take a v. short walk (maybe 5 min.) to the Artezen.  The staff has a pleasant and engaging manner to welcome you in.  I would like to see a fresh water dispenser in the lobby so I can fill my water bottle instead of receiving one of the small, free non reusable plastic bottles handed out by the doorman.  The rooms reminded of some European ones.  Max. 6 per floor (makes for quiet) with great floor to ceiling windows.  The shower was reminiscent of Europe too.  Hope they don't raise their rates too much and I can come back in future visits.

title: Great place!
text: The Artezen is a fantastic hotel, located in a great part of town, minute walk to Fulton St station, where you can catch just about any subway in the city.  The staff went out of their way to make this stay memorable, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to visit NYC.  The room with a terrace was very nice and well worth the price.  Overall, this was a 10 out of 10!

title: My new favorite NY hotel
text: I was one of the lucky first guests to stay at the Artezen at the time of their opening. I stayed for a long duration - 9 days - and had the opportunity to get to know the hotel and appreciate all the staff had to offer. My check in was quick and easy, the staff was always courteous when I walked through the lobby (thank you Kenneth!), and the hotel itself was perfect. The rooms are brand new, contemporary, clean, and comfortable. Some rooms inevitably don't have a view, but the interior is so beautiful that I would not even mind. The showers and bath products are amazing, and I looked forward to returning to this extra perk each day. The building has no kitchen/cafe or breakfast, but plenty of restaurants nearby. The Fulton Stop is across the street, and can get you anywhere in Manhattan within half an hour. Overall, this has become my favorite place to stay (and I have been back twice in the last month!)

title: So nice!!
text:
I stayed at The Artezen for two nights for a girls trip with two of my best friends. Before we even got into the room, we were greeted at the door with the best concierge. Carmelo was the best. He went out of his way to make sure we knew all of the spots to hit while traveling in New York. We told him where we wanted to go and he gave us ideas. He really went out of his way to make our trip great. 
About the room...the room was so nice. Clean and tidy. No issues at all. The hotel is across the street froM an Irish American pub. After looking out our window and seeing its popularity we decided to go there. So fun and convenient since our hotel was right across the street. The front desk employees were so nice. Anytime we called to ask for something they came within a good amount of time. I would definitely recommend this hotel for convenient. It was also across the street from the subway.  Perfect for us. I would stay here again!

title: Perfect Hotel!
text:
Stayed here during Easter weekend. Arrive Saturday morning and left Tuesday morning. They were awesome to hold our bags since we arrived before check in. What was also a bonus is they were kind enough to lend us an umbrella to use while we were there since I did not pack one!
This place was so convenient to the subway! Literally half way down the block was the subway station and since we were just a block away from Wold Trade Memorial it had a lot of the major subways there! Honestly best part of this place! The walls were quite thin I will say. We were able to here our neighbors conversation and if anyone used the ice machine. But other than that this place was perfect! Definitely a great place for when you want to roam around the city and use the subway.

title: Loved my stay!
text:
Great place and great value!
The Artezen Hotel is located less than a block from most of the major train stations therefore its easy commuting back and forth from the hotel.
The rooms were clean and had more perks than expected.
The staff was very friendly and helpful too, I would definitely go back!

title: Great location - Great Staff!
text: This brand new property did not disappoint!  Beautiful decor, high tech rooms, amazing amenities - CO Bigelow toiletries, an IPad in the room, a clothes steamer and more!  Room was on the smaller side, but perfectly appointed.  The staff was the highlight of my stay from checking in with Mack and having service with a smile at 1am from Genko to Angelo helping me with transportation and more.  I was greeted with a big smile and an offer of assistance every single time I entered the door.  They were genuinely interested in serving their guests.  Such a refreshing treat!  I will be back if I find myself in NYC again soon!

title: Latrice
text: My teenage daughter and I were EXTREMELY satisfied with the hotel and staff. Our room was super clean, cozy, and quiet! The housekeeping staff were so polite and accommodating. We didn’t want to leave! We rhighly recommend the Artezen and we’ll be returning for another stay in July. KEEP UP THE GREAT SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS!

title: Great Find
text: I usually stay in Times Square area. But wanted a new place to explore. Found the Artezen on Expedia and was glad I did. Clean and comfortable and spacious for NYC standards we even had our own terrace. The front desk staff was kind and courteous and Sal the doorman was excellent and helpful. Everyone made us feel welcome. Would definitely recommend and would like to return.

title: Vacation
text: We just got back from a 2 night stay.  We couldn’t of asked for a better place to stay.  Beautifully decorated and clean.  I can’t say more about the front desk/door staff.  They were WONDERFUL.  We will be back for sure!!!!!!  The whole area has so much to do, shop and eat.  The train station is literally at the corner of the street.

title: Restful stay in new hotel!
text: We initially had a large ADA compliant room on the 4th floor, street side which was good size, but connecting and our neighbors were loud. The front desk was nice enough to move us up to the 16th floor on the backside of the hotel. The room was smaller but I really liked it (1605). I slept so well. It was quiet. We even slept with the windows open. The hotel is brand new, super clean, staff is eager to serve, and the in-room amenities are quite nice. The biggest problem was parking. Initially we were not told that the street was completely torn up in front of the hotel so that we couldn't drop off our bags. Then when we were given information about the parking garage and driving around all the one-way streets, the garage was full. We weren't given the option for another garage as the staff told us when we finally arrived at the hotel. Thankfully, we have the Spothero app. We should have just used this from the beginning. Again, this was the only negative. Everything else was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great! highly recomanded
text: Brand new hotel. We really enjoyed our stay. Beds were very comfortable. All the staff is helpful and kind. Specially Michael from frontdesk and the door man.We’ve been with family and we’ll choose this hotel next time for sure. Thank you for all.

title: Gorgeous hotel, wonderful stay!
text: This is a stunning little gem, with kind staff, brand new rooms, and wonderful amenities. It had all that I needed for a quick work trip, was around the corner from my office, and the staff made the entire process seamless and lovely. Highly recommended!

title: A gem in the heart of Downtown NY
text: This is my new home in NY. Lovely staff, very comfortable beds and delicious linens and towels. Perfect location. The staff was incredibly helpful and made sure to accommodate nay request I made. A keeper!

title: Impressive hotel!
text:
We stayed in a Standard King room at the Artezen Hotel in the Financial District from April 5-8th.  We arrived at 1:00pm but our room was ready, and the let us check in early.  We were assigned a room on the 14th floor, overlooking John Street.  Even though there was road construction going on, our room was quiet.  The 14th floor hallway is a little dark, painted a warm gray, but the rooms are nicely spaced, which was appreciated.  

Our room was a bit small for two people, but it is well laid out, with plenty of outlets, and it worked fine for us.  We asked for a refrigerator to be brought to the room, and that fit easily under the desk.  The hotel leaves chips and cookies along with bottled water each day, which was much appreciated!  There is also a Nespresso Coffee masker, if you like that type of coffee.  We were not fans, but found a lovely coffee shop just a few doors down and on the way to the subway.

The TV was huge, and internet was included in the room. Using your Artezen access code, you can also watch Netflix, Hulu, You Tube, etc on the TV.  That worked out great for us!

The bathroom is roomy, with tiled floors and shower.  The shower has a wand and an overhead rain shower which is awesome for taller people.  The room was stocked with soft fluffy towels, and a bathrobe and slippers.  They leave shampoo and conditioner, lotion, shower gel, bar soap, and mouthwash in the bathroom for your use.  If you are traveling for business, there is also a steamer in the closet to freshen up your clothing.

We loved the proximity to the subway, and the many options for trains from The Fulton Center and the Oculus.  These two stations are also connected underground, which was very helpful in the rain!  Both areas also have access to shopping and restaurants as well.  Just take a left when you leave the hotel and the subway is a half block away.

The rooftop bar was not yet opened, and we did not check out the fitness center.  However, we were very impressed with the staff as well as with the amenities in our room.  The only thing I would change is to place a mirror on the wall outside the bathroom.  That would have been a big help getting ready in the morning.  We liked the communication system with housekeeping, and found that staff to be very helpful as well.  

Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

title: Birthday Trip
text: I recently celebrated my birthday in NYC and stayed at the Artezen Hotel. The hotel is gorgeous and very clean. It’s located in lower Manhattan, minutes away from the World Trade Center. The staff is amazing... very friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable. They helped with transportation questions, food suggestions and navigating through the city. They made my stay in the city that much better!

title: Superb location
text: First trip to NY for me and my 16 year old daughter. I knew very little of this hotel but the price and location looked great so I took a chance. Very glad I did. Front desk staff excellent and door men extremely helpful. Room was the size of any typical hotel (not tiny like other NY hotels I've heard about). 9/11 memorial about two blocks away, subway entrances within a block in both directions, plenty of food options nearby. Free water and snacks were provided in the room. I guess my only real "complaint" is that there was no regular coffee available. I don't care for espresso. But there is a Starbucks just around the block so I managed. If I return to NY again I will stay here  for sure. We checked out on time but our flight wasn't until later in the day and the door guy stored our luggage for us while we went out walking around. Other than not having regular coffee it was a perfect stay.

title: Stunning hotel!
text: The Artezen Hotel is an amazing property. I had a 2 night stay and was highly impressed by the well appointed rooms, the attention to detail, and the staff. I enjoyed staying in this property. It’s centrally located in the financial district. It’s across the street from a subway station which makes it easy to get uptown, downtown, or to Brooklyn. By New York standards the rooms are nicely sized. I can’t say enough good things about this property. Give it a try!!!!

title: Diamond in the rough
text: Neighborhood looked a little worn but this hotel shines! The most friendly and helpful staff! Carmelo and Michael were super helpful, as was everyone there. One block from Fulton Street subway. Super quiet. Beautifully appointed room, comfortable bed, Linens and towels. Complimentary water and coffee in your room each day. Would definitely use this hotel again.

title: Fantastic stay with the hotel!
text: Artezen was the first hotel on my first visit to NYC. Carmelo opened the door for us giving us a very good welcome to the city and this extremely warmed our hearts in the cool and tiring morning after a 19-hour long flight! The hotel staff were always attentive, smiling and checking if we were in need of help. The room was cosy and well equipped, the complimentary mini bar and Nepresso coffee were absolutely many plus points! If I ever come back to NYC again, Artezen will definitely my first choice! Thank you team :)

title: Amazing stay!!
text: very nice hotel with super friendly service. i stayed there a week and had a awesome experience at this hotel. all other hotels need to take note on how to treat their customers. They also gave me help with tour guides, saving money with tours etc. i will definitely stay at this hotel again. it is 1 block away from the world trade center and memorial. lots of great stores near by etc. i want to say thanks to all of the staff for being honest and friendly.

title: Beautiful Hotel!
text: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was absolutely gorgeous and the staff went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. It is reasonably priced and in a great location. We will definitely be staying there again soon!

title: Amazing service and comfy
text: I will admit I was slightly skeptical because I had never stayed here and frankly the price was very affordable for the location. I was so pleasantly surprised! The staff was all so lovely upon my arrival all the way through checkout. The room is luxurious with a comfy bed, Frette linens and a plush robe with slippers. There are even free snacks and water. I can not recommend this hotel enough and I will absolutely be back! Their rooftop is undergoing renovations but it looks like it will be amazing.

title: We loved our stay! We will definitely return!
text: I enjoyed the experience of the hotel the terrance was nice and beautiful. The yoga room and weight room was nice and fully stocked. Angel the doorman was amazing. I also had a male front desk guy that brought my food to my room from door dash because he didn’t want me to leave the comfort of my room (overnight shift April 5). The shower head was amazing lol! The room was stocked with snacks and Fiji water and refilled daily (amazing). Hotel was very clean and quiet. Front desk crew guys were very nice and friendly. Never felt ignored always greeted. On the downside the internet did not work in the room and the cable went in and out the entire stay. The lounge isn’t open yet so there wasn’t any breakfast. Not a huge issue as we weren’t in our rooms that much. And the staff made up for what was missing. Hotel is near a lot of restaurants and perfect location from subway.

title: Fantastic place!
text: Came on a trip with a few friends this week and booked the place because it looked close to everything downtown. Wow! It is brand new. Boutique feel for sure. Beds were so comfortable and there was an espresso machine in my room. For the price it can’t be beat. The staff was great! Can’t get over how nice it was for the price. Definitely will be coming back!

title: Perfektes Hotel für einen Städte Trip, würde auf jeden Fall wieder kommen
text:
Das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wünschenswert wäre eine bessere Kommunikation zwischen den verschiedenen Schichten (Frühschicht/ Tagschicht und Nachtschicht). Dies, weil einige Dinge vergessen gingen. Jedoch war das Personal sehr darum bemüht alles wieder in Ordnung zu bringen.
Ich würde auf jeden Fall wieder kommen.
Auch die Lage war Perfekt.

title: 5 Stars!
text: I frequently  passed this hotel while it was under construction and  I was looking forward to its opening.     I had the opportunity to stay there last night  and  I absolutely love this place!    The hotel is brand new, has spacious rooms,  is centrally located,  and the price was very reasonable.  They even offer complimentary wifi, Fiji water, and espresso in the rooms.   This will definitely be my new home when I’m  doing business in NYC.

title: Well Done!!!
text: What a great experience! Brand new, grand opening week, gorgeous decor! Staff was on point, every detail was thought of. My only regret was trip was too short, coming back with the family in the summer to see the 9/11 memorial,  i will defiantly be repeat customer!

title: Absolutely Gorgeous
text: Bravo Artezen Hotel, what a fantastic hotel to stay at.  This hotel is beautiful, from the decor to the staff one can tell that they run a fantastic operation.  The rooms are gorgeous, the location is phenomenal and the staff is extremely attentive and helpful.  I must say, I am really impressed and I will surely stay at The Artezen hotel in the future.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel
text: Really beautiful boutique hotel in a very convenient location. Breakfast was fantastic and having a bathrobe was a nice added bonus. Train across the street makes getting around super easy. Easy walk to the 9/11 memorial and ferry to statue of liberty. Prices were also very reasonable and much lower compared to others.
